An injury at work left a husband and father facing a layoff. He couldn't return to the job until his hand healed from surgery, but recovery was complicated by an ongoing struggle with diabetes. With two children in the home, the family saved enough to pay the power bill. Unfortunately, that left very little money for rent. The Clarke County School District contacted the Empty Stocking Fund for help on the family's behalf. A check was written for a portion of the rent in an effort to keep the family in their home.

Four detection stations throughout the Large Hadron Collider will help gather huge amounts of information about what happens during each collision, possibly revealing new information about the basic makeup of the universe. Today was perhaps the most exciting day in a more than a decade for scientists and science lovers around the world. Not since the comet Shoemaker-Levy 9 broke into fragments and collided with Jupiter in 1994 has there been as much news and excitement over a single event in the scientific community. Rather than corresponding to a massive, cosmic event, today’s news focused on the sub-atomic level.

Cryptocurrencies , outside of Bitcoin , have failed to garner much attention from buyers , and while the same can  not be said for Litecoin

Recently Litecoin has seen some spectacular rises in value that have caught investors’ eye, especially because it features features similar to Bitcoin in a different package. Cryptoanalysts argue that Litecoin’s Proof-of-Work protocol produces blocks faster and they praise the transaction capacity improvements over time, so the risk of overburdening has been removed. Moreover, recent SegWit Integration, Beam technology and lower transaction costs along with Litecoin's' velocity of circulating in wallets also make it desirable for crypto enthusiasts.

The proxy owner and publicity officer of a private event-organising company, who were arrested on charges of organising the Wadduwa beach party where four people died, were today remanded till August 17 by Panadura Additional Magistrate Kalhari Liyanage. The suspects, Amila Pushpakumara and Eranda Danthanarayana were produced in Court by the Wadduwa Police Crime Branch Sub Inspector K.A.S.W. Sugath. Submitting the report on the police investigations, he said the Government Analyst and Assistant Government Analyst visited the hotel and conducted investigations. SI Sigath said the police also carried out an investigation into the tragedy that occurred at the beach party on August 4 attended by some 2,000 people.

FERGUSON, MO (KPLR) - The crisis in Ferguson has left residents on edge, especially the elderly and the disabled. Many are afraid to leave their homes to go to doctor's appointments and to the grocery store. Representative from Better Family Life set up a tent at Canfield Green Apartment, where 18-year-old Michael Brown was shot and killed by Ferguson Police Officer Darren Wilson more than a week ago. Representatives are offering free blood pressure checks, food, diapers, toiletries, and school supplies to residents in need. They are also providing financial assistance to those who need to buy medications.

New Jersey hits day three of its government shutdown Monday over a budget stalemate that's closed state parks — and will likely force the furlough of 35,000 workers. On Sunday, the impasse even inconvenienced Gov. Chris Christie, forcing him to leave a state beach that was on shutdown to the public — but open to his family — because he had to return to Trenton. All nonessential services remained closed as the Republican governor and the Democratic Assembly speaker continued to disagree over Christie's plan for a nonprofit health system that is at the center of the budget dispute.

HIGH POINT, N.C. — A dentist lost her license after two patients died, according to a Final Agency Decision report from the North Carolina Board of Dental Examiners. Shawana Neopi Patterson, who was first licensed in 2011, was an oral and maxillofacial surgeon at her practice Patterson Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery in High Point. In one instance, the report found that Patterson took little action when one patient turned "bluish-gray," and only called EMS for a second patient once she had no pulse. The report revealed two cases in which patients provided medical histories that indicated they should have only undergone surgery under emergencies.

This article was published 28/8/2009 ( 3522 days ago ) , so information in it may no longer be current 

28/8/2009 (3522 days ago) marks a day in which much has changed since then, particularly in regards to scientific research and technological advances. Many discoveries have been made and newer methods and tools have emerged as a result. Smart phones, computer technology, even drone warfare, can all be dated to within the last 10 years. More incredible developments may lie ahead that no one is expecting. As much progress as has been made so far, this rate is likely to accelerate even more in the upcoming years.

SAN BERNARDINO – In recognition of his great aunt , San Bernardino Valley College art instructor David Rosales constructed an  artistic bridge on campus that unites East Valley College's dormitory and dining hall. Rosales made sure that the design and materials that went into the bridge’s construction perfectly reflected the love his late great aunt had for San Bernardino Valley College. His uncle Juan assisted with construction, gathering many donations from local businesses in order to finance the project. Rosales believes the bridge serves a larger purpose than his individual recognition of his late relative, that of further integrating students living and learning experiences together.

Following a team of international scientists , this film exclusively documents an archeological sensation : the exploration of royal tombs  located in a remote mountain near Vichama

The researchers cautiously opened two heavy stone doors leading to two rock cut tombs behind, one of them 25m deep. Although certain surfaces were badly eroded from tropical rainfall and small tremors,the objects found were otherwise undamaged. Exciting artefacts such as jewel encrusted alabaster sculptures, historical vessels and food containers,fertilisers, feathered and fibrous regalia, complemented by hieroglyphic icons on the tombs's walls reveal new information about the enigmatic high-cultured Andean inhabitants.

To most NBA experts , players and fans , Kobe Bryant is one of the top 20 best players of  all time. Following his retirement announcement, the city of Los Angeles is paying tribute to Bryant in a major way. Events celebrating the career of the 18-time All-Star include t-shirts, massive billboards of his famous portrait as well as a motion picture project released on Twitter. Thousands gathered in Lakers official gear near Staples Center Sunday in respect of his 20-year career that showcased countless jaw dropping moments in the League’s record book.

TOPEKA ( AP ) - A bill that would rescind restrictions on the development of private property near historical sites  in Kansas received overwhelming bipartisan support Wednesday in the Senate. The bill that passed 33-7 expands a state-run program aimed at recognizing sites with national or regional significance, designed to protect private development within a 2,000 foot radius. While historic sites like battlefields will continue to be protected, homeowners in the state’s 24 historical preservation districts are now exempt from burdensome regulations on structure heights, uses, and environmental quality control plans.

Shares in Premier Foods shot up five per cent earlier today after the Mr Kipling and Hovis group said it  expected to achieve market growth expectations this year

Shares rose further in the hours since Premier Foods had also confirmed it planned to introduce new brands and flavours over the next several months. This is in line with the firm’s new focus on innovation and experimentation, an element to the turnaround strategy CEO Alex Whitehouse wants to prioritize this year. Investors and customers seem optimistic about what the future of the group will hold, with the excitement further pushing Premier’s stock to gains unseen in the past three months.

In a study from 24/7 Wall Street , Leelanau County was named Michigan 's most expensive housing market with a  median home value of $304,700. The high cost of living can be attributed to numerous factors. Some are the upscale homes found in resorts and other vacation-like neighborhoods; others include infrastructure development in various forms like the renovation of Michigan's highways, improvements to education and amenities; and recreational opportunities that exist from places such as Glen Arbor and Leelanau County's National Lakeshore, featuring marinas and access to popular beaches and campgrounds.

The Brother MFC-J775DW is a low-priced inkjet with very low running costs and a basic feature set for a home-office  multifunction. It offers Wi-Fi, Ethernet and Bluetooth connectivity, as well as fax functions. This easy-to-use device produces both a good quality black & white as well as color copies, printouts and scans at an economical speed. The three separate paper trays come in handy if you often make different media or need to get it in many papers to finish. Ink consumption is very low which helps the total cost of ownership.

Perthyn Belonging has an opportunity for a Support Worker to join our team based in Cardiff. Joining us on a full or part time basis, you will receive a competitive salary of £7.86 to £8.29 per hour. The organisation is a large not-for-profit charity who provide support to people with learning disabilities in England and Wales. We deliver person-centred services, encouraging individuals to live as independently as possible within their home and community. Are you an enthusiastic, able to use your initiative, have good problem-solving skills, wanting to make a difference to people’s lives?

The J. C. Penney Company, the fourth-largest United States retailer, said today that September sales at stores open at least a year were falling short of expectations, prompting several analysts to cut fiscal third-quarter earnings estimates. Warm weather and consumer concerns about the decline in United States stock markets hurt sales of clothes, notebooks and other back-to- school products, retailer analysts said. J. C. Penney's same-store sales may decline as much as 5 percent this month, they said. The company's goal was to increase sales as much as 4 percent.

Running errands on your bicycle is a great way to burn calories and get some exercise . When you need  to stock up on groceries or go to the store, this can become part of your exercise routine. This also has environmental benefits - when running errands, opting to cycle instead of drive keeps CO2 emissions down and contributes to healthier air quality. Cities across the world are investing in bicycle-sharing programmes and initiatives in order to make running errands more feasible by bicycle. Often times, the slower speed of travelling by bike affords the added advantage of giving you time to stop and take in the beauty around you.

The movement is a global phenomenon – but here it has stalled before even getting started. RIDESHARING SERVICES WHICH supporters claim could spare Irish cities from gridlock are being effectively locked out of the country on the grounds of breaking taxi laws. Transport officials have recently questioned one of the industry’s newest entrants, a carpooling app backed by entrepreneur and Dragon’s Den investor Sean O’Sullivan, on how it fits within rules that have already seen similar operators abandon the market. But Cork-based startup Carma Carpooling claims it is only promoting the kind of ridesharing setups neighbours and colleagues have been doing for decades.

The proposal that foreign powers acquire land in Africa to stem migration is nothing but 'hipster' colonialism. Last week, Germany's Africa Commissioner Gunter Nooke said that European countries should be allowed to lease land and to build and run cities in Africa as a means of stemming what he views as the unchecked expansion of migration from Africa to Europe. For Nooke, allowing the "free development" of these areas would stimulate African economies and create "growth and prosperity" and therefore, reduce the attractiveness of Europe as a destination for migration. The proposal has elicited mixed reactions.

Technology ’ s continuing onslaught , and employees ’ responses to it , will be central issues for the American  workforce and government. Since technology has transformed how jobs are performed and structured, Americans face a dramatic shift in job dynamics. Already, studies have suggested that jobs in retail, customer service, and technology could become completely automated within the next twenty years. Employers could potentially be taking away more stable employment opportunities. To mitigate this outcome, companies, governmental entities, and other stakeholders must come together to reassess regulations and compensation programs to protect employees’ welfare, career aspirations and pensions.

CINCINNATI -- As FC Cincinnati fans chanted and cheered for taxpayers to help fund a Major League Soccer stadium ,  city officials made a move to answer the call. Citing fan passion, City Council unanimously passed an ordinance on Wednesday that allows it to place a proposed sales-tax increment financing plan before Hamilton County voters. Supporters will have a little over two months to prepare and organize in time for a March ballot that seeks approval of a half-percent tax on restaurant purchases in Hamilton County to build the $250 million facility. While approval is far from guaranteed, local government leaders expressed eagerness to put their plans before the community.

No doubt if you are into painting of the artistic kind then you will probably know that artist Thomas Kinkade  has sadly passed away. Known by many as “the Painter of Light”, Kinkade’s ability to create sweeping views of tranquil mountains, villages and countryside earned him the title of the most widely collected living artist in the United States. His often softly coloured prints used strong luminescence that generated scenes from home in ordinary households all around America. Kinkade’s immense success spurred controversy throughout the art world, where such romanticised motifs were thought to undermine standards for contemporary artistic expression.

The police have uncovered Class A drugs after using its powers of stop-and-search in Central Park . Arrests were made  for suspected possession of illegal substances. Police further deployed its covert teams which eventually located dealers attempting to deliver large volumes of drugs within the Park. Using smart technology and multiple inquiries of footage across Central Park, authorities pinpointed a car suspected of harbouring narcotics and upon interception conducted a successful drug search which unearthed large doses of Class A drugs. Additional sources later indicated that drugs had been produced elsewhere in order to boost its availability within the Park.

The University of Arkansas at Fort Smith recently told student Jennifer Braly that she was prohibited from giving lectures about being transgender to classes on campus, despite the fact that faculty were eager to feature her presentations. Braly suspected it was because she had sued the school for other forms of discrimination she faced. This week, the university reversed its policy restricting Braly to gender-neutral bathrooms after the Department of Justice sent a letter on her behalf. Trans students will now be able to use the bathroom corresponding to the gender with which they identify.

The Brexit crowd refused to believe the experts in the run-up to the referendum vote . The warnings from every  major financial institution in Europe and from a significant section of businesses, that leaving the European Union would cause significant economic harm, had gone unheeded by the British people. However, once the UK did decide to leave, the experts' dire predictions began to come true. Just as they had feared, UK stocks plunged significantly as soon as the vote was announced, resulting in dramatic losses for both big investors and everyday British citizens.

To most NBA experts, players and fans, Kobe Bryant is one of the top 20 best players of all time and one of the top five guards the league has ever produced. To some, he is second only to Michael Jordan and to a third, out there, group he is the best of all time. To get the first group of people to consider agreeing with the second (I leave out the third because nobody seriously believes that is ever possible), Kobe Bryant has to lead the Los Angeles Lakers to a championship this season.

The eight-episode 1980s-set drama will air in the summer. Mere weeks after finishing production on the pilot and securing a series order, the cast and creators of Ryan Murphy's newest FX drama, Pose, met reporters Friday at the Television Critics Association's winter press tour where they touted the realness of the drama that explores the ball culture. Pose looks at the juxtaposition of several segments of life and society in 1980s New York: the rise of the luxury Trump-era universe, the downtown social and literary scene, and the ball culture world.

Herbert Davis and MRA are looking to get back to the title game after failing to do so for the  past two years. The pair of coaches have implemented some creative ideas, looking to rejuvenate the squad to be back in form. Herbert Davis changed the team's playing style to a faster and more precise form of football. During off-season, he worked with players to increase the mental capacity and strength to perfect their play-making ability. On the other hand, MRA worked with them physically, teaching them different aspects of ball handling and movement during exercises.

Will an upcoming vote in Congress signal the end of Medicare? In the next few weeks Congress will decide whether to cut $54 billion in overpayments to Medicare insurers, igniting a battle that may well determine whether the program survives. On one side are Medicare supporters, who want it to continue as a successful social insurance program. On the other is the insurance industry, which is spending millions and lobbying hard to put Medicare on a fast track to privatization, a goal long sought by fiscal conservatives and their allies in right-wing think tanks.

In 1890, a group of eight large New York City bakeries combined to form the New York Biscuit Company and built a giant six-story factory in West Chelsea. Eight years later, they merged with their competitor, Chicago's American Biscuit and Manufacturing to form an even larger conglomerate – the National Biscuit Company, but the factory and headquarters remained in Chelsea. In 1901, the National Biscuit Company put their abbreviated company name on a box of wafers for the first time – Nabisco. Soon, Nabisco became the company's official name.

Salad may be an overlooked part of the holiday meal, but it doesn’t have to be that way, thanks to this beautiful salad that’s robust enough to stand up to the rest of the meal. Wrap each beet in foil and set on a rimmed baking sheet. Roast for 50 to 60 minutes, or until tender when pierced with a paring knife. Set aside to cool for 15 minutes. While the beets cool, increase the oven to broil. Arrange the citrus segments in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet, then sprinkle with the brown sugar.

They concluded that much of the corruption was carried out at local precincts, some of which failed to provide secure ballot boxes and minimal safety checks to voters. On top of this, it was found that in some areas government officials and ruling party operatives actually were complicit in rigging or promoting the buying and selling of votes.

This is n't just a museum ; in 2005 , the Knesset ( Israel 's parliament ) passed a law  enshrining it as the country's official national park , dedicated to protecting the landmark's unique ecological, geological and archaeological value. In 2018 the law was upgraded, in light of findings about a once secret World War 2 airbase on the western slopes of Masada and various habitats present on the site. Uncovering new ecosystems to uncover or surveys looking for existing flora and fauna – much work is taking place on the project’s five main research components, including astronomy and wildlife corridors.

The best retirement financial advice you can get might be to get more sleep . That is the provocative implication  of new research from the Rand Corporation, which studied 10,000 respondents over two decades

Researchers found that people who slept an average of seven or eight hours were better at taking action on advice that involved their retirement accounts. They reported less anxiety and stress than those who slept five hours or less. Plus, seven to eight hours of sleepers maintained a more consistent pattern of saving. Getting enough sleep allowed individuals to feel better prepared and more capable to do retirement-specific tasks.

In Atlanta This Weekend? Then You Should Be At Momocon. Anime and gaming convention Momocon is on day three of it’s newly extended four-day run, which leaves plenty of time to check out some cosplay, buy some vintage video games and maybe watch a Kotaku writer judge an indie game contest. When I first attended Momocon back in 2010, it was an incredibly small convention held on the campus of Georgia Tech. Now it’s a massive event spanning multiple locations—the Omni Hotel, the Georgia World Congress Center, the Georgia World Congress Center’s tiny bathrooms—with more than 20,00o people expected to attend.

Until further guidance is issued , USCIS is temporarily applying interim procedures to H-1B non-profit entity petitions filed with the  I-129, Nonimmigrant Worker form

USCIS is actively working to create new final guidance to follow interim procedures that includes broader acceptances and relaxes in evidence submissions of " affiliation ". While developing the guidance, USCIS requests parties not to initiate any form requests or non-frivolous denials until USCIS establishes final protocols for petitions filed with the I-129 form for non-profits. To improve service, USCIS anticipates a standard processing time of 15-21 days with emergency- processed in up to seven calendar days.

SHAH ALAM (THE STAR/ASIA NEWS NETWORK) - The High Court in Shah Alam has rejected a bid to block the relocation of the Seafield Sri Maha Mariamman Temple in USJ 25 that was at the centre of riots earlier this week. Three individuals acting as the administrators of the temple filed an application at the Shah Alam High Court on Thursday (Nov 29) to strike out the eviction order. However, the High Court dismissed the injunction against a 2014 consent judgment ordering the temple to be relocated. Lawyer S. Morgan, representing plaintiff Thangaraju Sundarajoo, told reporters that the court refused to allow the temple to stay.

The Australian telecommunications (telco) industry is largely responsible for the highly connected and digital world we live in today. Their networks and services have fostered professional work environments and have brought together family and friends amidst Australia’s vast distances, and remote global position. But to continue doing so at an ever-changing pace, telco providers must accelerate their digital revolution. In fact Accenture, in collaboration with the World Economic Forum, has estimated that digitalisation could contribute approximately $100 trillion in value to the telecommunications industry over the next decade globally. Australian telecommunications operators have long maintained vast networks, held together by complex infrastructure.

ST. PAUL -- Minnesota Wild General Manager Paul Fenton today announced the National Hockey League (NHL) club has signed forward Matt Read to a one-year, two-way contract ($650,000/$200,000). Read, 32, collected 16 points (7-9=16) and eight penalty minutes (PIM) in 33 games with Lehigh Valley in the American Hockey League (AHL) and scored one goal in 19 games with Philadelphia in 2017-18. The 5-foot-10, 185-pound native of Ilderton, Ont., collected two points (1-1=2) and four PIM appearing in all six Stanley Cup playoff contests with the Flyers.

Abby Kelley has 1,426 students in kindergarten through high school this year and is at maximum enrollment . A new  multi-year expansion and renovation project has just been launched in order to accommodate more students. The first step in this project will be the building of a 5,800-square-foot expansion which will provide three additional classrooms and additional needed storage spaces. New windows, ceiling, plumbing and restroom renovations, as well as new flooring, a computer laboratory and improvements to student hallways will be included as well. Once construction is complete, students and staff can take advantage of additional program opportunities.

Plushenko’s glorious career was finished. He had hoped to cap it at home after a comeback from spinal surgery, which he did, partially, by helping Russia win the team competition. But his 31-year-old back, after all those years of wrenching revolutions and hard landings, gave out two nights too soon. In essence, Plushenko sacrificed his chance at another individual medal to put his country on top. He was a longshot for gold, but in a sport of sequins and stuffed animals, he brought pugnacious sizzle. He was the James Cagney of the ice.

GoldMoney founder James Turk interviews When Money Dies author Adam Fergusson , who discusses the parallels and differences between the  post-WWI economic upheaval in Germany and present-day American

Fergusson acknowledges similarities in their borrowing behavior and general destabilization of prices, such as overproducing low cost commodities. One important difference he identifies is today’s purchasing power losses more significantly affect savings instead of wages, where in the Germany crisis it was a sharp deflationary collapse. Turk points out the implications of less centrally planned fiat economies that more than 100 years later seem headed for a dangerous recurrence.

Sen. Cory Booker, the New Jersey Democrat who’s launched a bid for the White House in 2020, is reportedly dating actress Rosario Dawson. Dawson shared the news with TMZ on Thursday when they caught up with her at a Washington D.C.-area airport. The outlet shared a video of the encounter, during which the reporter noted that Dawson had been frequently visiting the nation’s capital and had “been hanging out with” Booker. The actress kept fairly mum on whether the pair was headed toward an engagement but offered an optimistic note on their relationship.

An injury at work left a husband and father facing a layoff . He could n't return to the job  he loved. The injured man tried to make the best of it, eventually enrolling in classes to become a plumber. While waiting for his career path to turn around, he used every moment to spend with his children, support his family and strive to make their home a sanctuary. Although he wished he could be the breadwinner like he was before the accident, he still wanted to make the most of each day with his family.

The casino chain 's stock moved higher as the company announced new expansion plans . A rendering of Paradise Park  Casino was unveiled in conjunction with the announcement. Consol Energy was a winner within the metals & mining industry , rising 99 cents ( 3.1 % ) to  end at $ 32.64 in Monday’s trading . Evo Morales , Bolivia 's president-elect , fresh from meetings with the leaders of Cuba and Venezuela , says that  Bolivia is committed to an 'Anti-Imperialist Alliance' which

Morales went on to announce that this new alliance will give the countries in question the opportunity to join together and look at shared cultural and social programmes. BATON ROUGE—Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin is warning voters to be aware of who they discuss their private information with . Secretary Ardoin cautions that individuals running voter registration drives have started asking citizens for passwords to websites that people use, like Facebook and Google, to make the voter registration process quicker. He warned that, if someone is asked for such passwords, that is an indication of an illegitimate voter registration drive. Ardoin suggested people either leave the voter registration drives and sign up for an application on their own or only give the information necessary to properly fill out a voter registration application.

The feud between California and the Trump administration grows as the president visits the California-Mexico border to inspect wall prototypes. Fast bowler Matt Hobden has been tipped for a bright future as he bids to bounce back from one of the darkest days in his fledgling career. Hobden’s encouraging start to the season came to a grinding halt in the previous Championship match against Middlesex at Hove. The 22-year-old from Eastbourne lost his rhythm completely as he committed 11 no-balls in 16 overs in the first innings and another three in the second. His struggles were highlighted by an injury to Ajmal Shahzad on the opening day which prevented skipper Ed Joyce from withdrawing him from the attack.

Richard Drew/Associated PressThe normally busy trading floor will be empty on Monday. All United States stock and options markets will close on Monday as Hurricane Sandy approaches, as Wall Street braces for the storm to barrel through the heart of the country’s financial center. The decision, made on Sunday night, leaves the American stock markets closed for weather conditions for the first time in nearly three decades. The New York Stock Exchange had previously planned on closing only its physical trading floor, while allowing for trading on its Arca electronic exchange. It has now decided to halt all trading.

Under Trump, presidential pardons have become a way to reward blind loyalty—and to punish his predecessor. Since discovering that the constitution gives him the somewhat controversial power to absolve criminals who are also his friends, Donald Trump has pardoned more people and commuted more sentences in his first 18 months in office than any of his three immediate predecessors. The pardoning spree continued on Tuesday, as Trump issued two more before jetting off to Europe to stomp all over NATO, this time clearing the names of father-son arsonist duo Dwight and Steven Hammond, Oregon cattle ranchers whose 2016 fight against the federal government became a conservative cause célèbre.

Why Did This Woman Walk Away From Earning $600,000? It takes a lot of courage to quit your job and start a venture of your own. It takes something entirely else to walk away from a finance job that pays you over half a million dollars a year, and create a new media property – teaching yourself Final Cut Pro via Lynda.com, taking sketch comedy writing classes through Upright Citizens Brigade, writing, editing and starring in your own videos, and filling a perceived void in the market with no guarantee for success.

Hybrid Cloud : Wave of the Future or Digital Chimera ? Home Blogs Infrastructure Hybrid Cloud : Wave Of The  Future Or Digital Chimera? Hybrid cloud presents great benefits with opportunities that both public and private clouds fail to offer. For example, cost efficiency, increased security, and privacy have become hybrid cloud focal points, driving widespread industry adoption and massive investments by tech firms. There are countless studies showing how it could bridge gaps across different aspects of enterprise networks and let a business mix multiple computing services from diverse providers with almost unnoticeable workarounds.

It 's not your imagination—but you should blame the candidates , not the media . CBS President and CEO Les Moonves has pushed for rights to stream NFL games on the network's digital service. CBS Corp. said it obtained rights to carry National Football League games on its CBS All Access streaming service, allowing the most-watched U.S. TV network to offer its most popular programming online. The multiyear deal with the NFL begins Sunday and will include all CBS coverage of regular, preseason and post-season games in subscribers’ local markets, the network said Thursday in a statement. Financial terms weren’t disclosed. While NFL viewership has declined this year, football remains the most popular programming on TV.

Jack Kerouac cruised the bohemian North Beach neighborhood here in the 1950s intent on achieving nothing less than freedom of the mind, body, soul and written word. Nearly 50 years after the publication of his classic best-selling novel, "On The Road," the spirit of Kerouac, who died in 1969, is back in town at the new Beat Museum. In a modest one-room space sublet from the Live Worms art gallery on upper Grant Street, the museum uses letters, videos, books and photographs to tell the story of the writers known as the Beats.

Who is K P Sharma Oli ? The new prime minister of Nepal , K P Sharma Oli gained popularity  in recent times.He is popularly known by his nickname , K P Oli. He was one of the leaders in the 2006 movement to restore democracy in the country and has held several government offices including leader of Communist Party. K P Sharma Oli was sworn-in as Prime Minister of Nepal in 2018 after leading his left alliance to victory in the General Election in 2017.He is known to have focused on maintaining sovereignty and good ties with Nepal’s neighbors and development in agriculture.

The five-storied 'Farhad Mansion' resembles any other well-maintained house in an affluent neighbourhood of Chittagong city. Yet no gatekeeper guards any of the two steel gates that lead to the small front yard and the stairway of the building. With the summer holidays, it is not surprising that the ground and fourth floors that house an English medium school are deserted. But even the residential second and third floors show no signs of life. Climbing to the top, the locked grilled-gate to the roof is reached. Standing there, one cannot help but shudder, imagining what had happened there on April 27, 2012.

The verdicts being announced in court thus far in relation to some minor misused campaign donations has further stoked outrage against Edwards who had thus far thought that he may not face any kind of real penalty for his misconduct.

You have to give Square Enix points for honesty; Bravely Default: For the Sequel wears its primary intentions right on its sleeve. I mean, it's right in the title: "For the Sequel." Some restaurateurs are altering menus to accommodate dieters on macro diets. When Chicago-native Vince Schiano was working toward his goal to drop body fat, he’d often carry around a food scale, protein powder and a tupperware full of ground beef or turkey. Vince Schiano started macro dieting in 2016 to lose fat. The diet is different for each person. For example, an active 130-pound adult following a 1,600-calorie diet could opt for 40% of calories from carbs; 30% from protein; and 30% from fat, Runners World recommends.

School opened this week , so I thought this exploration would be appropriate and valuable . Recently , I was  learning about genetically modified foods and some of their potentially harmful impacts . I wanted to research whether or not any of the items served in my school lunch contained any GMO foods . To do this I talked to the school lunch manager and she gladly obliged by allowing me to look through the food packages in search for the food manufacturer . Shockingly, nearly one third of the items contained GMOs . It was eye-opening and as a result, I presented these findings to the PTA board who were quite alarmed by this information .

Ontario’s Special Investigations Unit has ended its investigation into the death of a 43-year-old Rideau Lakes man who allegedly shot himself after receiving a phone call from police. The incident occurred on the afternoon of June 3, in the Township of Rideau Lakes, just west of Smiths Falls, when an Ontario Provincial Police officer contacted the man and told him he would be arrested. Shortly afterward, at 3:20 p.m., the man called 911 reporting that he had sustained a self-inflicted gunshot wound. Police and paramedics responded to the call and the man was taken to Ottawa Civic Hospital by air ambulance.

What will happen to a living organism placed in a state of quantum superposition ? September 22 , 2015 , 

The possibilities are exciting, and puzzling. We may eventually discover what conditions a living organism placed in a state of quantum superposition actually experiences, or it may be simply beyond our capabilities to interpret. In a way, this remains in a limbo between life and death, a grey area, if you will, and to consider such situations highlights our understanding of both concepts. Studies involving extreme cases of freezing and freezing (cryopreservation) may tell us more about this type of 'stasis'.

Born in the country and fluent in the language, Gursewak Singh considers himself Japanese. The government doesn't. It’s Scorsese’s 10th DGA nomination and first for a documentary. The battle over the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ’ s new “ borrower education tool ” unveiled earlier this week  is escalating 

Opposition is mounting against the new borrower education tool, with key banking associations, trade associations and banks arguing that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau overstepped their regulatory power and mandated a ‘one size fits all’ solution that lacks necessary considerations of cost or a sense of voluntary guidance. Those in opposition of the policy point to certain loopholes as grounds for legal challenges. Lobbyists, advocates and commentators on the right have seen this development as a concerning usurpation of Congress's policymaking prerogative.

Salad may be an overlooked part of the holiday meal , but it doesn ’ t have to be that  way . This Thanksgiving, give salads the special treatment by including fresh , seasonal fruits and vegetables . Top salads off with some festive decorations . You can dice an apple or cranberries and include nuts, pomegranate seeds or candy corn to add some colour and extra flavour. Another way to liven up your dish is to layer quinoa or crumbled stuffing with vegetables. Your guests will thank you for a delightful and flavourful way to enjoy all the best that the season has to offer.

New York, NY, March 19, 2014 … In recognition of her “abiding commitment to promoting and protecting human rights at home and abroad,” the Anti-Defamation League (ADL) today presented German Chancellor Angela Merkel with its distinguished ADL Joseph Prize for Human Rights. The prize was presented at the German Chancellery in Berlin by members of a leadership delegation currently traveling in Germany led by Barry Curtiss-Lusher, ADL National Chair and Abraham H. Foxman, ADL National Director. Angela Merkel has been Chancellor of Germany since 2005 and the leader of the Christian Democratic Union since 2000, and is the first woman to hold either office.

The Jawbone Up debuted last year with big ambitions: A bracelet-like device that you'd wear all the time, tracking how much you move and how well you sleep. Paired with an app, the Up helps you recognize patterns in your habits, empowering you to improve your health. One problem: It wasn't built to withstand the punishment of being a wearable device. Unlike a cellphone that resides in your pocket or a bag, the Up wraps around your wrist, exposed to the world just as much as your skin is. Many users found it quickly malfunctioned, and Jawbone recalled the Up and issued refunds.

In Syria , Peace Plan 'Is Unraveling ' : The Two-Way `` It 's almost as if in certain parts  of Syria there is peace. Areas like Idlib have experienced days with minimal or no airstrikes , some reconstruction has begun and populations of internally displaced individuals are gradually coming home. Unfortunately , according to analysts, this period of apparent calm could end suddenly. Extremist groups operating in and around Idlib still control their terrain, terrorizing non-violent people and forces in opposition-held regions , highlighting the simmering tensions beneath the calm on the ground.

ORANGEBURG, S.C. — Talk-show host and media mogul Oprah Winfrey has conducted a jailhouse interview with a South Carolina mother who pleaded guilty to killing her two sons. Winfrey went to the jail in Orangeburg last week where 30-year-old Shaquan Duley is awaiting sentencing. Winfrey interviewed Duley’s family in September 2010, a month after Duley suffocated her 2-year-old and 18-month-old sons, then tried to stage their deaths by driving her car into a river. Prosecutors say she killed the children after being badgered by her mother about being a poor parent. Duley faces 30 years to life in prison when she’s sentenced Friday.

SAN BERNARDINO – In recognition of his great aunt, San Bernardino Valley College art instructor David Rosales constructed an altar box that includes pictures of her as a young woman in Mexico, an old lithograph from his grandfather’s house and his own watercolor painting. The artwork, titled “Altar Box for Mrs. Martinez” is one of many on display at the Dia de los Muertos exhibit that opened this week in the Gresham Art Gallery at the college. “This is different artists’ interpretations of this celebration of life,” said Rosales, also the director of the art gallery.

Most Janus cats do n't live for more than a few days , but Frank and Louie 's unusually long  lifespan of over fifteen years captured the attention of scientists across the globe. Research around this phenomenon found that this breed of two-faced cats are unique in having two well-separated cerebral hemispheres allowing two completely separate nerve signals. Additionally, Frank and Louie were two distinctly functioning neural systems within the same brain - incredible. In addition to these physical discoveries, the impact on humans was also something noteworthy. Frank and Louie demonstrated how two-faced creatures had twice the amount of life and human perspectives that the researchers once assumed they had.

In common with family businesses' tax planning and on the advice of their accountants, one share was issued to Mrs Jones and one share to Mr Jones. The best retirement financial advice you can get might be to get more sleep. That is the provocative implication of recent research that examined investors’ financial risk-taking following periods when their sleep was disrupted. Furthermore, retirees typically would like to sleep more, but can’t — due to the disruptions in sleep patterns that are a normal part of the aging process.

In a study from 24/7 Wall Street, Leelanau County was named Michigan's most expensive housing market with a median home price of $281,979. Carrying-case manufacturer Skooba announced Thursday that it 's working with the Transportation Security Administration on new laptop bags that can  pass through airport security faster

London ( AP ) — An iceberg four miles wide has broken off from a glacier in eastern Greenland and  scientists warn this event is further evidence of accelerated melting of Arctic ice 

This event, as seen through satellite imagery, comes less than two weeks after a gigantic island of ice snapped off the Arctic island's mile-long early October. Researchers tracking Greenland's glaciers report that about 12% of Greenland's surface mass loss this summer occurred in the course of three events, with the recent breaking off being one of the largest events of recent years.

Hedge mazes usually are reserved for mansions or fancy gardens . Hedge mazes usually are reserved for mansions or fancy  gardens, but in modern day people build their own maze in a different format like geoglyph. One advantage of building it is that people can decorate it in whichever shape they want, rather than repeating a single pattern. It not only entertains, but helps practice skills like teamwork and strategic thinking. When reconciliation becomes a last-minute vote catcher , only the deepest , most corrosive cynicism is possible . Trampling on  hundreds of years of suffering will then lose its monstrous status and become the essential mechanism of sustaining some out-of-touch elite. By resorting to last-minute politicking of this nature, we may be weakening an honest effort to fully confront, appreciate and unravel the histories that birthed the outrage and grievances on all sides, now quietly co-opted in this timely bid to convert diverging voter preferences into collective unanimity. Ultimately, if successful, only an enduring cynicism rather than shared spirit of harmonious existence may be possible in return.

In developed capitalist democracies , financial , media and energy companies are private enterprises that don ’ t report to  governments directly and aren ’ t nationalised as common services. But, on the other hand, an unregulated market of privately owned companies causes wide concern among ordinary citizens and activists, as far too much influence over how nations interact with the rest of the world and how money is managed rests in the hands of only a few unaccountable actors. Many believe governments should adopt models to exert better control over this limited sector and at the same time promote democratic choice.

Media & Entertainment I write about women in the business of Hollywood . Judy Watson watched as the California Poppy Reserve was established in the 1970s just five miles from her home . She thought this land would provide protection and resources to ensure the safety of her community and those around them. As a native to the region, she felt connected to the California poppy flowers that spread across this nature reserve. Judy made it her life’s mission to raise awareness of its beauty and educational value. She regularly ran conservation efforts, seminars, lectures and other fundraising events to allow visitors of all ages to appreciate its wild and beautiful habitats.

Timeshare management companies foreclose on homeowners who do not pay the bill . 1 Can I Be Sued for Not  Paying My Timeshare Bill? Yes, you can be sued if you do not pay your timeshare bill. If you cannot make a payment or default on it, the management companies may take action against you. A management company has the right to foreclose your home, assess late charges and place a lien on the property. Ultimately, failure to pay could put a serious dent in your credit history and hamper your ability to obtain mortgages or credit in the future.

The percentage of overweight and obese adults in Lancashire is almost 1% higher than the national average (64.7% compared to 63.8%). The first annual report produced by Lancashire’s Director of Public Health has highlighted the fact that while people are living longer, they are often facing years of ill-health at the end of their lives. • While people are generally living longer, life expectancy and the number of years for which people enjoy good health in Lancashire are less than the national average. • Work to address health inequalities is needed both in deprived communities and more affluent ones.

If you live along the Eastern Seaboard and wake up early Friday you could be treated to a colorful sky , The Wall Street Journal reported. Meteorologists forecast Aurora Borealis, more commonly known as the Northern Lights, could be visible over New England and the Middle Atlantic. This type of phenomenon usually happens in much further latitudes - so New Yorkers who've never been to Iceland and didn't imagine the mysterious shimmer in the night could suddenly find themselves witness to an unprecedented light show. Skygazers in parts of Michigan, Maine and northern Ohio should look for activity and will be facing the north/northeast for maximum brightness and color.

A 29-year-old woman was killed when her car was hit by a train on a crossing in Ogi , Saga  Prefecture

According to the authorities, the incident occurred around 9 am at a crossing with flashing lights, but not a level crossing barrier. The woman, Takayo Nojima, was the only occupant in her vehicle when the car was struck. Local traffic police have warned against violations at crossing lights. “Please pay full attention to traffic safety,” they said.

Pliskova pulls out of Czech team for Fed Cup final vs. U.S.
PRAGUE (Reuters) - World number eight Karolina Pliskova has pulled out of the Czech team for next week’s Fed Cup final against defending champions the United States due to a calf injury, she said on Saturday. It's hard to imagine that 2001: A Space Odyssey would have its incredible cinematic impact without that classical soundtrack. But director Stanley Kubrick originally hired a composer to score the film, only to abandon the score in postproduction. Kubrick tapped Alex North, who had scored a number of classic films, including Kubrick's own Spartacus, to write the 2001 score. Kubrick deemed the score inadequate for the film, and replaced it with the classical musical tracks that are so familiar today. North wasn't aware of the change until the film premiered.

At least 21 people were killed and hundreds wounded in four days of fighting between two rival tribes in the southern Libyan town of Sebha. The clashes are between the Awled Suleiman tribe and the tribe of deposed leader Muammar Gaddafi, the Guedadfa tribe. The death toll is at 21 and about one hundred wounded from the Awled Suleiman tribe, according to the head of the Sebha Medical Center, Nasser al-Jehimi. The Scimitar-horned Oryx no longer lives in the African desert . It is considered extinct in the wild . But  there are now efforts underway to help it reclaim its home . Conservationists and wildlife experts have embarked on a project in collaboration with various African countries to ensure its return . Breeding centers and natural preserves have been set up, stocking the herds from international captive breeding centers that are tracked and supervised. So far the process has been successful, and it is expected to continue for the foreseeable future. These animals will be tracked for some time so that the complete gene pool remains within the same habitat as before.

Crucially though, these guys don't stop at food production. While their commercial services seem to focus on landscaping and food production planning for now, the team is also involved in research on designing low impact, low energy, resilient structures that can withstand future shocks—be they natural storms and other challenges, or man-made disasters such as peak oil. Based out of a purpose-built multi-purpose dwelling at the research farm, Whole Systems Design clearly puts an emphasis on low tech, appropriate and "passively survivable" sustainability features, by which they mean systems that can keep operating if there is an interruption of power supply or other crucial resources.

Richard Swift Obituary : Richard Swift ’ s Obituary by the TheTimesNews.com . Richard Swift , singer-songwriter , musician and  producer , passed away on July 3 , 2018, at the age of 41. He left behind a powerful body of work and an overwhelming contribution to the music community. He began his career with an Indie Folk Band The Shins in 2004. He eventually began a successful career in both indie rock and soulful compositions, writing songs for dozens of popular artists and releasing multiple albums for himself. During this time, he began an affiliation with Jonathan Rado and earned his membership in The National as keyboardist.

Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi routinely lands up at the airport to receive world dignitaries . Labour leader Ed Miliband does n't have an image problem , he has a policy problem . The problem is  that his policy agenda as well as his decisions in past are confused to most people and Labour activists. Furthermore, this situation is damaging to Labour party, because members of the party often don’t understand Ed Miliband's long-term strategy and plans. In light of these criticisms, Miliband has made adjustments to his approach to make sure his policies have the ability to become concrete political achievements. Recently he appointed a new head of policy and developed a cross-party commission which aimed at opening up politics.

When Pacers coach Frank Vogel announced he would sit all five starters for last night 's game against the Bucks 

Vogel knew that a blow-out was a near certainty, but he was adamant that it was the right move. Sitting his starters served as a message to the team to step up and show him that they're up for the challenge ahead of the NBA playoffs. Most of the reserves managed to score in double digits and although the Bucks eventually won 110-95, the experience is sure to be invaluable to a young Pacers team that's attempting to reach the next level in terms of their capabilities.

ROBIN VAN PERSIE may still leave Manchester United this summer , but it wo n't be for Qatari side Lekhwiya . United were believed to have received an offer from Lekhwiya and many thought the club was interested in signing Van Persie, who has been troubled by injury problems throughout the campaign. However, he will no longer be moving to Qatar. Instead, it looks as if the player could remain at United beyond the summer. He still has a season left on his current contract and the club's hierarchy may wish to keep him around for at least the short-term future.

Security researchers at Kaspersky Lab say they 've discovered the first virus designed to infect iPods . Called `` Podloso , '' the malicious software replicates itself among music files stored on the device, placing a dangerous backdoor into iPods connected to computers running Windows. The infected iPods were part of the shipments delivered by a major Japanese retailer that happened to buy iPod devices carrying preloaded viruses. Even though Podloso appears to only cause devices to reboot each time they are disconnected, its remote connection could pose a threat of bigger data theft, manipulation and remote control in case of more powerful adversaries with increased access.

PASSENGERS are now banned from drinking alcohol purchased from duty free shops under new rules. It's hoped that the initiative will tackle the increasing number of in-flight incidents and disruptions caused by drunken travellers. The new policy has been introduced by World Duty Free, according to The Times, who own most of the duty free shops in airports across the UK. Any alcohol bought by passengers in any of its shops will be given in sealed bags, which must remain sealed until they leave the flight. All alcohol will be included - from beer and wine to spirits - no matter what size they are.

May 23 - Egyptians arrive early at voting booth to cast their vote for the first president since deposed leader Hosni Mubarak. Rough cut (no reporter narration). ROUGH CUT, NO REPORTER NARRATION Security tightens around Cairo, as Egyptians gather to vote for their president. This will be the first time they are picking their president. The election is wide open, pitting Islamists against men who served under deposed leader Hosni Mubarak. The contest is a novelty for a nation where elections during the 30-year rule of a man some called "Pharaoh" were thinly attended rigmaroles in which the result was a foregone conclusion.
