Read It To Me is your audible reading assistant that is capable of reading text no matter how short or long it may be. You can easily copy and paste any amount of text to be read by the app.

It takes a community to help migrant workers who need affordable medical care and social assistance . This is the  spirit that spurred over 30 medical personnel, including doctors, medical students, nurses and translators, to join in an effort to support Migrant Clinics, an organization devoted to the medical needs of underserved families across Canada. These dedicated volunteers ran clinics where the medical personnel not only provided free screenings and vaccines, but they also ran on-site educational events in both English and the various languages of the different nationalities of their clients.

I was delighted to read in Eureka Street Ruby Hamad ’ s passionate protest that she and other Muslims should  not have to apologise

Ruby's words have opened a flood of questions around Muslim identity and the refusal to kowtow to widespread misconceptions. Her writing resonates loudly among minority communities and can foster greater understanding in the broader Australian populace. As Australian Muslims, we take heart and applaud Ruby for courageously promoting dialogue, exploration and engagement for acceptance and equitable outcomes for those of all cultures and identities. Muslims do not need to apologise and seek pardon for unfounded allegations made about our communities.

It 's Memorial Day Weekend , and that means hitting up the best sales , whether at the store or  online . However this Memorial Day may be different. Given the nationwide shelter-in-place orders due to COVID-19, stores may remain closed in compliance with their states regulations and shoppers could be discouraged to go out to crowded locations and areas with more infections. Many online businesses are responding by launching flash sales, free shipping promotions and hosting sales on apps, social media, etc. Many individuals and communities have resorted to sales of second hand items on Instagram and Twitter, joining efforts of Memorial Day BBQs being held by delivery only.

With the economic noose poised to tighten around Iran over its suspect nuclear program, the Tehran regime is shaking a stick at Gulf nations. Tensions in the Persian Gulf and modest economic recovery in the United States could influence retail gasoline prices, analysts said. The International Energy Agency could respond to a major Middle East oil crisis but doesn't see any immediate need for action, the group's director said. Military officials in Tehran said the United States can not stop Iran from preventing oil from passing through the strategic Strait of Hormuz.

“ Overwatch ” was pristine out of the box . The character and level design were excellent . It combined  fantastic third-person shooter mechanics with other skills unique to the various heroes. Players are taken through interesting maps, use creative tactics with friends, or partake in new and interesting missions with each match. The sound track of the game just brings players into a sort of a mesmerized zone. Competitive gaming keeps everything exciting; with ranks and new emotes, dances, or victory poses unlocked with each rank up or achieve a specific requirement.

ANTIOCH 6/5/16 – When Trevor Dunning first entered the Trinity Christian School speech class , he was personally greeted ,  hugged, and quickly accepted as one of their own by his teacher, Mrs. Robles. Since then, Trevor has amazed everyone with his positive attitude and personality. His contagious enthusiasm and extraordinary confidence can be witnessed at the local showcase of talent and speeches delivered by the group members of his class. Trevor says that his favorite moment of his career is his memorable award for taking 2nd place at the same competition he once feared to join. He and his parents are humbled and thrilled.

(CNN) — Spending the night at an airport isn't usually an aspirational sleeping arrangement. That was before someone transformed the original flight control tower at Stockholm Arlanda Airport into a luxury apartment. The disused tower is now home to a spacious, bright space complete with panoramic views of the runways below. The airport control tower is now a chic, minimalistic apartment space. Arlanda has partnered with vacation rental company HomeAway and Swedavia to reinvent the 80-meter-high tower as a destination that'll appeal to aviation geeks, design freaks -- pretty much everyone else.

The University of Arkansas at Fort Smith recently told student Jennifer Braly that she was prohibited from giving lectures about  socialism and anarchism on the university's grounds

Jennifer was told the university's security regulations did not permit those kind of topics, as the faculty worried these ideas would evoke fear or harm among some of the university's population. Despite her pleading that socialism and anarchism don't "involve force, no economic boycott, and nor have I mentioned support for physical revolution," the administration firmly denied her request to speak.

The Bridge City Cardinals are the boys 22-4A district champions in tennis. The team participated in the district tournament in Beaumont last week. Taking home the silver medal in Boys Singles was Lorenz Schrader. Schrader played an epic four hour match in the finals before falling 5-7; 7-5; 7-6 (5) to Hardin Jefferson. In the Boys Doubles division, the Perry brothers once again dominated. Camden and Kian dropped only two games in their move thru the bracket. Also in the Boys Doubles, Salvador Torres and Alberto Munguia captured the bronze medal for the Cardinals.

Damn, aside from Tom Tykwer desperately trying to get out of there at the 30 minute mark, and their publicist throwing out a bit of a burn towards DP at the very end, it was a great interview. Loved the epic rants on the philosophical nature of “Revolutions,” as well as Andy Wachowski’s understandable annoyance with film junkets. Amazing interview…I wish I had the chance to catch the late screening with Q&A at Fantastic Fest…Profound love/respect/admiration to the Wachowskis, Tykwer, and you David. Cornel West was not joshing when he said Lana was laser smart.

Keep it classy . Cheer . Revel in a rival . And Yankees - keep it brief , a simple  nice gesture , brought jubilation among baseball rivalries

After Derek Jeter retired in 2014, a gesture by the New York Yankees revealed they weren't all rivalry. During the ceremony held at Boston Red Sox's Fenway Park in honour of Jeter, the Yankee held up a giant-sized baseball jersey, expressing thanks to one of their most loved rivals. The powerful, nostalgic act stirred Red Sox fans to stand up for a toast, take off hats in homage, chant his name and tear up as one.

Technology’s continuing onslaught, and employees’ responses to it, will be central issues for the American workplace of 2012. IT’S a far different work world today than it was even 10 years ago. Technology and the economy have converged to create a set of priorities and preoccupations that are unique to our times. Here are just a few workplace and employment issues that are likely to stir debate, frustration and a search for solutions this year. DEVICE BACKLASH As workers add more electronic devices, Web sites, software programs and apps to their arsenals, there is a point at which efficiency and satisfaction suffer.

Barack Obama ’ s presidency has coincided with immense growth of social media services like Facebook and Twitter . And  his influence on both these services has been marked. During his 2008 campaign for US president, Obama held multiple Town Hall meet ups over Facebook to connect directly with supporters . Obama also used both platforms to urge his supporters to volunteer , vote , and continue engaging politically after the election . He then partnered with twitter in 2009 to communicate news , upcoming events , and his own messages to his almost 3o million followers . Social media has undeniably helped reshape the president’s involvement in citizens ' lives .

Although state trademark registration offers fewer benefits than trademark registration with the United States Patent and Trademark Office, state trademark registration can be a cheap alternative for securing limited trademark rights. Federal trademark registration can run anywhere from several hundred dollars to $3,000, depending on the type of mark being registered and the amount of attorney's fees. On the other hand, many states charge less than $100 to file a trademark application. Keep in mind that state registration will not offer multi-state protection, nationwide priority status, incontestability, a presumption of validity or the ability to file a trademark on an intent to use basis.

After reports , speculation , and rumors – it ’ s now official . There is going to be a  royal wedding this weekend. Excitement is high throughout the region. Royal dignitaries and fans alike are flocking to the small, ancient village of Penn where the nuptials will take place. Preparations have been ongoing since the announcement was made official a week ago. Repairs and renovations to the quaint church located at the heart of Penn are now complete, awaiting the happily betrothed pair. Security will be extra tight on the days leading to and during the wedding to ensure a peaceful event and to accommodate the number of anticipated attendees.

Cryptocurrencies, outside of Bitcoin, have failed to garner much attention from buyers, and while the same can be said of sellers, the digestion of losses over the past month is likely to lead to more losses soon. Ethereum, Ripple, and Litecoin are all carving out a similar bear-flag pattern that should lead to another purge of speculative excesses. Weak price action in ETH/USD has it set up to make another leg lower soon. It could continue to drift ever-so-slightly higher, but the developing bear-flag implies risk is skewed more heavily towards the downside.

MANCHESTER UNITED outcast Morgan Schneiderlin has emerged as a January target for Inter Milan, according to reports. Schneiderlin has fallen down the pecking order at Manchester United under Jose Mourinho. Despite Bastian Schweinsteiger also being marginalised, Schneiderlin has been unable to force his way into the side over the likes of Paul Pogba, Ander Herrera, Michael Carrick and Marouane Fellaini. United are set to cut their losses on the midfielder this summer just 18 months after he signed for £24million from Southampton. And Italian website Calcio Mercato claim that Inter Milan want to bring the France international to the San Siro.

I’m still not convinced Foreman is the answer — they’d be crazy not to draft a running back next year — but for now Foreman might get goalline work and has speed to do a little more. When Cooper Kupp sustained an ACL tear, the question was whether Reynolds could step into his role as an equal partner in the Rams’ pass-catching triumvirate. He leaped the first hurdle with flying colors: six catches for 80 yards and a score against the Chiefs. The Rams operate out of three-receiver 11 personnel an insane 98 percent of time, per sharpfootballstats.com.

Following a team of international scientists, this film exclusively documents an archeological sensation: the exploration of royal tombs beneath the ancient Mexican city of Teotihuacán. Despite many decades of research, not much is known about the long-lost Teotihuacán society. But when archeologists enter the newly discovered burial chambers, they find the clues that may finally tell us who these mysterious people were. The film incorrectly states the city of Tikal is in Mexico when it is in Guatemala. Secrets of the Dead strives to get the facts correct and we regret the error.

The newest entry to the robo-advisory service is TIAA . Part of the allure for firms is to appeal to  customers who are digital-first and wants to build more user-friendly digital experiences to appeal to users of any demographic. TIAA offers mobile and tablet access, making it more convenient and secure for customers to reach their financial goals. TIAA allows for up to a 90% human element with automated user on-boarding and cross selling, enabling customised savings journeys for customers. They’re also offering better personalization opportunities across the customer life cycle, giving access to visual displays and educational aids that explain investment concepts and goals.

Iqbal Survé’s Sagarmatha Technologies, which failed to list on the JSE a year ago, has set its sights on an offshore listing, according to Survé’s newspaper Business Report. Sagarmatha, a technology company within the Sekunjalo investment group, has already made an application to the SA Reserve Bank, the publication said, citing Survé, the chair of Independent Media. In early 2018, Sagarmatha’s listing on the JSE — along with a mooted listing in New York — was scuppered by its failure to submit financial statements on time.

Around 2.54 million new cars were registered in 2017 compared with 2.69 million the previous year . More than 157,000  were alternatively fuelled, accounting for 6.2 percent

Despite the slight decrease in registered new cars compared to the previous year, there were several positives for the motor industry. All three alternative fuel types, hybrid, electric and plug-in hybrid saw substantial year-on-year growth. While in total over 54,000 electric cars were registered in the 2017 – up 57.6% from the year before – by December, hybrids, plug-in hybrid and electric car ownership collectively constituted the highest new fuel type since 2001.

We chose to question the narrative of history by simply quoting words which Churchill used himself. At a glance, Blighty Café appears to be another one of those trendy and sophisticated coffee shops that offer the terribly appealing combination of tasteful beverages, off-beat music and the inviting aroma of freshly-baked sourdough bread. As a university student living in the area, of course, I couldn’t resist. Sounds perfect, right? Except, sitting in the mock air-raid shelter, drinking my flat white, I couldn’t help but feel ever more uncomfortable.

Two capitals are look set to burst through the 40C mark and another swelters through its 10th day of a heatwave. Melbourne is set to hit 42C today, a figure a climate expert has called a once in a decade heat event. Adelaide’s CBD has seen temperatures soar to 41C on Thursday as south eastern Australia sweats its way through 36 hours of “intense heat”. At 2.30pm Adelaide’s CBD reached its forecast high for the day and is likley to keep on climbing. Further inland, Port Augusta touched 44.7C, Ceduna 45.5C and Nullabor 46.2C at 1.40pm.

Slack said the deal is part of its continued efforts to make the collaboration hub more flexible beyond engineering and IT. Slack on Tuesday said that it's acquired Missions, a startup behind a tool that lets non-developers build custom integrations and automate routine processes in Slack. Slack said the acquisition -- it's third ever -- is part of its continued efforts to make the collaboration hub more flexible beyond engineering and IT. Custom integrations are apparently a big deal in Slack, with around 65 percent of paid teams having built one of their own.

A jaunt through October's art highlights. Eighty-eight-year-old Jack McLarty has had a distinguished career, with an exhibition history stretching back to the 1940s and artworks housed in collections such as the Smithsonian Institution's. His paintings this month at Broderick show evidence of his fascination with Central and South America. A riot of tropicalia, The Garden of Good and Evil is all parrots, crucifixes, Dia de los Muertos skulls and anacondas wrapped around naked women's legs. The best of McLarty's works have a kooky exuberance, executed with a neo-Impressionist technique and a folk artist's naivetÉ.

Rain mac with metal clasps , $ 91.44 at Asos . Felix Rey Kissy Face umbrella , $ 65.00 Shopbop  

An out of the ordinary Mac with O rings rather than buttons also costs £91.44 at ASOS, whilst at Shopbop a new Kissy Face themed rain umbrella has landed just in time for April showers, it retails for an easily affordable $65. From Stella McCartney's symbolic eye emoji umbrellas toHunter's Big Boobada Bow (yaaassss! ), the impactful prints carry everything you could ask for in such a quintessentially rainy accessory.

The AKP should take comfort in its large majority and start to view minority views and even peaceful dissent benignly 

The AKP has faced a steady trend of diminishing majority in the most recent elections and many critics argue this suggests the government may become more totalitarian in nature. Despite the drop, they remain in majority and they should use this period of relatively strengthened majority to strive for unity rather than harbour an environment of distrust towards dissent. Minority voices should not only be accepted and accommodated, but embraced in policy-making and encouraged where deemed appropriate.

Q. What was your favorite Christmas gift you got as a kid? A. "Man, I don’t know if I even remember like a specific gift. I got a smartphone when I was a senior in college. That’s the one I remember, pretty recent. So I had a flip phone all through college. I don’t know if that’s my favorite, though. That’s just the one that I remember because it was kind of a big change for me to go from a flip phone to a smart phone.

CINCINNATI -- As FC Cincinnati fans chanted and cheered for taxpayers to help fund a Major League Soccer stadium, Hamilton County leaders laid out a bleak reality: The county has too many projects and no way to pay for them all. From an outdated convention center to the obsolete Western Hills Viaduct, Hamilton County Commissioners are trying to figure out how to pay for more than $1.5 billion worth of infrastructure, development, transportation and county building needs in the coming years. "We have more projects than we have money," Hamilton County Commission President Todd Portune told a crowd of at least 150 people Tuesday night.

Surgical Strike Day : State Education minister Partha Chatterjee yesterday criticised the central government alleging that the UGC 's direction  which mandates that the

institutions shall organize online celebration on the Surgical Strike day is motivated. He added that a necessary prior-information must have been provided as majority of these colleges in West Bengal were left without internet connectivity and basic infrastructure to conduct online programs. He said it will be impossible to comply with UGC's direction within a span of such little notice and added that the edification programmes should focus more on academic aspects, that be celebrated by carrying out e-meets of specific teachers with particular subject.

DUTA has been boycotting the evaluation for a month now to protest the new faculty reservation mechanism in universities and  colleges 

As a result, DU vice chancellor had promised to invite a 5-member committee to take care of the faculty concerns, in order to continue the evaluation process. Following the instructions, the committee constituted a working group to resolve the issues and DUTA finally decided to withdraw the boycott. The committee promised to come out with the report in 15 days. Although DU promised to meet the needs of the Faculty members, students will continue to suffer as the assessment process has already been disrupted.

With all the charm of yesterday with many of today 's modern features , this lovely 3 bedroom craftsman cottage  provides great opportunity for many. Not only does the well-maintained property have high ceilings , large bright windows and plenty of character, the modern touches make it attractive to today’s families. The energy efficient system ensure minimal electric bills as well. In addition to its current attributes, the lovely garden invites owners to take advantage of their green thumb. Also its driveway is spacious enough to accommodate up to 5 cars - definitely a rare opportunity!

The Defense Information Systems Agency has provided and operated telecommunications and information technology for decades. Today the Agency is sharpening its operational focus working with its partner, the Joint Task Force-Global Network Operations (JTF-GNO). Together DISA and the JTF-GNO provide a mission environment for warfighters and national leadership that comprises command and control capabilities and the entire enterprise infrastructure. The term 'operationalizing' refers to doing this with a no-fail customer-focused mindset, and a shift from an application mentality to a service mentality. This is critical to fielding Global Information Grid 2.0 capabilities that will deliver a next generation Web 2.0 environment for the warfighter.

The ease of Manchester United’s win over Premier League title rivals Chelsea masked a potential moment of controversy after an “innovative” corner routine involving Wayne Rooney, Ryan Giggs and Cristiano Ronaldo produced a goal, with the scores still level, that was disallowed under instruction from the linesman. Step Two: Ryan Giggs picks up the loose ball following Rooney's hand-over. United manager Sir Alex Ferguson expressed astonishment that the effort, converted by Ronaldo, did not stand, admitting the routine had been planned on the training ground. Step one: Wayne Rooney goes over to corner flag to take quick set-piece.

Will an upcoming vote in Congress signal the end of Medicare ? In the next few weeks Congress will decide  the fate of a program that was created over 50 years ago. A vote on new changes proposed by President Donald Trump and Republicans is expected as soon as next month. The vote will determine the future of the Medicare program and is set to include a number of drastic measures that would limit healthcare access. Some of the changes include higher prescription costs, income limits and deeper budget cuts, which some argue would be the death knell of the popular insurance plan.

Facing a mountain of debt and increased competition from online (Amazon) and brick-and-mortar (Wal-Mart) retailers, Toys R Us may be positioning itself for a possible bankruptcy filing, according to CNBC. A new report says the giant toy chain has hired a law firm to help restructure its roughly $400 million in debt. Toys R Us relies heavily on holiday sales to support year-round business, and 2016 proved to be a disappointment for the Wayne, N.J.-based company, and CNBC said those weaknesses carried into the spring with a net loss of $164 million in the first quarter of 2017.

Known as a “floating fest,” Lake Wylie Music Fest has performers on land at a private residence and the audience is by boat only. The event, which first debuted in 2010, has drawn more than 125 boats. “Let your Freak Flag Fly!” is the slogan for this year’s event. The fest was created by Jan and Jon Pendleton and Paul Noble and is volunteer led. For more information, visit lakewyliemusicfest.com. CHAPIN Limitless Sports’ 13th annual Ski Event will be held from 9 a.m. until after lunch June 13 at the Woodmen of the World, 2000 Johnson Marina Road.

FABIO CAPELLO is celebrating a happy hat-trick as he leads England into the last match of the season at Wembley today. There is imagination and confidence and we have players who have improved a lot. New faces. New imagination. New confi dence. The Italian’s change of mood has been a long time coming. A year ago he was heading towards South Africa and a disastrous World Cup. He admits for the fi rst time he was surprised by how badly England performed. England have certainly made strides this season and Capello knows he goes on trial again when the team gets to Poland and Ukraine next summer.

Eighteen years ago Monday, on June 24, 1995, South Africa’s Springbok rugby team staged a stunning upset to win the Rugby World Cup against the heavily favored New Zealand. But the game was much more than just one day’s win. This was the day Nelson Mandela cemented himself as leader of all South Africans. Elected the year before, democracy was still fragile and the racial divide was still raw. Rugby was an all-white game and Springbok captain Francois Pienaar was its hero. But Mandela enlisted Pienaar’s helps to use this final to unite, instead of divide.

A cartographer that created maps for senior policy makers at the National Counterterrorism Center wants to map out your next hunt or backpacking trip. Ben Harshyne and his wife Kate Harshyne took a risk this year when Ben left his job as a contractor where he made maps for the National Counterterrorism Center and chose to work full time on a company he started called HUNTERRA Mapping. HUNTERRA creates maps by blending high-resolution aerial photography with a 3D-like terrain model. The company can create waterproof, tear resistant field maps, poster maps and custom-sized mega maps.

Firefighters more progressive in how we 're using information to gear how we make our decisions within the community . We’re looking at demographics to understand where potential fires may occur, socio-economic backgrounds of potential victims in an incident, mapping tools that forecast where an incident might take place as well as looking into algorithms and technologies for even better fire decision-making. In addition, firefighters are now engaging local businesses and introducing Neighbourhood Risk Assessment Groups (NRAGs). The purpose of NRAGs is to join together the community’s diverse knowledge and create an area that collaborates to create a dynamic structure for awareness and collaboration.

Can You Keep a Secret? is based on Sophie Kinsella’s 4-million-copy New York Times bestseller and centers on Emma Corrigan (Daddario), who spills her secrets to a handsome stranger sitting next to her on a turbulent plane ride. That guy happens to be Jack Harper (Hoechlin), the young and elusive CEO at Emma’s workplace. And Jack knows every single humiliating detail about Emma… . Elise Duran is directing Peter Hutchings’ adaptation. BCDF’s Claude Dal Farra, Brice Dal Farra and Brian Keady of BCDF Pictures are producing. Daddario and Charles Miller are executive producing.

A FAKE doctor allegedly used useless metal rods to test people for cancer and diabetes then charged a fortune to  the affected

The victims found out about this man when the labs that received their tests revealed the fraudulent metal rods. Furthermore, it came out that the rods weren't tested with the chemical balance nor was the required research done on it, rather it was homemade from thin metal pieces, taken out from objects like chairs. Victims claimed they were made to pay hefty amounts in advance as consultation fees, hospital visits and medicines, among others.

The Nicholls softball team staged a strong defensive effort Wednesday night against Southern Mississippi in its home opener at Swanner Field in Thibodaux. Nicholls State stifled the Golden Eagles at the plate, while taking advantage of three errors in the 4-1 non-conference victory. Colonels pitcher Megan Landry earned the win with four strikeouts, a walk and by scattering three hits in six innings. Southern Miss pitcher Abby Trahan took the loss despite six strikeouts, two walks and allowing five hits. "It was a bit of a chess match in the beginning," Colonels coach Angel Santiago said.

A year ago, Palos Verdes came on strong at the end of the regular season and dominated during the playoffs en route to winning the Northern Division championship. The Sea Kings are doing it again. They could easily be 9-0 but final-minute losses to Narbonne and Newport Harbor have them at 7-2 and they are ranked No. 1 in this week's Northern Division rankings. A win over Peninsula on Friday will give Palos Verdes another Bay League championship. The team once again relies on a variety of players. Running back Tyler Moore is closing in on 1,000 yards rushing and has 15 touchdowns.

With the lessons of 2014 fresh in their collective memory and the 2016 election cycle about to start , progressive  grassroots groups around the country have made plans to continue their campaign of change and demand policy priorities such as affordable health care and accessible voting rights. To make it easier, grassroots organizations have created new digital hubs that make it easier for activists to find news and access local leaders to inform their outreach efforts. Others have rolled out “issue literacy” education programs to ensure more citizens are properly informed about important topics.

After a recent update to Adobe 's Creative Cloud service , some users have reported having their personal data deleted 

Following the update, customers flocked to Adobe’s official support channels to inquire about lost images and other missing data. Fortunately, Adobe was quick to identify the cause of the issue. After doing an investigation, Adobe revealed the culprit was a coding error. They reported that no private data had actually been deleted, instead some assets had been unintentionally hidden from Creative Cloud users’ normal views. To fix the issue, Adobe initiated a safety precaution which quickly released a resolution and reverted assets to their prior state.

James Grady scored in the final minute of the final game to hand Gretna an amazing victory that clinched promotion and consigned Ross County to the drop. Michael Gardyne blasted County into the lead from the edge of the box. Nicky Deverdics replied four minutes later from close range and Grady broke clear to fire Gretna ahead. Deiarmuid O'Carroll bundled an equaliser, but Grady broke clear to fire Gretna ahead and deny St Johnstone promotion in a dramatic finish. By that time, County had already gone down after Airdrie beat Queen of the South. Gretna had been forced to win their final game after squandering a 12-point lead in Division One.

The future leadership of Volkswagen hangs in the balance today as the 20-member board of the troubled and iconic company  meet to make the critical decisions that could ultimately lead to a more secure tomorrow. The future of Volkswagen depends heavily on the outcomes of today’s board meeting. Currently under speculation, many speculate that changes in top level management, such as the CEOs resignation, is inevitable. Should the board also decide to allow state intervention from the German government, this could bring much needed and badly required fresh impetus and transformation, towards a bright and thriving future for Volkswagen.

In December 2013 , INSYS received a subpoena from the Office of Inspector General ( OIG ) of the Department  of Health and Human Services. In March 2015, INSYS was officially subpoenaed again in a federal healthcare fraud investigation led by the US Attorney’s Office. At the time of the investigation, INSYS denied allegations of illegal practices or corporate malfeasance, stating it followed all relevant laws, guidelines, and industry standards. In the subsequent years, a string of legal troubles for INSYS unfolded, leading to criminal and civil prosecution for bribery and fraud.

Surgical Strike Day: State Education minister Partha Chatterjee yesterday criticised the central government alleging that the UGC's direction on 'Surgical Strike Day' is a part of the BJP's "agenda". Surgical Strike Day: The Narendra Modi government at the Centre and ruling Trinamool Congress dispensation headed by Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee seems to be heading into a fresh rift, this time over the University Grants Commission’s (UGC) directive to varsities on Thursday and higher educational institutions across the country to observe September 29 as “Surgical strike day”.

If you live along the Eastern Seaboard and wake up early Friday you could be treated to a colorful sky hours before sunrise lights up the horizon. The Terrier-Improved Malumute sounding rocket is scheduled for launch Friday between 4:26 a.m. and 4:41 a.m. ET. Sounding rockets, by the way, have been used for over 40 years to carry science payloads on brief, 5-20 minute missions to space. Friday morning should provide mostly clear skies in the viewing location, and upper level winds should be friendly enough to allow the launch to take place (if not, backup launch dates are available each morning through June 6).

WARWICK — Chariho High won six bouts with pins and defeated Pilgrim , 62-18 , in a Division I crossover  high school wrestling meet on Tuesday. Following up Chariho's victory, lead captain Alex Britten displayed remarkable skill with back to back pins over Pilgrims Sean Amaral in two seconds of the 106lbs bout, and Derek Wittmer in the 113lbs bout at a dazzling five seconds. Johnny Hatch (132) took on Thorairstia Kandis and earned his six team points with a win by fall. Carl Broadgate (138) followed, boasting solid form to bag a 6-5 decision over Logan Stark.

The new law finishes old business in Trenton and expands the so-called Tuition Equality Act , which let qualified immigrants  attend public colleges and universities at in-state tuition rates

Trenton law makers now had good cause for celebration following the final vote to pass the New Jersey law. As residents celebrated, thousands of undocumented students eligible to apply under this new act were celebrating an even bigger milestone as they'd now gain access to significantly more affordable educational pathways. Officials estimate that the tuition Equality act will open the gates of opportunity for nearly 19,500 of them living in New Jersey.

Q . What was your favorite Christmas gift you got as a kid ? A . `` Man , I  had so many favorites from over the years . There was one that really stands out in my memory . When I was six , my parents got me an old doll house that had once belonged to my aunt . It was almost a hundred years old , with wallpaper and furniture hand made out of wood and tiny carpets that covered each room's floor. To make it even more special , it was my mom and dad who restored the doll house to its former beauty before I got it.

A truck slammed into a fire hydrant on Western Avenue in San Pedro on Thursday morning, creating a geyser and backing up traffic on the busy thoroughfare. Lomita sheriff’s Lt. Tony Del Pinto said the agency received a call at about 10:45 a.m. that a green truck had collided with the hydrant near the intersection of Western and Delasonde Drive near the Garden Village Shopping Center. It’s not clear if the driver was injured in the crash. Cal Water crews shut off water to nearby businesses for about five minutes, Kingman said, as it was working to restore service.

Clinton said this week paid family leave is possible by taxing the wealthy but states have done so without soaking  taxpayers

The exact plan proposed by Clinton involved cutting taxes on those in the middle and lower classes, while taxing investments of the wealthy. Teaching language to an artificial intelligence system is child ’ s play , thanks to MIT . Researchers at the  Massachusetts Institute of Technology developed a new algorithm which easily guides machines in mastering different languages . Tests have proved that the AI can translate , speak and read natural human speech almost perfectly . To achieve this impressive feat , the new algorithm relies on reinforcement learning from parallel human translated sentences instead of hand written programs . With no traditional models , humans have to guide the AI just like an adult does with a baby , teach the same concept and determine if a response is appropriate or not .

HIGH POINT , N.C. — A dentist lost her license after two patients died , according to a Final Agency  Order filed Wednesday

The North Carolina Dental Board Order requires Sarah Green Hill to give up her license to practice dentistry in North Carolina. Green Hill, who was first licensed as a dental practitioner in 2001, provided intravenous sedation services to two separate patients who died following procedures performed in her High Point office in 2017 and 2018, according to the agency order. She is permanently barred from renewing, reapplying or reappointing a new license to practice dentistry and operating an office providing these services.

Jesse Winker will undergo season-ending shoulder surgery . He was batting .299 this year with 7 homers and 43 RBI s for the Reds. Capital abundance , low interest rates , and high volatility are creating new challenges and opportunities in equity markets . TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan on Wednesday basked in the glow of its World Cup soccer team’s historic win over Colombia, a victory that has lifted the nation’s mood after an earthquake struck its second-biggest metropolis Osaka. Fans watching Tuesday night’s match at pubs and outdoor bars in the downtown Tokyo area of Shibuya celebrated when Japan clinched a 2-1 victory, exchanging high-fives with strangers on the street and flooding into Shibuya’s famous “scramble crossing,” prompting scores of police to come out to ensure order.

Carrying-case manufacturer Skooba announced Thursday that it's working with the Transportation Security Administration on new laptop bags that can pass through airport security without having the computer inside removed. Carrying-case manufacturer Skooba--the same company that brought the world the slightly mocking Skreener bag --announced Thursday that it's working with the Transportation Security Administration on new laptop bags that can pass through airport security without having the computer inside removed. For decades , aid groups have assumed they know what 's best for refugees and the poor ; a growing 

body of evidence shows that a hands-off approach has enabled refugees and those who live in extreme poverty to determine their own pathways out of difficult circumstances. This self-driven approach, pioneered by aid organizations such as Give Directly, delivers direct cash to people in crisis. Local entrepreneurs have also empowered local refugees, helping them find business opportunities where there were few in the past. Rather than food rations, communities have access to medical supplies, fuel and other resources that can provide the boost to income generation activities.

DUTA has been boycotting the evaluation for a month now to protest the new faculty reservation mechanism in universities and a host of other issues. New Delhi: The Delhi University Teachers' Association (DUTA) will continue with its evaluation boycott, it said today, even as the university again appealed to them to return to evaluation work. DUTA has been boycotting the evaluation for a month now to protest the new faculty reservation mechanism in universities and a host of other issues. In a General Body Meeting, the DUTA decided to continue its evaluation boycott by adopting a resolution, the teachers' body said.

Planting the Savannah grasses in front of Cary Home seemed like a good idea in 2013 , when they received  positive feedback for controlling the snow and water that built up in the streets during heavy rain and snowfall . However, three years later in 2016, the costs for maintaining it has almost doubled. The short-term solutions like controlling flooding could be seen as costly as more frequent manual removal is needed to trim down the thick grass growth in order to protect the car-filled sidewalks. Residents who decided to remove the grasses have found out the other advantage for removing the grasses, being fewer pest and vermin that flourish in their habitat.

BAGHDAD -- The Iraqi government launched an investigation yesterday into the apparent torture of detainees in a secret Interior Ministry  facility. The interior ministry facility, allegedly referred to by many as a "black site", was revealed after witnesses contacted human rights advocates with accounts of ill treatment. Reports detailed verbal, physical, and psychological torture such as beatings with pipes, burns, sexual assault, and waterboarding, indicating the use of torture was part of the interior ministry's regular activities. Following this news, Iraqis were out on the streets, raising flags and shouting slogans in protest.

ORANGEBURG , S.C. — Talk-show host and media mogul Oprah Winfrey has conducted a jailhouse interview with a South Carolina  death row inmate facing execution

Oprah's upcoming docu-series focuses on different perspectives surrounding cases of wrongful convictions. Through this program, Winfrey highlights death row inmate Ernest Basham’s sentence and calls for an end to death row executions. During the one-hour taped session at Kirkland Correctional Institution, Winfrey focused on his early life and significant moments that helped shaped who he was. With two decades on death row, Basham hopes this interview brings to light flaws in the legal system that landed him and others like him on death row.

London (AP) — An iceberg four miles wide has broken off from a glacier in eastern Greenland and scientists have captured the dramatic event on video. A June 22 video of the incident was taken by his wife, Denise Holland of NYU’s Environmental Fluid Dynamics Laboratory. They had camped by the Helheim Glacier for weeks to collect data to better project sea level changes due to global warming. In northwestern Greenland, another large iceberg was apparently grounded on the sea floor near the small village of Innaarsuit, which has a population of 169.

This is the ninth dispatch in a series from Jeff Goodell, who will be investigating the effect of climate change on Thwaites glacier. At about 5 a.m. last Tuesday morning, at latitude 74 degrees 57.4 S and longitude 106 12.8 W on the remote coast of West Antarctica, Thwaites glacier loomed up out of the fog and revealed itself to us. Peter Sheehan, a witty and hard-working 27-year-old researcher from the U.K.’s University of East Anglia, was one of the first scientists aboard the Nathaniel B. Palmer to lay eyes on it.

You have to give Square Enix points for honesty ; Bravely Default : For the Sequel wears its primary intentions  right on its sleeve. Rather than a full-fledged sequel, Bravely Default 2 more serves as a feature-filled stopgap while developers cook up a brand-new entry. Bravely Default 2 uses most of the game mechanics introduced by the 2012 JRPG but with a grander story taking players through unexplored lands. Despite its minimalist approach, players get to look forward to powerful bosses, 3D-animated monsters, local multiplayer support and DLC sidequests. Some signature classes and job roles such as an Italian Renaissance man-like gunslinger and sky pirates are a great welcome too.

The husband of a woman suspected of cutting a fetus out of another woman told police he found the baby “gasping” in a bathroom at their home, shortly after the attack, according to court documents obtained by Reuters. David Ridley said he believed his wife, 34-year-old Dynel Catrece Lane, was really pregnant; and when he returned to their Longmont, Colorado, home on Wednesday. The victim Michelle Wilkins was still bleeding in the basement, unbeknownst to Ridley. Lane had even arranged a prenatal appointment for the same day as the attack, reports 9NEWS.

Ryanair has lowered its full year profit guidance from a current range of €1.25-€1.35 billion to a new range of €1.10-€1.20 billion. The decision, which saw shares in the airline fall by more than ten per cent, comes after a turbulent period for the low-cost carrier. The Irish airline was recently hit by a fall in traffic after pilots and cabin crew in Germany, Holland, Belgium, Spain and Portugal went on strike. Ryanair has also been forced to lower fares for the third quarter of the year (particularly for the October school half-term holidays and Christmas) as customer confidence has been affected by fear of further strikes.

The Defense Information Systems Agency has provided and operated telecommunications and information technology for decades . Today the Agency is  revamping it’s strategies, leading a larger team that also include technical help from the Homeland Security agency as well as DoD Chief Information Officers. The change reflects a pivot to defend military and other networks against cyber security threats and signals a shift toward evolving combat techniques, according to current news sources. Additionally, officials involved in the shifts think a better attack can come from leveraging federal resources towards proactively fighting a strategy which places priority on securing DoD networks from cyber threats before taking more costly post breach measures.

North Korean hacking group focuses attacks on aging and soon-to-be-deprecated technology. Five-Star hackers: High-end hotel data thieves return to target government officials The DarkHotel hacking group has returned -- but this time they're focusing on a different target, using a new strain of Inexsmar malware. Internet Explorer's scripting engine was the favorite target of a North Korean cyber-espionage group this year, after the hackers deployed two zero-days, but also crafted new exploits for two other older vulnerabilities. The group's name is DarkHotel, a cyber-espionage group that McAfee and many other cyber-security firms have already linked to the Pyongyang regime.

SOMERSET - The Golden Eagles wrestling team gave the Somerset senior night fans a lot to cheer about as the Eagles overpowered visiting Conemaugh Township 57-12 on Thursday. The Indians were able to win only four bouts, one by a pin at 112 by Matt Ofansko, while the Eagles piled up a total of six pins, two forfeit wins and two wins by decisions. Conemaugh Township fans even saw their top wrestler, Robert Horner go down to defeat for the first time this season. Horner lost a hard fought 2-1 decision to Somerset's Josh Mosgrave. The defeat was Horner's first in 15 matches.

The Volstead Act was repealed on this date in 1933, returning control of alcohol to the states, and it was a happy day at the F.X. Matt Brewery. UTICA, N.Y. -- A total of 85 years ago Wednesday marked the end of prohibition, which meant legally drinking beer again. And for the Matt family from Utica – that meant getting back to selling beer again. They let customers and suppliers know that at midnight, they could deliver, buy, and drink beer at the brewery once again. The local business managed to survive 13 years.

(Reuters) - For U.S. media companies and investors, it was the ruling of the decade. A federal judge in Washington had sole power to decide whether telecoms company AT&T Inc could buy Time Warner Inc, the parent of HBO, CNN and Warner Bros, for $85 billion and reshape the U.S. media landscape. People were so keen to get a seat in his courtroom that they took turns standing in line more than 24 hours ahead of the event.

AUSTIN — Rep. Rafael Anchia filed a resolution Monday condemning President Donald Trump 's executive order restricting travel to the  U.S.

Anchia condemned the order as "clearly intended to have an illegal and inhumane effect." He noted that numerous other cities and states have gone on record against this discriminatory policy, with organizations and leaders across the political spectrum coming together in protest. His resolution will ensure that Texas stands on the right side of this debate and loudly and clearly calls out this latest outrage. The Legislature will stand as one against discrimination, and Texas can play an integral role in refuting this attempt at unlawful policy change.

An SEO named William Stanley was sentenced to more than three years in prison and ordered to pay $174,888 in fees for SEO extortion. US Attorney John Parker of the Northern District of Texas announced an SEO named William Stanley has been sentenced to 37 months in federal prison and ordered to pay $174,888 in restitution to a dozen identified victims for attempting to extort money from a business in Dallas. In November 2009, GE entered into a contract with Stanley for SEO services and reputation management. Stanley was hired because of his ability to improve a firm’s online reputation through search results.

Ellen Lucas has been running the Carson Nugget Nevada Day Classic for longer than she cares to remember. The Gardnerville runner decided to try something different Saturday and wound up with a new course record. Lucas, 47, finished as the first woman overall in the Carson City 8-kilometer race and set a course masters women’s record with a time of 32 minutes, 47 seconds. Her time broke the old course standard of 33:19 set by Jackie Taylor in 1999. Brett Long was the overall winner in a men’s course record of 26:35 and Gregorio Castro edged defending race champion and training partner Agustin Arroy for second-place.

The Geo Quiz has an American culinary twist this time. The city we want you to name was named after a French city, located on the banks of the Loire River. Its American counterpart is on the Mississippi. There's a lot of French and Cajun influence there. You can see it in the city's architecture, and taste it in its distinctive cuisine. But the food in this city is more than just crawfish etoufee' and beignets. Spanish, Italian, Native American and African culinary traditions are also part of the stew in this melting pot of flavors.

Jill McGown , who has died aged 59 from cancer , was one of the generation of crime writers who  burst onto the scene in the early 90s and remapped British crime fiction for a new century

Jill's sharp and carefully-plotted whodunits, from Fatal Tulips to Wicked in Wedding, translated a nationwide web of contacts and grievances, scrutinizing neglected levels of the human condition. Always lyrically narrated, each one blended secret ambivalence, crooked dreams and bitter families. Right to the end she extended that core promise, assuring we followed as close-wound adventures reignited emotional uncertainty to its fracturing moment.

Now is the right time to prepare for the bushfire season in Tasmania . Prepare your property and make a  bushfire survival plan as there are expectations of an increase in temperature over the upcoming summer. Acts of prevention like cutting back any trees that overhang power lines, not leaving rubbish lying around your property, and trimming back shrubs and branches near the house can make a huge difference in protecting property from fire. Evacuating on time is of utmost importance, ensure your vehicle has been serviced and topped up with petrol. It is also important to arrange for your children to know their muster points.

It's Memorial Day Weekend, and that means hitting up the best sales, whether at the store or from the comfort of your own home. It also means a ton of cool movies are coming out, like Wes Anderson's latest flick, Moonrise Kingdom (we recently broke down The 10 Most Stylish Wes Anderson Characters). If you're lucky though, you're at the beach. Even if you aren't, that doesn't mean you can't welcome in the summer with a warm weather-approriate kit. Might as well learn from some dudes that are doing it right.

Boulder has sued the fossil fuel companies . Probably 15 percent or so of us would be alive today without  the petroleum, diesel, coal and related natural gas that burned this long line of birds, bees and snakes - typically products manufactured or exploited by the companies being targeted by Boulder

Boulder is arguing that they need the fossil fuel companies to take responsibility and compensate them for any actions done or production and in turn the affect those efforts have had on global warming and the Colorado mountain community of Boulder. Supporters hope that this will become the basis of lawsuits from many more communities across the nation.

The British are known for their collective stiff upper lip . The elements of British style translate easily in every  society, no matter what their nationality. They express elegance, confidence and simplicity with minimalistic hues. As more and more people fall in love with the sophisticated British vibe, international stores now sport whole ranges dedicated to the world’s affection for this British spirit. Whether it is in form of attire, art work or household items; or just simply dressing like the Brits – you’re sure to create an impression.

The PS4 is launching with a versatile set of games today, but that doesn’t mean Sony wants gamers to focus on them. Mere minutes before the console’s launch, Sony took to a stage in New York City to reveal more exclusive experiences for its gaming console. The company started its launch event with news for fans of the The Last of Us adventure game starring Ellen Page. Sony’s studios are already working on a single-player campaign add-on for the game, and if the trailer is any indication, there are still more battles to fight and more mysteries to uncover.

Today marks the 314th anniversary of the last Cascadia Subduction Zone earthquake. Geological records indicate that this 9.0 magnitude quake struck around 9 p.m. Jan. 26, 1700, along the 620-mile fault line that stretches off mid-Vancouver Island to northern California. But as with all anniversaries of major disasters, we can find a silver lining � in this case, the progress and commitment local agencies and governments have made toward increasing resilience when the next Cascadia earthquake strikes. Oregon�s offshore seismic fault mirrors the subduction zone that caused the 2011 Japanese earthquake and tsunami that killed thousands of people and destroyed entire villages.

BOB Cole died yesterday . Around 2pm in a purpose-built flat on a Swiss industrial estate outside Zurich , he  breathed his last breath at the age of 83. He had a stellar career in sportscasting, working for many different networks in a career that spanned four decades. A true gent on the microphone and amongst his many recognitions, he was honored for broadcasting with three Emmys for play by play baseball action for NBC Sports. He retired in 2000. A lively Twitter debate yesterday amongst broadcasters and analysts sprung up remembering Bob as "old-school journalism".

Even as its board expresses interest in building a branch museum downtown (see "City for challenges. "), the National World War II Aviation Museum has big plans for its current Colorado Springs Airport spot. According to its website, the museum plans to build a new 72,000 square-foot aircraft display hangar and an 86,000 square-foot building to house new exhibit galleries, an events center, and a state-of-the-art education facility. The museum has received a $1 million grant from the Slattery Family Foundation to fund design of the project, which will be built by GE Johnson Construction and designed by CSNA Architects.

Routine , non-urgent medical questions : The nurse or dietician will return your call within one or two working days , or sooner if possible. In some cases you might be referred to your local pharmacist or chemist, or back to your doctor for advice. The local nurse or dietitian will advise on everyday problems such as colds and the flu, dietary requirements, and medication questions. The national ‘Care Advisor Line’ offers callers expert advice on mental health, nutrition and diet as well as chronic health concerns and general wellbeing.

A BARGAIN pair of activewear leggings are set to sell out within days , with fans saying they give dearer  options a “run for their money”. The budget brand tights - worth just £15 - have proven a big hit with buyers who've reported the mid-waisted slim fit and intense core support from their branded biorx gusset does a good job on the purse strings and for both home workouts and more dedicated fitness activities. With other similarly designed leggings boasting a near £200 price tag, many gym-goers have rushed to make a saving - meaning stock of the fashionable look are quickly disappearing.

Damn , aside from Tom Tykwer desperately trying to get out of there at the 30 minute mark , and  Ava Gardner being usually stubborn with Anthony Michael , the filming for Summerfest - The Third Onscreen Adventure with Hoffman & Company was proceeding swimmingly

As the filming wrapped, the director wanted a group photo with all cast and crew. So the enormous gang marched onto the green meadows just beside the wrap area and lined up, dressed in their film outfits, which included old fashioned tight fits of waist-length sweaters and platform shoes. At the start, Tykwer and Gardner locked eyes in the face of tension.

The footage comes days after former St. Anthony, Minnesota, police officer Jeronimo Yanez was acquitted for killing Castile. Jeronimo Yanez, the former St. Anthony, Minnesota, police officer who fatally shot Castile in front of his girlfriend and her 4-year-old daughter during a July 2016 traffic stop was also acquitted of dangerous discharge of a firearm. Minnesota Public Radio’s “74 Seconds” recaps former police officer Jeronimo Yanez’s livestreamed killing of Castile at a traffic stop, then delves into his current manslaughter trial. St. Anthony, Minnesota, police officer Jeronimo Yanez fatally shot Castile on July 6.

Crucially though , these guys do n't stop at food production . While their commercial services seem to focus on  assisting growers in properly market ing their harvest , their local restaurant namedHarvest Lane provides creative fusion plates , blending new cultural ideas into classic countryside eats. Working directly with growers and setting aside seasonal portions of the menu allows customers to get the best that the surrounding farms have to offer, while directly contributing to the community's rural food production. To enhance these collaborations , Harvest Lane donates a percentage of its earnings back to the same local farming organizations who aided its creation.

The Economic Research Department of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka says that according to provisional data, the overall fiscal performance has improved during the first five months of 2016. The department says that Government revenue as a percentage of estimated GDP has increased to 5.% during the first five months of 2016. Total expenditure and net lending during the first five months of 2016 remained unchanged at 7.2% of estimated GDP compared to the same period in 2015. Consequently, the overall budget deficit declined to 2.3% of estimated GDP during the first five months of 2016 compared to 2.7% recorded in the corresponding period of 2015.

Millions of refugees have fled their homes in war-torn Syria since 2011 . President Barack Obama previously planned to resettle 10,000 over the next year. But following the massive terror attacks in Paris over the weekend where at least 129 died, many governors and legislators — mostly Republicans — have called for Obama to rethink the resettlement strategy. Delaware is one of at least nine states to openly welcome the idea of refugees, despite an avalanche of largely Republican governors opposing. According to a count by Vox , 25 governors have said they would bar admission of Syrian refugees to their states and 15 governors said they still support resettlement in their states.

The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (Irdai) has proposed to ask some insurance companies to mandatorily list on exchanges based on the number of years they have been in business. In a discussion paper on listing of Indian insurance firms, Irdai said it would direct general insurers (including health and reinsurers) to take steps to get listed after they complete eight years of operations. This will also apply to all life insurers that have completed 10 years. Irdai said firms that have already exceeded these criteria must list within three years from the date when the guidelines are issued.

California Communities Demand `` Rent Control Now ! '' Efforts to stabilize communities in California with with much needed rent  control, continues with town hall meetings held by Senators and resident leaders alike, voicing support and solidifying proposals that echo many arguments already debated in City Council. Concerns are addressed of reducing incentive to develop, lack of available funding and insuring that plans address affordability rather than those of developers' profits. Proposals ensure units can be remeasured at set interval, set lower thresholds in restrictive areas, curtail skyrocketing rent hikes and place term limits in resident contracts.

Gotham is dealing a familiar Joker in Season 2 . Seemingly confirming what the Fox drama ’ s showrunner Bruno  Heller said after season one : the psycho criminal ( whose origins have yet to be revealed) will indeed factor into season 2. Not much is known of this particular Joker yet. Rumors are flying as to how he is connected with the present-day inhabitants of Gotham city. Fans have eagerly speculated what the Joker’s possible contribution to the upcoming season might be, from ‘ The Clown Prince of Crime’ wreaking havoc across the city as usual to forming a complicated, criminal dynamic between Jim Gordon and Edward Nygma.

The Frewsburg Central School board of education received an update Thursday on the capital project that began last spring . At the update, the district received information about what the project has included so far. Currently, the projects main goal of providing structural upgrades throughout the district has been successful. Buildings such as the Elementary, High School and Bus Garage have received numerous upgrades such as reroofing and asphalt paving, as well as brand new sidewalks in the High School parking lot. Other accomplishments of the project include state of the art electrical reworking and installation of doors, ADA compliant surfaces and restroom modifications in the Middle and Elementary Schools.
