It 's hard to imagine that 2001 : A Space Odyssey would have its incredible cinematic impact without that classical  song. After the iconic first frame showing off the awe-inspiring sight of an alien spacecraft among an atmosphere of eerie darkness and suspense, "Also Sprach Zarathustra" or "The Prelude to Also Sprach Zarathustra" from composer Richard Strauss gains an awesome status and accompany us throughout the plot. After this film, many science fiction and cinematic experience captured the influence from "2001 : A Space Odyssey", effectively extending this profound influence to generations upon generations.

Do n't miss this charming 3 bed , 2 bath home on a near 1/4 acre lot in the center  of Upperville. This single story property boasts fresh paint, newly renovated kitchen, stainless steel appliances and laminate flooring. Located near I-270, commuter routes and restaurants, it’s conveniently located but also allows its owners the much sought-after Upperville serenity with its rural appeal and no homeowner association rules or fees. Even if one desired city living and modern convenience the Tysons Corner, Dulles International and the Mosaic shopping and entertainment district are easily accessed with a short drive. Don't wait.

The casino chain's stock moved higher as the company announced new expansion plans. A rendering of Paradise Park. Image source: Wynn Resorts, Ltd.
What: Shares of Wynn Resorts, Limited (NASDAQ:WYNN) were in the money today, gaining 10% as of 11:04 a.m. ET after the company announced expansion plans and an analyst upgrade. So what: The casino operator last night presented plans for a new 1,000-room resort on a lake in Las Vegas, tentatively called Wynn Paradise Park. The resort would be the only lakeside destination of its kind in the gambling capital.

Jill McGown, who has died aged 59 from cancer, was one of the generation of crime writers who shifted the genre firmly into the contemporary world. Although she held fast to the traditional skill of well-crafted plots, she brought a modern perspective to characters and situations, creating a series of thoughtful and engaging police procedurals. She will be best remembered for the 13 novels featuring Chief Inspector Danny Lloyd and Sergeant Judy Hill. Theirs was a relationship that encompassed the personal as well as the professional, and Jill's deft handling of its development was one of the keynote elements of the books.

The "Checkout with Instagram" feature could add $10 billion of revenue for Facebook in 2021, Deutsche Bank says. Instagram users can browse and purchase offerings from 23 top brands in the U.S.
"Facebook is investing heavily" in this e-commerce opportunity, Deutsche Bank says. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg speaks about Instagram during a press event at Facebook headquarters. Facebook added a feature to make its Instagram platform a more efficient place for social media users to shop and buy, which Deutsche Bank believes "can drive monetization" further for the app.

The Brother MFC-J775DW is a low-priced inkjet with very low running costs and a basic feature set for a home-office all-in-one printer. Low price. Very low running costs. Above-par overall output quality, led by very good text quality. Modest paper capacity. Lacks Ethernet connectivity. Can't print from USB thumb drives or memory cards. Non-duplex ADF. The Brother MFC-J775DW ($149.99) color inkjet all-in-one printer is a good choice for light-duty use in a micro or home office. It avails itself of Brother's high-yield INKvestment cartridges to provide substantial savings in ink costs.

Who is K P Sharma Oli? The new prime minister of Nepal, K P Sharma Oli gained popularity in the 1990s for his efforts in the democratic movement that brought down the Panchayat regime. In the next few years, he became a key figure in Nepali politics. Two months after the successful conclusion of the historic parliamentary polls in Nepal, the winning party, CPN-UML on Thursday chose party chairman K P Sharma Oli as the country’s next prime minister. Oli (65) had previously served a prime ministerial term from October 11, 2015, to August 3, 2016.

The storm we're bracing for is the type of January variety everyone prepares for: monitor school closings, check flashlights and stock up on bread, eggs and milk. It's hard to know exactly how any storm will hit until it actually arrives. But there's a foreboding sense about what to expect in the coming days. "We had something comparable in January 2014," said Aaron Reynolds, meteorologist at the National Weather Service in Buffalo. That storm launched Buffalo's first official blizzard in 21 years at the time.

MANSEHRA, Nov 27: Provincial Minister for Haj and Auqaf Nimroz Khan on Tuesday said time was not far when Torghar would be fully developed district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. “People of Torghar remained deprived of basic civic amenities when their area was part of the Mansehra district and they had to travel to other parts of Hazara for meeting needs, but now the health, education and other infrastructure is being set up in the new district which would bring a major change in the life of people,” said Mr Khan while speaking at a public gathering in Nusratkhail, after inaugurating a road project in the area.

Newly anointed McDonald's CEO Donald Thompson gets some perks with his fries. A Big Mac may only cost a few dollars at McDonald’s, but when it comes to the fast food chain’s Big Mac Special Sauce, things get pricey fast. McDonald’s Australia has apparently decided to auction off the first of 200 bottles of their “legendary” sauce on eBay and bidders are emptying more than just their pockets for a chance to purchase the limited-edition bottle. By Tuesday morning bids had reached nearly $18,000 with more than seven days left to bid.

We chose to question the narrative of history by simply quoting words which Churchill used himself . At a glance  it showed that some of our nations heroes contradicted their ideals when asked how it would best achieve freedom. Upon further exploration, it showed an elitist past, whereby solutions that were required were repeatedly promised, yet still seen with apathy and contempt. Colonialism and Empires seemed an essential notion of history, where survival meant hiding any sympathy. This interesting perception in a shallow vein also spreaded itself amongst some Africans as well.

BALTIMORE -- Mayor Martin O'Malley says his role in a new John Travolta film, "Ladder 49," wasn't much of a stretch -- he played the part of a mayor. "I never came out of character," O'Malley said. His one day of work Thursday garnered him membership in the Screen Actors Guild and a $650 paycheck. O'Malley said he will donate the money to the Baltimore fire department's foundation. In the scene, O'Malley's character bestows awards on two firefighters -- played by Joaquin Phoenix and Robert Patrick -- who rescued a child.

PARIS -- France could become the latest country to ban the use of underweight fashion models . France 's health  minister Marisol Touraine said Thursday the draft law will look at how catwalkers, magazine and advertising images could promote an unhealthy body image among young people. The draft law will also include provisions requiring photographers who produce and create anorexia-style images of models to apply labels such as "anorexic photos, not retouched", before the image can be publicly shared. This is part of France's ongoing commitment to reduce risks linked to eating disorders and severe body dissatisfaction amongst the country's young population.

SALT LAKE CITY ( AP ) - Water officials are not quite ready to declare an end to the drought  

Despite recent rainfall and some seasonal snow accumulations, drought conditions are persisting, said Luke Chips, executive director of the Utah Rivers Council. Precipitation has not brought sustained relief across the region, he said. Local water providers have expressed that Utah’s rainy season remains far from secure. Although conditions are slightly improving, hydrologic issues remain a primary concern. Rainwater collections could help remedy current drought conditions. In addition to reservoirs, municipal conservation programs encourage locals to collect and re-use their rainfall.

A high profile heavyweight boxing match at Sands Casino Resort Bethlehem will be broadcast live on NBC Saturday as Tomasz  Adamek will go against Artur Szpilka

Tomasz Adamek, the 41-year-old from Poland and three-time world champion, has a 51-5 record. Szpilka, the 24-year-old from Warsaw, is 20-1. He lost only once in 2015 by knockout to Deontay Wilder for the heavyweight crown. Saturday's fight offers a potential of unscripted fireworks from both men who display fierce punches. Adamek seeks revenge from his 2014 defeat to Szpilka. He said recently he still had burning bitterness towards Szpilka about the loss and looks forward to redemption in the ring.

Johnson prepares to leave key K-12 post at Education Dept . Henry L. Johnson , a major addition to the  staff of the US Education Department, is preparing to depart in two months . Johnson , the Obama appointee to the Undersecretary post of the Education Department, announced his plans today, during a press conference . He has contributed heavily to the area of policy reform and elementary, secondary, and higher education programs and practices in his nearly 3 year term. Throughout this period Johnson fought for innovative approaches that challenged old norms.

Tacko Fall , who stands 7 ’ 5″ , is unstoppable . Likely the tallest player in high school basketball  in Florida , the 18 year old sen ior holds a perfect record so far this season. Many college scouts have been buzzing around watching the UCF recruit dazzle opponents with not only his height but also athleticism and basketball intelligence. In his last game, Fall outreached all of the players from the other team to defend shots near the hoop. With quick footwork, and strength that easily rivals that of a linebacker he can be virtually unguardable.

ARSENE WENGER last night confessed he passed up the chance to buy Didier Drogba – for just £100,000 ! The  striker famously went on to propel Chelsea to multiple titles 

When Wenger was offered a young Didier Drogba at just £100,000, he had just received major European pedigree with the UEFA Cup and having allowed him to stay in France a little longer and as a result he just couldn’t stretch himself at the time, no matter the measly sum being discussed. Wenger looked on as Drogba bamboozled English defenders throughout his glorious career at Chelsea and looking back admitted he regret it now.

A syrah lover finds hope in the Northwest, but sticks to his guns about the failure of many to reach their potential. Several weeks back, I wrote a column about syrah, in which I asserted that this great if temperamental varietal has tremendous potential, but along its journey from grape to wine often gets lost, mugged or tired. You hope and hope and hope, too frequently arriving at disappointment. Syrah is like soccer: 90 loping minutes of play for a final score of 2-1. I love watching soccer, and I love following syrah.

At least 21 people were killed and hundreds wounded in four days of fighting between two rival tribes in the  rural Kenyan area. Residents report seeing paramilitary forces used by the rival parties clashing violently over four days. Both parties used illegal arms including AK47 rifles, machine guns and other guns. Communities located around the town reported they are unable to leave their homes due to fear of being targeted. Residents also raised alarms about receiving threats to stay out of the conflicts. Despite President Kenyatta issuing a stern warning, this week’s violence highlights a worrying lack of peace and reconciliation across the region.

Tropical Storm Selma made landfall on the coast of El Salvador on Saturday with strong winds, heavy rains and risky ocean swells, while another system developing in the Caribbean was on a forecast path taking it toward Cuba and then Florida. South Florida, including the Keys could see between 2-4 inches of rainfall with isolated max totals of six inches. TD 18 is expected to pick up even more speed and continuing moving to the north-northeast today. An approaching trough will then cause Philippe to steer northeastward across the Florida Straits, continuing to be a rainmaker for Southwest Florida through Saturday night with rain tapering off by sunrise Sunday.

Pierre René-Worms, FRANCE 24 | Marco Cecchinato is the lowest-ranked French Open semi-finalist since 1999. Marco Cecchinato, the world number 72, became the first Italian man in 40 years to reach a Grand Slam semi-final on Tuesday with a roller-coaster win over 12-time major winner Novak Djokovic at Roland Garros. Cecchinato, who had never won a Grand Slam match in his career before this year's Roland Garros, prevailed in an epic fourth set tiebreak to win the match 6-3, 7-6 (7-4), 1-6, 7-6 (13-11), becoming the lowest-ranked semifinalist at Roland Garros since No.

A violent thug has been jailed after he unleashed his American pitbull dog on a man who died six days  later. The thug had claimed that he was holding his dog, who was responding aggressively to someone. He attempted to have the man take a different path and claimed to not be aware of his address. However, prosecutors demonstrated how the act was incredibly vicious as the dog was capable of inflicting life-threatening injuries. CCTV and eyewitness evidence helped the judge deliver his ruling. After being charged and convicted, the thug was jailed for a maximum of 7 years and was also banned from owning an animal again.

BAMAKO, Mali – The head of an ethnic Dogon militia blamed for a massacre in central Mali is denying that his fighters were involved in the gruesome attack. Youssouf Toloba also dismissed the Malian president's vow to eliminate the group, because "he isn't the one who created it." Human Rights Watch has said that Toloba's ethnic militia known as Dan Na Ambassagou has been implicated in scores of attacks in recent months. Suspicion immediately fell on the group when at least 134 people were slain over the weekend in an ethnic Peulh village.

MASSENA – Mr. William V. Cameron, Jr., 62, a resident of Olympia, Washington and a 1977 graduate of Massena Central School, passed away August 31, 2018 in Olympia after a brief illness. William is survived by his daughters, Tina and Josh Rozner of Fulton and Natasha Soucy of Rochester; five grandchildren; his sisters, Ann Cameron of Kissimmee, Florida, Mary Martin, and Patricia and Judy Cameron, all of Massena; his brother, Michael Cameron of Norfolk; and aunts, uncles, nieces, nephews and cousins.

In the age of Instagram , food is no longer designed to just be food . It ’ s a  form of artistic expression to draw in customers and show the dedication a chef can give in making unique , but amazing dishes . Restaurants have implemented modern approaches like charcuterie and theatrical dining to cater to the culture of curiosity among young millennials . Specialty diets such as vegan and organic offerings are very popular in today ’ s trendy menus , and the use of fresh local ingredients and cutting edge ingredients, have added new depth of flavor and enthusiasm.

The J. C. Penney Company , the fourth-largest United States retailer , said today that September sales at stores open  at least one year rose 4.9%

J.C. Penney was among many U.S. retailers posting improved monthly figures amid consumer spending remaining at near decade high levels. Company CEO, Jill Soltau said, "I am pleased that customers have responded positively to our merchandise as they spend across more occasions." J.C. Penney sales lifted by categories like apparel, Sephora beauty and home furnishings despite lower average sales than it registered in its 2018 third quarter, due largely to stores being closed last year during bankruptcy.

Although state trademark registration offers fewer benefits than trademark registration with the United States Patent and Trademark Office , state  trademark registration offers protection within a particular state. Some states also require businesses to possess a valid trademark to register and protect their businesses as state trademarks can be acquired quicker than a US federal registration. Businesses that pursue interstate commerce should generally consider pursuing both federal and state trademarks to receive the maximum trademark protection in the United States. This is especially beneficial for smaller businesses as the costs associated with state trademark registration can be significantly less than federal registration.

Why do we only hear about Jasper Johns when he gets ripped off? Jasper Johns is the greatest artist alive. It seems a shame that he only enters the headlines when people rip him off. Johns was in court this week to give evidence against a Queens, New York foundry owner, Brian Ramnarine, who has now pleaded guilty to faking one of the artist's works. It was a bronze version of one of the most iconic of all American paintings: Flag. Johns had made four bronze copies of Flag in 1960 at Ramnarine's foundry.

The ex-girlfriend of the football star whose plane disappeared has spoken out — making a sensational claim about who is behind the crash. Argentine football player Emiliano Sala's light aircraft has gone missing over the English Channel. He had recently signed for premier league team Cardiff City from French team Nantes. Emiliano Sala’s model ex-girlfriend is claiming that the “football mafia” is behind the doomed plane crash in the Channel. Berenice Schkair, 27, said her “heart is broken” and she is “destroyed” after hearing the plane her former partner was on vanished on its way to Cardiff.

The rapper could be heading to jail over child support again. (AllHipHop News) Chief Keef should be sitting in jail, according to the mother of his child. According to reports, the 23-year-old rapper has a baby with a 43-year-old woman named Erica Early, who gave birth to their child back in 2013. Keef is under a court order to pay $2,500 a month to Early, but he has allegedly fallen behind or is simply refusing to pay the bill. Either way, Chief Keef will have to head into court on December 14, where a judge will make a ruling.

What Motivates People To Break The Rules At Work ? A look at what drives workplace rule-breaking , and when  it’s seen as unacceptable

There have been many discussions as to what really drives people to break the rules at work. More often than not it stems from pressures at work. Many times they’re pressed for time, the workplace is rife with overworking, unpaid overtime or expected quick turnarounds, leaving staff frustrated and unable to deliver to the same high expectations, so decide to cut a corner, believing there to be some room for maneuver.

The star even added another chapter to his life to spend with the team in late 2019, when he joined as the Managing Partner of the Express. During this partnership he has led the round rock organization with high expectations while forming positive relations between fans, management, and staff alike. Since Nolan’s ownership the Express have taken success to all levels, elevating Round Rock's prospects through frequent achievements and collective, combined force.

Under construction at 664 North Michigan Avenue, the former site of the Terra Museum of American Art, The Residences at the Ritz-Carlton give every indication that they will indeed be, well, ritzy. Flying buttresses, carved panels, and a crown of lighted art glass will adorn the exterior of the 40-story building, which was designed by the architect Lucien Lagrange with an eye toward the art moderne look of the 1930s. The 88 condos, with interiors by Darcy Bonner, will feature large windows and wide-plank floors, as well as such modern features as a portable control panel for the audio and security systems.

A shopping bonanza has hit Bawadi Mall, and will continue until May 1, as part of Retail Abu Dhabi (RAD). More than 60 retail shops are taking part in the shopping fiesta, where shoppers can expect sweet bargains. It’s National cheese ball day and Trader Vic’s JBR in Hilton Dubai Jumeirah will be giving diners a chance to feast on all the cheese balls they can eat for Dh99, all through the evening (6pm-1am). Call 04-3182530. The Parisian bistro in Jumeirah Lake Towers Cluster A, is celebrating women, every Wednesday between 8pm and midnight, offering free flowing beverages.

Consol Energy was a winner within the metals & mining industry, rising 99 cents (3.1%) to $32.99 on average volume. Consol Energy ( CNX) pushed the Metals & Mining industry higher today making it today's featured metals & mining winner. The industry as a whole closed the day up 0.3%. Many Alberta small-business owners, who have been struggling through a prolonged economic downturn, are hoping the next provincial government will bring relief through business-friendly policies. The Alberta election is April 16 and polls suggest that Rachel Notley’s ruling New Democrats will be replaced with Jason Kenney’s United Conservatives, which have campaigned to scrap the carbon tax and loosen some labour rules that have driven up business costs. Over the past two years, small-business confidence in Alberta has reached the lowest levels ever recorded in the country, according to the Canadian Federation of Independent Business, which has been tracking the measure for about 20 years.

Find your happy place with Peace , the app described as a surreal exploration through sounds such as rain ,  rainbows, plants, crystals and stars. Peace is here to help make all of your wildest wishes come true. Taking cues from different forms of therapy, it encourages mental and physical relaxation for stress-relief in a different world. Incorporating calming breathing, music and guided meditations to improve well-being, it makes for an authentic tool for stress relief and guided meditations. Making it possible to access nature from virtually any place around the globe and crafted from some of the planet’s rarest, unheard sounds.

( CNN ) -- France 's Michel Desjoyeaux won the Vendee Globe solo round the world yacht race for a  record breaking second time. Desjoyeaux, 58, finished his mammoth voyage around the world with no stopovers and only half-an-hour rest per day by returning to the start in Les Sables d'Olonne on Tuesday. It took him 84 days, two hours and three minutes to complete the nearly 28,000-mile voyage. In celebration, a big festival was arranged and people gathered at Les Sables d'Olonne, with French Minister of Sports Laura Flessel presented him a golden medal on behalf of the President of France.

Security researchers at Kaspersky Lab say they've discovered the first virus designed to infect iPods. Called "Podloso," the bug is a "proof of concept" virus, which means it was made to prove it could be made, not necessarily with any malicious intent of releasing it into the wild. Two other factors that ought to let you sleep a little easier: Your iPod has to be running Linux for the virus to activate. And it only damages program files with the .elf extension. Which makes us wonder if this thing really deserves to be called an "iPod virus."

Angela Mahoney , 52 , of Bentley , scooped �75,000 on the Irish Lottery and could now win another million  pound top prize. The analysis performed by the team’s members, some of whom acted as observers during 2013 local elections in Estonia, revealed that sophisticated attackers, like those employed by nation states, could easily compromise the integrity of the country’s Internet voting system and influence the election outcome, often without a trace. The team chose to analyze the Estonian system because Estonia has one of the highest rates of Internet voting participation in the world—over 21 percent of the total number of votes during the last local election were cast through the electronic voting system.

ROCHESTER – Nathan Bastian scored the game-winning goal as the Binghamton Devils defeated the Rochester Americans in overtime , 4-3 . Nathan's shot propelled Binghamton to a 5-0 start to the season and also allowed the team to end their longest ever winning streak. The last time Binghamton ended the winning streak of their opponents was six seasons ago against the Albany Devils. The back-and-forth game included nine different players who all tallied a goal. Amerks fans stood throughout overtime, almost willing Rochester to find a fourth and last-minute winner, however the efforts of the Devils proved to be too great as they flew away with all the points.

Born June 9th, 1951, Willem "Wim" Smith passed on August 2nd, 2017. Wim was the son of Raymond and Margaret May Smith who both preceded him in death. He is survived by three brothers; Cole (Toni), Gage, and Scott (Piper). Wim was a native son of the State of Nevada and lived in several Western Nevada locales however his most favorite place was "The Moon" located in northern Elko County near Wildhorse Reservoir. Wim was a long time building contractor in Carson Valley and built many fine custom homes in the Valley.

OAKLAND — Nine people living in East Oakland discovered over the past nine months what it ” s like to  coexist, the premise behind intentional communities. Intentional communities, made popular in the 1970s, center on living and collaborating with people with similar philosophies in an environment that welcomes change. It is not only limited to likeminded individuals as partners of people of varying ages, gender, and beliefs are also welcomed. Participants participated in three retreats, wherein activities included civic education on gender roles and egalitarian communication to brainstorm ideas on transportation and emergency planning.

Northside Step Team performs at Seattle Theatre Group’s Global Dance Party at the Moore Theater. She directs the Northside Step Dance Team in Shoreline, and last year, her team used their dance routine to protest the police shootings of unarmed black people. Step dancing has a rich cultural history. It became popular in the United States in the early 1900s at historically black colleges and universities. But it started even farther back. “It started historically back in Africa with certain tribes using it, and then through slavery as a way of communication, so there’s a lot of call and response,” Darnesha said.

Amazon.com's purchase of Austin-based Whole Foods Market is showing up in the wine category. As this year ends, Amazon has shut down Wine.Woot and its own wine marketplace in favor of Whole Foods' expansive wine operation. Now that Amazon owns Whole Foods, a licensed seller of wine, it comes under different state laws and can't sell directly from a producer. As a result, Dallas entrepreneur Matt Rutledge sees an opening in the marketplace. When Amazon.com purchased daily deals site Woot.com, based in Carrollton, in 2010 it also acquired Wine.Woot, a direct producer-to-consumer website that Amazon adopted for its own wine marketplace.

HARRISBURG , Pa. ( AP ) — Pennsylvania State Police say car accidents killed seven people and injured 315 others  during this Memorial Day weekend. Officials noted that three of the fatal crashes involved people not wearing seatbelts, urging motorists to buckle up. Roadside operations have increased to reduce risks for the increased travel the holiday weekend brings. Although, so far troopers had reported an overall decrease in impaired-driving, hit-and-run, speeding and aggressive driving violations compared to the 2018 Memorial Day weekend. Law enforcement from various police departments conducted patrol activities and multiple agencies coordinated check point efforts to educate motorists about safe driving practices.

The U.S. government is charging that Google is systematically paying women less than their male counterparts . Testifying in a  Senate committee hearing, the US Equal Employment Opportunity Commission chair Victoria Lipnic alleged that "there was systematic compensation disparity. Google responded to the charges, explaining in a written statement that their team worked to address the wage discrepancies but claiming "there was no gender pay gap at the company". Best Buy Co. Inc. shares surged 9% in premarket trade after the electronics retailer's fiscal third-quarter profit and revenue sailed past estimates. Best Buy said it had net income of $107 million, or 30 cents a share, in the quarter, up from $54 million, or 12 cents a share, in the year-earlier period. Adjusted per-share earnings came to 32 cents, well ahead of the 25 cents estimate from analysts polled by FactSet. Revenue rose to $9.38 billion from $9.33 billion, also ahead of the FactSet estimate of $9.11 billion.

AFC Fylde ’ s match at Torquay United has been postponed following a Friday morning pitch inspection at Plainmoor . Shares in Premier Foods shot up five per cent earlier today after the Mr Kipling and Hovis group said it expected to meet its full-year profit expectations. The St Albans-based group said sales at its eight power brands, including Mr Kipling, Bisto and Ambrosia, increased by 2 per cent sales in the three months to the end of September. Salads from McDonald's have been linked to more than 500 cases of an intestinal illness in the US. More than 500 people in the US have become sick with an intestinal illness after eating McDonald's salads, according to health officials. US federal health officials have confirmed more than 500 cases of the intestinal illness linked to the salads. The illnesses reported earlier this year are linked to the cyclospora parasite, which can cause diarrhoea, intestinal pain, nausea or tiredness. The Food and Drug Administration said on Friday that 507 cases have been confirmed in 15 states and New York City.

A Houston district court judge who lost a re-election bid on Tuesday is facing criticism for releasing a majority of the juvenile defendants who appeared before him Wednesday after allegedly asking them whether they planned to kill anyone. District Court Judge Glenn Devlin, a Republican, lost his seat Tuesday to Democratic opponent Natalia Oakes — in a wave of 59 conservative jurists who had been ousted by Harris County voters, NBC Houston affiliate KPRC reported. And on Wednesday morning, Devlin had made a decision that shocked Steve Halpert, juvenile division chief for Harris County's Public Defender's Office.

Tropical Storm Selma made landfall on the coast of El Salvador on Saturday with strong winds , heavy rains and  a powerful storm surge. Selma swept up the entire country, toppling trees and inundating rivers. Coastal areas reported severe flooding as huge waves pounded their shorelines. Heavy rainfall left parts of the capital city flooded and overflowing river banks caused serious damage and affected hundreds of people in the region. All flights have been canceled, power has been knocked out in some areas and major roads have been closed due to severe flooding and falling debris.

WATCH: Sunday marked the third anniversary of B.C. declaring a public health emergency because of the overdose crisis. As Kristen Robinson reports, the city was flying flags at half-mast to mark the occasion. The flag atop Vancouver’s city hall was flown at half-mast on Sunday as the city marked the lives lost in the province’s ongoing overdose crisis. Sunday marked the third anniversary of the province declaring the overdose crisis a public health emergency. In the 1,090 days since then, more than 3,600 people have died of overdoses — more than 1,000 of them in Vancouver itself.

The Toronto real estate market is showing signs of stirring from its deep freeze , with new listings starting to  bounce back. The European Commission is considering legal action against EU member states to protect farm animals from suffering in hot weather . The proposal by the European Commission, would set minimum requirements for temperatures, bedding and air conditioning for cows, pigs, poultry, sheep and goats. It also calls for greater transparency, to prevent a lack of compliance among animal producers. Furthermore, better national standards for species-specific levels of physical and mental stimulation are proposed to keep animals in healthy environments. If members don't act, the European Commission could launch infringement proceedings.

TOPEKA (AP) - A bill that would rescind restrictions on the development of private property near historical sites has been approved by the Kansas Senate, despite pleas from preservationists to delay the vote. The bill approved Wednesday repeals state restrictions on the development or renovation of buildings within 500 feet of a historical building in a city, or 1,000 feet around sites in unincorporated areas. It now goes to the House for a vote. Currently, property owners must notify the state Historic Preservation Office in advance if they want to substantially alter properties near a building that's on the state or national Register of Historic Places.

Bavarian farmers are angry that their famous Alpine dairy cows will apparently have to wear nappies under European Union environmental laws. Johann Huber, whose family has farmed on the mountain slopes of Gmund am Tegernsee for over 400 years, has begun putting home made nappies on his 18 diary cows to avoid falling foul of an EU fertiliser ban. Mr Huber said that his cow Doris had behaved well when he fitted her with a home made bovine nappy to prevent her dropping cow pats on the Alpine slopes. "We have no standard nappies, they have not been developed commercially yet," he said.

North Korean hacking group focuses attacks on aging and soon-to-be-deprecated technology . Five-Star hackers : High-end hotel data thieves return . Five-Star Hackers is believed to be North Korean hacking group, notorious for targeting the aging technology found in aging routers and other security-limiting legacy hardware. Recently, researchers at 360 Total Security’s Honeynet Team, using de-obfuscation techniques to expose IP information have confirmed a resurgence of this notorious hacking crew focusing attacks on system software infrastructure. By attacking any older systems using antiquated technology, that aren’t regularly receiving security updates and don't have patches readily available, they are more vulnerable to become prime targets.

The rapper could be heading to jail over child support again . Allegedly, Cozart was granted the option to submit an "affirmative defense in response" or allow an attorney to respond in court, but nothing has been submitted as of yet.

This morning, Lieutenant Governor Brian Dubie formally kicked off his third re-election campaign by promising to improve the Vermont economy and strengthen laws against child sexual assault. Former state Representative Thomas Costello of Brattleboro took a step toward returning to Montpelier, winning the Democratic primary for lieutenant governor. Two democratic candidates for Lieutenant Governor are highlighting different issues. Republican Lieutenant Governor Brian Dubie says he’ll be a candidate for re-election this fall.

A new study for The New York Times reveals that the media pay for the top 200 CEOs is now  315 times more than the median income of the general working population. The massive pay disparity among these top executives is alarming. Despite facing drops in pay this year due to the effects of the pandemic, CEOs still earned millions of dollars and continues to outpace even professional athletes who bring in impressive incomes as well. Workers in all areas - retail, technology, financial, health care and other service sectors - cannot seem to make it close to earning a CEO's yearly income.

The NSA spied on Israel despite a US pledge to curtail surveillance of ally states, revealing how the Israelis lobbied US lawmakers to reject the Iranian nuclear deal. The snooping also reportedly eavesdropped on some members of Congress’ private talks. According to the Wall Street Journal, the spying has been ongoing during President Barack Obama’s two terms and continued unabated even after Edward Snowden’s surveillance revelations in 2013. Following the scandal, the Obama administration composed a so-called protected list, shielding close allies from surveillance, including countries such as Germany or France.

Banking giant Standard Chartered on Tuesday announced a return of dividends for shareholders after a two-year hiatus as it reported  strong performance during 2020, driven mainly by an unexpected increase in demand in certain areas of the business. The Singaporean based banking giant has improved its profits and financial performance considerably throughout the second half of last year, surpassing the already high market estimates and surpassing forecasts, much to the surprise of analysts and the industry alike. Standard Chartered saw its underlying pretax profit jump a staggering 47 percent to just over $7 billion dollars.

MILLERSBURG -- If laughter really is the best medicine, then the people who turned out for the inaugural Standup Comedy Night were served a very healthy dose of humor. On Saturday, Nov. 9, 14 performers shared their funniest routines and tickled funny bones in the Buckeye Room at Hotel Millersburg. This casual non-competitive event raised $160 to sponsor four aspiring authors to attend the Wayne Writers Workshop at the University of Akron Orrville next April. It was Denice Hazlett's first-time attempt at standup. "There are a lot of funny people around here!" Hazlett noted.

Ontario ’ s Special Investigations Unit has ended its investigation into the death of a 43-year-old Rideau Lakes man who  died while in the custody of Ontario Provincial Police. The SIU Director concluded that the death of the man had no reasonable grounds to believe that a criminal offence occurred. An autopsy conducted at the time of death showed that he died as a result of cardio-respiratory failure during his physical restraint. The police did not use excessive force or fail to act in any way, and the SIU determined that criminal responsibility for the man’s death was “not applicable”.

With the lessons of 2014 fresh in their collective memory and the 2016 election cycle about to start, progressive groups and Democrats have been making a sustained push to highlight policies to boost incomes for the poor and middle class and fight income inequality. The Democrats on the House Budget Committee outlined a plan in January to create a $1,000 tax credit for every worker making less than $100,000 annually, financed by eliminating some tax exemptions and deductions for high earners. The Center for American Progress released a series of policy recommendations for “ensuring that middle- and lower-income households are the substantial beneficiaries” of economic growth.

The ex-girlfriend of the football star whose plane disappeared has spoken out — making a sensational claim about who is  responsible

Speaking at a press conference, the ex-girlfriend pointed the finger at his arch rival who allegedly sent the star on a business trip where he was due to sign a lucrative sponsorship contract. She claimed the rival threatened to ruin the deal unless the football star withdrew. Witnesses had also reported suspicious activity from his rival, prior to the disappearance. This allegation fuelled theories that the disappearance was no accident and authorities launched an investigation to establish the truth behind this theory.

HERTFORD, N.C. — Hertford police say a 10-month-old boy is dead after a dog attacked him while he was in the care of his grandmother. The Daily Advance of Elizabeth City reports that Hertford Police Chief Doug Freeman said the mixed breed dog bit the child all over his body. The child was transported to Albemarle Hospital by Perquimans County emergency personnel who tried the save the child by administering CPR. The boy died at the hospital Tuesday evening. Freeman said the grandmother fainted in the yard of the home and was also taken to the hospital.

This isn't just a museum; in 2005, the Knesset (Israel's parliament) passed a law declaring Beit Hatfutsot the center for Jewish communities in Israel and around the world. This beautiful facility traces the history of the Jewish people and spotlights the constant evolution of the faith and culture worldwide. Exhibits include artifacts, dioramas and murals. Recent Jewish visitors especially liked tracing their own origins right there at the museum, while non-Jewish visitors found the exhibits educational and engaging. Beit Hatfutsot is located on the Tel Aviv University campus about 5 miles north of the downtown area.

Technology offers new and exciting ways for your children to learn and for you to increase your involvement in your  children’s educational experiences. Access to the internet has made it possible for schools and educators to build webpages, e-mail newsletters and platforms that communicate up-to-date class content. Technology allows students to gain wider understanding of concepts by featuring online-learning applications, where tasks become meaningful challenges, such as following international challenges, quizzes or debate boards.

A FAKE doctor allegedly used useless metal rods to test people for cancer and diabetes then charged a fortune to cure them. Onelio Hipolit-Gonzalez, 73, also claimed the device could diagnose multiple sclerosis and vision problems. Hipolit-Gonzalez was arrested last week in Florida for practicing the sham procedures out of his friend's home. The procedure also involved taking a patient’s blood before re-injecting it back into their bodies. Fox 13 reported Hipolit-Gonzalez posted ads online featuring a picture of him in a white lab coat with Dr. Onelio Hipolit stitched into it – although authorities say he never had a medical licence in the state.

Lunchtime concert at St George 's URC . Third 2018 lunchtime concert at St George ’ s United Reformed Church  in Southwater, was filled with joy and music, lifting everyone's spirit. Audience experienced great performances of variety of composers and were entranced with beautiful choral works. The hourlong program opened with stunning strings of Vivaldi and gave audience the tastes of Rachmaninov, Purcell, Britten, to Haydn and many others. Finishing up the show was the ending treat with quiet selections from Dowland. With virtuosity and heartfelt emotion, the dedicated choir illuminated music that mesmerized their audienceto provide great pleasure and nostalgia.

One minute he was strutting around the end zone, staring into the stands, the look of a stone-cold killer in his eyes. The next, Golden Tate was tossing his helmet to the ground in a fit of frustration, stunned – like most everyone else in Ford Field – at what he’d just heard. The Detroit Lions had a win stolen from them in the cruelest of fashions Sunday, when Matthew Stafford appeared to throw the game-winning touchdown pass to Tate with 8 seconds left, only to have the score overturned on replay and the game ended by a mandatory 10-second clock runoff.

Cristiano Ronaldo, 33, leads the competition's scoring charts for a remarkable fifth year in a row and a goal against Liverpool in Kiev. Sunni Fighters Returning To Al-Qaida In Iraq , 'NYT ' Reports : The Two-Way After months of being squeezed out  by a Sunni-led revolt , Sunni fighters linked to Al-Qaida in Iraq are reportedly finding their way back in several parts of the nation, The New York Times reported. Citing anonymous officials in Iraq and the United States, the Times says fighters are returning, "reenergized and resupplied with cash and new recruits to their cause," because of their opponents' -- local Sunni insurgents -- increased militancy. Iraqi security officials warn the terrorists are rebuilding their positions.

Can You Keep a Secret ? is based on Sophie Kinsella ’ s 4-million-copy New York Times bestseller and centers  on an insecure business woman. The story follows the woman's experience of unexpectedly revealing her biggest secrets to a complete stranger she meets on a turbulent airplane ride. They agree to never meet again, but things change when he becomes the company’s newest intern, leaving her questioning who this enigmatic stranger is and his intentions. As the secret hovers over her job and her budding romance, she faces the daunting question; Can she really trust a stranger with a secret she has shared with nobody else?

HERTFORD , N.C. — Hertford police say a 10-month-old boy is dead after a dog attacked him while he was  in a family friend's care. According to Police Chief Joey Ballard, a Labrador-mix attacked the baby while he was at a home in Hertford Tuesday afternoon. Ballard said a medical helicopter was called to the scene and took the 10-month-old to a hospital in Norfolk, VA., where he was later pronounced dead. The Perquimans County sheriff is in charge of the investigation and authorities do not suspect foul play. An autopsy has been scheduled in the next few days.

THE NEW YORKER waves . Some months ago , he was one of several guests who attended a demonstration of  an urban windmill built by two solar engineers , Bob Smith and Henry Palmer. He was intrigued and moved by the concept. He thought such innovation would be useful in cities around the world and gave it a ringing endorsement. All were patterned on the blueprint the two engineers had developed for the prototype.

A pair of districts in the Midwest will add Muslim women to the ranks of the US Congress for the first time, CNN has projected. Michigan Democrat Rashida Tlaib and Ilhan Omar, the Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor Party’s nominee, will secure their respective seats in strongly Democratic districts following primary victories earlier this year that effectively decided their races. Omar, in addition to being one of the first Muslim women in Congress, will also be the first Somali-American member. She came to the US more than two decades ago as a refugee. Tlaib actually campaigned with Omar ahead of the latter’s primary race earlier this year.

On April 22 , 2014 , Hollingsworth was supposed to drop off 20-month-old Aurora Aryana Hollingsworth at a child-care center 

Hollingsworth called the facility around 10 am to confirm, however when she arrived later, staff at the facility did not have her daughter's name on the sign in list. Confused, Hollingsworth called police who, when unable to find Aurora, issued an amber alert. Aurora was then discovered wandering an apartment complex approximately 3 hours later by a passer-by. Police immediately conducted a thorough investigation and the lead detectives reported that a few hours after arriving at the childcare center Aurora had taken the family's white and blue car.

Testimony began Monday in Carrie Lea Reynolds ' trial . She is charged with second-degree murder in the death of  3-year-old Karl Francis. On Monday, Karl Francis’ parents, Cameron Gray and Kristen Dickerson, both testified about the night Reynolds called 911 claiming Karl had stopped breathing. Dickerson testified Reynolds appeared emotionless when she found the toddler in distress and did not perform CPR before EMS crews arrived. Gray remembered when he got home to find Karl lifeless on a living room couch and described his emotional pain as his son's death sunk in.

Eurovision 2018 was winner Netta Barzilai ’ s finest hour , and moment of national pride for all of Israel  . The storm we 're bracing for is the type of January variety everyone prepares for : monitor school closings ,  charge our electronics and round up batteries . Residents stocked up on essentials, such as bread, milk and snacks in order to have sufficient resources in case of a power outage. Utility companies predicted outages and repair crews worked ahead to keep power flowing if winds forced poles and wires to crash down. Everyone urged caution for walking, cycling and driving with gale-force winds barreling through, potentially downing branches, signs and even rooftops. Those who are facing the threat are a step ahead.

The new law finishes old business in Trenton and expands the so-called Tuition Equality Act, which let qualified immigrants pay in-state tuition. Going to college is not cheap these days. In fact, for many in New Jersey, it is unaffordable. Gov. Phil Murphy’s signing into law a bill that allows undocumented immigrants to apply for state financial aid to help pay for college beginning this fall won’t help all who hope to attend a post-secondary school, but it could help many. With Murphy’s signing, New Jersey becomes the 10th state to extend financial aid to undocumented college students.

(CNN) — Portuguese sailors called it the "Gates of Hell." Namibia's Bushmen speak of the land God made in anger. From the air, the bleak shoreline of the Skeleton Coast looks wonderful -- a deep green sea, fringed with surf, breaks over a shore receding into infinite dunes. From land, it's a different story. The Benguela Current rushes in, urgent and strong, hurtling the chilling Atlantic into the fierce heat of the Namib. Whale and seal skeletons from the former whaling industry still litter the coastline -- the source of the region's frightening name.

He ’ s eaten dog food and appeared nearly naked on telly , but comedian Alex Horne has revealed his  true talent . The 34-year-old unveiled his amazing 'Star Chart' artwork during an appearance on BBC TV show QI. His impressive art shows off an artistic mapping of every star that has ever been visible to the naked eye, complete with every constellation highlighted with constellations listed to mark each individual star. Alex says that creating it involved investing nearly four months trawling databases and collaborating with over 70,000 entries of data, into one chart. Furthermore, he chose the tessellating triadic colour palette to bring balance, consistency and harmony.

One 15-year-old girl from Russia loved sharing her image on social media . She would take selfies whenever the mood  struck and use creative hashtags when sharing them. Though this act was incredibly concerning, it served as a timely reminder for many adults to watch over what their children do and say online. Through more effective parental control and regulation from governments and media outlets, more kids could have a safe and fun internet experience.

What will happen to a living organism placed in a state of quantum superposition? September 22, 2015, 3:24 p.m.
Schrödinger's cat was merely a thought experiment. But now it's going to be tested in real life for the first time. You've probably heard of Schrödinger's cat, a famous thought experiment posited by Erwin Schrödinger that suggested putting a cat in a suspended quantum state where it is simultaneously alive and dead. Schrödinger merely meant it as a thought experiment — he didn't intend to toy with the life of a real, living cat.

With snow falling steadily and the temperature well below freezing , Minnesota Sen. Amy Klobuchar said she 's joining the  effort to provide warm and safe spaces to communities impacted by severe weather

“Extreme winter weather is devastating, and all of us should join the effort to make sure no one is exposed to temperatures below freezing,” she said. Klobuchar’s statement praised the people, organizations, and cities providing homeless populations with access to hot shelters, meals, warm clothes and medical assistance. “There are lives at stake and many other Minnesotans struggling to keep warm and survive this harsh winter”, said Klobuchar.

You may remember Gary Coleman, the child actor from the 1970s show "Diff'rent Strokes." Coleman died on May 28, 2010, in Provo, Utah, from an intracranial hemorrhage. There is much that can be learned from Coleman's less-than-perfect estate plan. However, to understand where Coleman went wrong, some context is needed. Coleman, like many child actors, had a very sad and tragic life. After "Diff'rent Strokes" ended its successful eight year run, Coleman sued his parents for misappropriating millions of dollars in his trust fund.

JERUSALEM — The face-off at the security gate outside the Western Wall one Friday this month was familiar: for more than two decades, women have been making a monthly pilgrimage to pray at one of Judaism’s holiest sites in a manner traditionally preserved for men, and the police have stopped them in the name of maintaining public order. But after a flurry of arrests this fall that set off an international outcry, the women arrived for December’s service to find a new protocol ordered by the ultra-Orthodox rabbi who controls the site.

A pair of districts in the Midwest will add Muslim women to the ranks of the US Congress for the  first time. The new representatives, Minnesota Democrat Ilhan Omar and Michigan Democrat Rashida Tlaib, will make history when they arrive on Capitol Hill, creating a new and important representation for Muslim and Middle Eastern communities in Congress. This victory is an affirmation of the voice of these communities who, too often, are not given the recognition they deserve in politics. Omar and Tlaib’s successful campaigns against well-known incumbents have mobilized Muslim-Americans throughout the US, indicating a collective wish to become part of the national conversation.

Luann De Lesseps Was Caught In A Hotel Room With A Mystery Man Prior To Her Arrest ! Luann De  Lesseps had no choice but to take plea deal in her highly publicised Florida disorderly intoxication case, after being caught in a hotel room with an unknown man.The officer conducting the search of the room noticed a strong odour of alcohol and said De Lesseps was unsteady on her feet. Despite initially denying it, she finally conceded to her probation as well as a 50 hour community service, restrictions to not consume alcohol and mandatory visit to AA meetings twice a week for the entire period.

An SEO named William Stanley was sentenced to more than three years in prison and ordered to pay $ 174,888  in restitution 

William Stanley pleaded guilty to four counts of wire fraud. According to the plea agreement, from December 2016 through June 2018, Stanley received money from more than 500 victims all over the world for website SEO services he claimed he would provide. He instead kept the money for his own use without completing any SEO services. He marketed his SEO services in online marketplaces, including Warrior Forum and Flippa, as well as through website advertisements and YouTube videos.

Could Washington state elect the greenest governor in the nation? All around the country this election season, we’ve got Democrats who don’t want to talk about climate change and Republicans who don’t even acknowledge that climate change is real. But in the Washington state governor’s race, it’s a whole different ballgame. The Democrat, Jay Inslee, is a longtime, outspoken crusader for climate action and clean energy. The Republican, Rob McKenna, is one of a vanishing breed of Republicans who not only acknowledge that climate change is happening but support government action to fight it.

Why do we only hear about Jasper Johns when he gets ripped off ? Jasper Johns is the greatest artist  of his time, his fame rests on masterworks he has created since the mid-1950's. Johns, as it stands, doesn't care what is being said about him. This past year has only solidified the true masterpiece of Jasper Johns' painting. His greatest work this year was his original painting, Homage to Cy Twombly. It was highly acclaimed by critics and viewers, who have highly praised Johns for staying true to the spirit and design of his old-school painter friend Cy Twombly.

How will fuel prices and driving in Europe be affected by Brexit? Following the momentous decision taken today by United Kingdom voters to leave the European Union, a British motoring association has warned fuel prices, driving in Europe and motor insurance could all be affected. The Automobile Association (AA) has said fuel prices are set to rise during a period of instability as the market begins to adjust to the news that Britons have voted to leave the EU. Driving abroad will also change, with drivers having to display a GB sign with the potential of a fine for those that don’t.

Sean Bean has made a career of being around royalty in epic fantasy . He was the heir to the  kingdom of Winterfell in HBO's hit show 'Game of Thrones.' He played the role of an enigmatic resistance leader and 'Lord of the Kingslayer'. In recent years he has had a starring role in the cinematic Lord of the Rings trilogy and has held roles in various franchises such as, playing Elbryan in a Queen's Spirit and Renifer Vot in Guardians of the Galaxy. In 2021, Bean will be featured in Legendary's Kingsman prequel titled 'The King's Man'.

One of the biggest highlights of Valve's Greenlight process for games awaiting their arrival on Steam, is that we get to report on all sorts of wacky, original, unique and artistic games that we otherwise never would have encountered without the system. One of those games happens to be the 16-bit'ish Anodyne, which is a nice mix of top-down RPG adventuring and hack-and-slash gameplay. Designed by two dudes, Sean “Seagaia” Hogan and his friend Jon Kittaka, Anodyne pits players against monsters, traps and pixelated puzzles. The game takes place in a fantasy dream world of the young protagonist named Young.

Many of the supporters of the nearby Sussiya villagers and the settlers residing in the area come together to advocate non-violent resistance. Diplomatic and faith initiatives on the both the national and international levels hope to create a better understanding between all those involved.

ST. PAUL -- Minnesota Wild General Manager Paul Fenton today announced the National Hockey League ( NHL ) club has  agreed to terms with forward Kevin Fiala on a two-year, $6 million dollar contract extension. The 22-year-old Switzerland native was acquired by Minnesota on February 25 from the Nashville Predators and since arriving with the Wild, has tallied 12 points (6-6=12), in 19 games and also added three goals during a postseason run that ended in the First Round of the 2019 Stanley Cup Playoffs. He's collected 96 points (48-48=96) and 26 PIM in 209 career regular season games with the Predators and Wild.

The Four set is gon na need a daycare center ! ET talked to Fergie , host of Fox 's  singing competition The Four

Fergie said that the talent is tremendous but with contestants in their teens and early twenties, many of them had to leave their homes and jobs and "things we don't even realize they need." She explained that while the judges are big on advice, they also rely on a support system of educators and advocates who "protect our beautiful little fam ily and show them different paths."

American troops may have finally left Iraq, but for that nation's citizens the war is only getting worse. American troops may have finally left Iraq, but for that nation's citizens the war is only getting worse. More than 700 people, mostly civilians, were killed in violent attacks last month, making it the deadliest calendar month since June 2008. Nearly all of those killed were attacked in the capital of Baghdad. The sectarian violence between Sunni and Shia Muslims has escalated in recent months, and the minority Sunnis have turned up the protests of the Shia-led government—leading to violent confrontations with police.

Harvest season is back , which means it ’ s time to drive out to the farm stands on the  country roads and stock up on fruits and vegetables fresh from the garden . This season you don't need to wait for the tomatoes and sweet corn that grace the backyard as more and more produce grown by local farmers become accessible for harvest and use. More varieties of produce appear this season that are often seen less often, but grown here as well. From heirloom squash and varieties of apples to miniature root vegetables like watermelon radishes, there is much to explore when looking for fresh ingredients.

If you can't find figs, layer the cream and the crunch here onto whichever fruits are in season. We happen to have a line on super-fresh figs – from the elementary school down the street from us. If you don't know any third-graders tending to some fig trees, however, layer the cream and the crunch here onto whichever fruits are in season; apples and pears now, berries later. You might even play with the mascarpone and toasted pine nuts in savory applications: Dollop cheese onto steak off the grill and finish with nuts.

ANAHEIM , Calif. / Oct. 26 , 2000—Stephen F. Bollenbach , president and chief executive officer of Hilton Hotels Corp.  , was the keynote speaker at today’s conference held at The Hilton Anaheim. Mr. Bollenbach opened the keynote session with his reflection on what changes Hilton had gone through to date, how far it had come and how, going forward, its world-renowned brand would continue to rise. He spoke of continuing the legacy that founded Hilton and encouraged its leadership to adapt with innovation and pride. It would be keeping to that pioneering tradition that would see the company to even greater successes.

The Nicholls softball team staged a strong defensive effort Wednesday night against Southern Mississippi in its home opener at Swanner  Field. Despite the gritty display, Nicholls couldn't make it three wins in three days, eventually losing 6-5. This capped off a strange week that featured road trips to LSU and McNeese, alongside a combined 24 hours of bus time. However, this time would prove fruitful in both the success on the field and bond off the diamond. With 4 seniors in the batting order, they totaled 6 of the 9 runs scored and inspired the younger underclassmen on the squad with timely production.

The team that brought you driverless cars and Siri is now fighting a new kind of war on information . Apple recently joined Microsoft and Google in filing lawsuits against the US federal government for access to information that its users request in exchange for free public services. These public services include key government features such as electronic filing of income tax forms and electronic distribution of food stamps. Apple believes this creates an unfair competition between its customers and companies offering paid services to get around this requirement. It hopes that with the lawsuit they will be able to force the government to start offering more transparent disclosure standards in these digital exchange relationships.

Perhaps the most ironic and scary part of the whole “ Thank You ” rally was the crowd ’ s  approval when the candidate talked about attacking people who went against his political platform. Many in attendance did not realize that violence and brutality was on the way for them and for many more should this candidate win the election. An attempt to remain quiet, kept most from expressing any disapproval at his talk. In the end, it appears he received the last, lingering thank you that could perhaps end up costing millions of innocent people the freedom they love so much.

BANGKOK (Reuters) - The leader of Thailand’s military junta said on Thursday that Yingluck Shinawatra, the prime minister he ousted three years ago, was in Dubai, where she fled last month to avoid being jailed over a rice subsidy scheme that lost billions of dollars. Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha, the army chief who led the coup, said Thailand would pursue Yingluck through diplomatic channels and police cooperation using Interpol. His remarks came a day after the country’s top court found Yingluck guilty of criminal negligence and sentenced her in absentia to five years in prison.

New Delhi: The ruling Communist Party of India (Marxist), or CPM, is prepared for a fight against the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in assembly elections due in Tripura this year, CPM general secretary Sitaram Yechury said on Tuesday, adding: “Tripura will be the BJP’s Waterloo." Separately, in a letter to finance minister Arun Jaitley, Yechury criticized the central government’s decision to introduce electoral bonds which he said was a “regressive move" and a route for “dubious funds". He said that the bonds will have an effect in the upcoming polls in Tripura as well.

The thorny question of abortion rights is again taking center stage on Beacon Hill and putting some top officials in an uncomfortable spot, chief among them Gov. Charlie Baker. This week Baker, a Republican who supports abortion rights, celebrated the signing of a bill approving $8 million to offset the potential loss of federal funding to women's reproductive health organizations under a new Trump administration rule. That rule, dubbed a "gag rule" by critics, would prohibit federally funded family planning clinics from making abortion referrals or sharing office space with abortion providers.

Selkirk Avenue was closed down for several hours by a fire . At around 10 a.m. Monday , Winnipeg Fire  crews responded to an alarm in an empty building that is still under construction . No injuries were reported, however firefighters confirmed the structure contained several types of materials, some of which could be hazardous. Fire crews began working immediately to contain the flames, but reported difficulty due to the configuration of the building. Two adjacent residential buildings were evacuated as a safety measure while efforts were made to control the fire. City officials have stated they will keep Selkirk Avenue closed while they conduct an investigation into the cause.

After a recent update to Adobe's Creative Cloud service, some users have reported having their personal data deleted. The data was apparently deleted without their consent or even a warning. The bug has only affected Mac users who installed the update to Creative Cloud and then logged in using their Adobe accounts. Once the users signed in, Creative Cloud activated a script which deleted the contents of the first folder in their computers root directory. Mac users, who use the data backup service Backblaze, ended up being hit the hardest by the bug.

The Mountain Home Lady Bombers held the No. 4 ranked team in Class 5A to five field goals over the entire game in a defensive clinic Friday night at The Hangar. Mountain Home outscored Paragould 17-3 to end the game to take a 30-16 victory over the Lady Rams in 5A-East Conference action, creating a three-way tie for second place in the league. The Lady Bombers shot only 9-of-28 (32 percent) from the field in the game, but the hosts held Paragould to only 5-of-22 (22.7 percent) shooting. The score was tied 13-13 early in the third quarter as points were hard to come by for both teams.

FERGUSON , MO ( KPLR ) - The crisis in Ferguson has left residents on edge , especially the elderly  population . Local churches have taken notice and are helping the residents cope. They are visiting the senior citizens’ homes and doing what they can to make them feel safe in the midst of this unrest. Counselors are also lending support by visiting the residents regularly. Local soup kitchens and other non-profit organizations are increasing outreach services as well. More law enforcement officers and representatives from city hall have joined in these efforts. There is now more cooperation and respect in the efforts to secure the senior citizens’ well-being.

The Children's Center held an "opening ceremonies" Monday night. Jonathan Northcott, 14, is recovering from a leg surgery and has been living at The Children's Center since June. Northcott sang the National Anthem during the opening ceremonies. "That was actually my first time ever singing in front of a big crowd. I've never sang in front of anyone before. I was nervous," Northcott said.

In a small way , we made history . Last Saturday , an ad hoc group of citizens interested in  preserving our neighborhood successfully took steps to prevent a property from being demolished

The percentage of overweight and obese adults in Lancashire is almost 1 % higher than the national average ( 64.7  % ). The report states that around 46 % of children in the age group 2-4 years in the county are overweight or obese, almost double the figure for England, which is 23 %. Many attempts have been made in the county to raise awareness and encourage healthier living, but the problems faced with rising poverty levels and the geographical area of Lancashire which has historically lagged behind its fellow regions, it's proving difficult. Even with significant Government investment to date, this is still a very real issue.

I was delighted to read in Eureka Street Ruby Hamad’s passionate protest that she and other Muslims should not constantly be called to account for the vicious behaviour of IS. Still less to be stigmatised until unnamed Muslim leaders disowned it. I was disconcerted to see so many Eureka Street readers appeared to agree with the demands against which she protested. Both Ruby’s complaint and the responses to it reminded me of the attitudes taken to Catholics in an earlier generation. The popular charges against Catholics were honed in the Great War and particularly by the referenda on Conscription.

Meanwhile, other top-level action continues as European regulators begin delving into VW’s emissions behaviors and as 27 state attorneys general in the United States develop a potential criminal case against the German automaker.

( CNN ) — Portuguese sailors called it the `` Gates of Hell . '' Namibia 's Bushmen speak of  a sprawling, forest-ringed pool the depths of which plunge so deep that those who peered in found darkness never ends. Now scientists have used sonar to get their first look at what's actually inside one of Africa's biggest lakes, an otherworldly liquid presence which promises untold surprises as it sits unexplored. Stretching 400 kilometers from Namibia into Botswana and from there into Angola, Lake Guinas has depths up to 204 meters and depths still undetected by the sounding equipment of the team.

China began three days of national mourning for the victims of the May 12 earthquake , restricting access to entertainment  to curb revelry. Mourning activities spread all over China, in schools, companies and entertainment venues, symbolized by national flags hung at half-mast. Members of the ruling Chinese Communist Party, who make up most of China's population, were called upon to conduct religious activities and show empathy and kindness towards fellow citizens affected by the earthquake. President Hu Jintao paid tribute to the dead by attending services and meeting rescue workers.

What 's the difference between bipolar I and bipolar II ? Bipolar disorder is a mental health condition that causes  extreme changes in mood, energy, and activity levels. Bipolar I disorder is marked by a manic episode, which typically last for at least one week and is characterised by feelings of euphoria or hyperactivity. Mania can also include delusional thoughts. Depressive episodes also occur and may last for several weeks, accompanied by feelings of hopelessness, low energy, and loss of interest in activities. Bipolar II disorder involves only a major depressive episode with at least one hypomanic episode.

An increased use of critical thinking has been a dying trend for quite some time, and if not dealt with it could mean a perpetual twilight in logical conclusions and creativity.

A local nonprofit whose mission is to transform the lives of at-risk youths will host its sixth annual fiesta fundraiser next week. Supporters of Save Our Youth, or SOY, will be able to sip cocktails and sample appetizers from Taco Rosa Catering on the Halecrest Club's patio in Costa Mesa, while they browse items up for silent auction or buy raffle tickets. Then, during a live auction, a Mexican buffet will be served. Tickets for the event, which is set for 5:30 p.m. April 25, are $60 per person if purchased in advanced or $75 at the door.

The proxy owner and publicity officer of a private event-organising company , who were arrested on charges of organising the  company’s annual party in Bengaluru while flouting safety guidelines due to the COVID-19 pandemic, have been released on bail

The two accused had allegedly contravened orders issued by the District Magistrate under the National Disaster Management Authority and the Government of Karnataka during the festive season. According to sources, hundreds of participants, without taking any safety measures, took part in the function causing it to be declared as a hotspot for transmission.

After delivering a blockbuster such as Meri Gurriya , writer Radain Shah is on a roll as her story explores  family secrets and dark forces to prove her own innocence. Radain Shah's writing took an edgy twist in her newly released work - 'The Spider's Lair', where she addressed issues like revenge, longing and preys running into the darkness of despair. Set in London and other such exotic places, the tale became an engrossing mix of obsession, mistrust, trauma and lies which try to destroy the balance and order of the families involved.

In a democracy, it is said, we get the government we deserve. The same can be said of bestselling guru prescriptives. Malcolm Gladwell's new book What the Dog Saw, a compilation of some of his favorite New Yorker pieces, has drawn both praise and criticism. Personally, I'm not a big Gladwell fan. Shoot me. I'm told he's an interesting person. And he knows how to tell a good anecdote. But, at the risk of oversimplifying my critique of his work ... he oversimplifies.

BATON ROUGE—Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin is warning voters to be aware of who they discuss their private information with in light of a potential voter registration scam that surfaced this week. While our office has not received reports of the potential scam in Louisiana, election officials in several states have confirmed residents receiving calls impersonating an organization that provides voter registration assistance. The callers are offering to register residents over the phone, and in some cases, to send the voter an absentee ballot. In Louisiana, residents cannot register to vote or request an absentee ballot by phone.

ASTANA, Kazakhstan—Nursultan Nazarbayev, Kazakhstan’s first and only president, resigned on Tuesday, ending his nearly 30-year reign and setting the stage for an opaque succession process in the oil-rich Central Asian country of 18 million people. As his speech hinted, Nazarbayev’s departure from office will not mean giving up the reins of power. The aging leader, who has led Kazakhstan since 1989, when it was still part of the Soviet Union, said that Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, the speaker of the Senate and a trusted political ally of Nazarbayev, will take over as acting president until new elections are held in 2020.

SW Minnesota State at MSU Mankato , 6 p.m. Thursday : MSU Mankato ( 13-1 , 11-0 NSIC last season  ) will be up against the team in one of their opening games in 2020-21. It’s a showdown between the two perennial NSIC contenders, with Minnesota State State the team the Mavericks must go up against in order to defend their Northern Sun conference championship. After their opening success last season, both teams will enter the clash hopeful to start this season off to the same style of competitive form, as each attempt to win their first ever outright NSIC regular season title.

How will fuel prices and driving in Europe be affected by Brexit ? Following the momentous decision taken today by  the British citizens in voting to leave the EU, several countries in Europe are worried about the implications for fuel and travelling. Increased economic uncertainty surrounding the implications of Britain's new trading agreement, when applicable, is likely to be the main concern. It remains to be seen whether British fuel prices will see an increase due to levies that might have to be put in place. Moreover, motorists travelling into the EU and vice-versa may encounter long waiting times at customs to verify their papers.

The Volstead Act was repealed on this date in 1933 , returning control of alcohol to the states , and  overturning a 16-year ban on its production , distribution and sale 

Despite this happy news, not all effects of the Prohibition were quickly reversed. Across the country the social reform movement saw the outlaw of saloons and speakeasies that characterized the country for those 16 years. Communities used the ability of new state alcohol regulations to clamp down further on drinking habits, even expanding their capabilities to women, which many viewed as undesirable to polite society.

Over the next few months , many federal employees will receive performance ratings . Some may believe their ratings to  be unfair due to biased appraisals or because they do not live up to unrealistic expectations. However, an organization-wide investigation found that the current ratings system works overall. A full-scale report on it suggested introducing mandatory manager training so that workers can benefit from constructive performance appraisals in a healthy workplace culture. The Government will be releasing this information alongside other reviews concerning employees in a timely manner in an effort to assure workplace fairness.

SUT-PJ/CJ series tuner modules TOKYO—Sony Corp. announced commercialization of a demodulator and tuner set for 4K- and 8K-capable satellite TV  broadcasting that packs reception performance about ten times greater than any before. The demodulator-Tuner set which offers even high gain reception sensitivity and operates using minimal electric power could form the cornerstone of digital broadcast equipment as development expands. By drastically lowering required antenna sizes while greatly enhancing reception sensitivity, Sony claims they've overcome a critical issue regarding satellite digital broadcast receiver modules. Their reception sensitivity significantly outdoes conventional single frequency/IF for that analog as well as digital reception format.

Some Zimbabwe government supporters say President Robert Mugabe should form a government without the opposition, following an opposition boycott of talks Monday in Swaziland. Tendai Maphosa asked ordinary Zimbabweans in Harare what they think about this latest threat to the power-sharing deal signed last month and reports for VOA. After failing to agree on the allocation of Cabinet posts last week, Zimbabwe's ruling ZANU-PF party and the opposition Movement for Democratic Change decided to refer the matter to the Southern African Development Community. They agreed to meet with SADC representatives earlier this week, but that meeting never took place.

Reporting a 25 percent jump in profits , Amgen ( NASDAQ : AMGN ) also dealt a blow to Seattle 's RexLogic . The healthcare and biotech company highlighted that despite challenging times for many due to the ongoing pandemic, their drug business had witnessed major successes. Their products, Epogen and Procrit, continue to gain substantial traction among US consumers, particularly those facing cancer treatments. The quarterly profit had witnessed a marked rise and gross margin jumped to 78% during the past quarter. On the flip side, this means tougher times for rival RexLogic , whose previous robust financial footing saw them back business growth initiatives.

Meanwhile, Palomar San Diego also boasts a similar guest influx – complete with impeccable reviews from customers as far as Ireland, France and Belgium.
