New Delhi : The ruling Communist Party of India ( Marxist ) , or CPM , is prepared for a  state-wide electoral campaign against the recently-elected right-wing BJP led coalition. The CPM has made clear its opposition to the policies of the BJP and is rallying the party cadres across Kerala to protest against the new regime and their centralised politics. It will organise massive public meetings and build the mass campaigns in all 20 districts. Party Secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan and his comrades plan to activate young voter base who might have tilted to the right during the recent election and their objective will be to rejuvenate the left in Kerala politics.

A Manitoba woman has been sent to prison for hiding the remains of six infants in a rented storage locker, but court never heard an explanation as to what prompted her to hide the babies she conceived over many years. Andrea Giesbrecht, 43, bit her lip and looked straight ahead, but showed little emotion as she was sentenced Friday to 8 1/2 years. Provincial court Judge Murray Thompson said Giesbrecht’s moral culpability was extreme and the sentence needed to be strong enough to denounce her behaviour. “These were newly delivered infants, our most vulnerable,” Thompson said in his decision that was livestreamed by Winnipeg media.

Australia's Cordell Jigsaw Zapruder has got a toe-hold on New Zealand's reality TV, buying Greenstone TV for an undisclosed sum. The Australian television production firm, which was formed from the merger of Cordell Jigsaw and Zapruder last year, expects to complete the deal in the coming few weeks, it said in a statement. The acquisition aims to build a stronger platform in the trans-Tasman market, which CJZ says is dominated by European and US formats. Greenstone's "creative output dovetails perfectly with the successful and original content we provide networks here in Australia and internationally," CJZ managing director Nick Murray said.

One minute he was strutting around the end zone , staring into the stands , the look of a stone-cold  killer upon his face. He pumped his fists in the air after each made field goal, determined to savour this sweet moment of success. After receiving hugs from his fellow players and well-wishers, he then had one thing left to do before this joyous celebration could be completed - perform the game-winning tackle. Tackling with conviction and courage, he capped off an epic season as an accomplished defensive end in a most unexpected fashion, almost dragging an offensive lineman out of bounds as the clock ran out.

LOS ANGELES ( AP ) — The Oscars are adding a new category to honor popular films and promising a  brisker show 

The announcement Tuesday follows a review by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences and pushes the annual telecast an hour earlier, to 8 pm Eastern on February 24. In addition to the newly introduced "Outstanding Achievement in Popular Film," other changes for 2019 include announcing awards for categories such as cinematography, editing, makeup and hairstyling during commercial breaks with "thank you" messages being presented during the telecast.

ASHEVILLE — Asheville police are requesting public assistance to find a woman wanted on six open warrants including trafficking drugs and larceny. The department said Monday it is searching for Denise Nicole Williams. Williams, 26, has outstanding warrants for larceny, failure to return rental property, trafficking opium or heroin, two counts of possession with intent to manufacture, sell or distribute a Schedule II controlled substance and possession of drug paraphernalia.

GRAND RAPIDS , Mich. — Democrat John Edwards endorsed former rival Barack Obama on Wednesday , a move designed to  bring a sense of party unity and symbolize an attempt by both men to win November’s White House race. At a packed rally in Michigan, Edwards welcomed Obama by describing him as an experienced leader and reminded the crowd of Obama's steadfast vision to be a champion of all Americans. Edwards thanked supporters and proudly admitted he was behind Obama all along, despite not ending his presidential run until the beginning of April. This wasn't a normal endorsement from the party front runner either.

AFC Fylde’s match at Torquay United has been postponed following a Friday morning pitch inspection at Plainmoor. The match had been in doubt following the week’s cold weather and a decision was made after an 8.30am inspection. A Torquay statement read: “The South West suffered heavy snowfall on Thursday, and it has made travel a near impossibility for home and away fans, as well as travelling teams. “Due to the current travel conditions the club is closed today. “We hope that everyone has remained safe during this time, and look forward to welcoming everyone back to Plainmoor soon.

Australia 's Cordell Jigsaw Zapruder has got a toe-hold on New Zealand 's reality TV , buying Greenstone TV for  $6 million

With their sights set on New Zealand, Cordell Jigsaw Zapruder are planning to expand their empire as New Zealand's dominant producers of reality tv. While reality shows, as well as soaps, news and more factual programming, will feature strongly in the portfolio, other documentary and comedy programmes could also be in the offering. In the midst of the covid-19 pandemic, cordell is still proceeding with their big spending ambitions.

The OLCC is cracking down on marijuana retailers that sell to minors . PORTLAND , Ore. – A rule increasing  the fine on recreational marijuana retailers who illegally sell to minors has gone into effect in Oregon. The Oregon Liquor Control Commission (OLCC) established the stricter regulations last November as a warning that retailers face higher risks and penalties if they break the rules. In Oregon, marijuana dispensaries and stores selling products to minors face penalties that may include, among other actions, suspensions, fines or the permanent cancellation of their OLCC license. The OLCC encourages both employees and the public to be extra vigilant of underage customers.

Barack Obama’s presidency has coincided with immense growth of social media services like Facebook and Twitter. And today, the White House released the Social Media Archive, a searchable collection of more than a quarter million posts across more than 100 different Obama Administration accounts. The idea? To make it possible for those interested in the administration’s activities over the last eight years a way to surface just about any social media activity related to topics in which they’re interested. The tool makes it easy to plug in search terms and then see an exhaustive collection of all posts that match.

Why Did This Woman Walk Away From Earning $ 600,000 ? It takes a lot of courage to quit your  high paying job and not worry about the salary drop you'll incur but that's exactly what Jessie Amatayakul chose to do. After making a well paying $600,000 yearly income working in high-powered Los Angeles legal practice, she decided it was time for a lifestyle change. Jessie packed up her bags and moved to her family's remote cattle farm in Wyoming to live off the land, run the family business, and forage for wild mushrooms and other goodies with her brothers.

Against the odds, Auburn Smith, 16, has become a nationally ranked wheelchair tennis player. She will participate in the USTA-ITF Junior Wheelchair Tennis Camp. PORT ORANGE — Auburn Smith was born into sports. Her first name largely derives from her father's love of Auburn University, where he has attended football games since childhood. “She loves it when we go to the football games and they're chanting her name,” said Jimmy Smith, her father. She was also born with spina bifida, the most common permanently disabling birth defect in the United States, according to the Spina Bifida Association.

CBS President and CEO Les Moonves has pushed for rights to stream NFL games on the network 's digital service  All Access

Moonves sought this plan with high hopes that it could increase online subscriptions. Though originally, CBS was reported to seek out all Sunday football games, the negotiations with NFL officials began more limited in scope, eventually culminating in the All Access digital streaming plan that it rolled out. This plan meant All Access viewers could stream Sunday, Thursday and Sunday Night Football games live, plus access on-demand video clips and broadcasted coverage of the game itself.

STARSPORT brings you the latest transfer news and gossip from Upton Park . West Ham have had a club-record £31m  bid accepted

West Ham now look likely to have increased their attacking options when they leave Upton Park and move to the Olympic Stadium next season. Slaven Bilic’s side is being further reinforced with another set of defensive signings. Besiktas’ Angelo Ogbonna is being closely followed and PSV Eindhoven left-back Jetro Willems looks set to sign for the Hammers shortly. Valencia forward Sofiane Feghouli is also of interest to the Londoners, with the Algerian expected to join up at Upton Park soon.

At one time, he had 120 peony plants blooming in the backyard of his former home on Hillandale Circle.

Currently a team of 15 based in Bangalore, ConfirmTkt has had a significant increase in traction over the past one year with 20-30% increase every month. “Waiting list” is one term that every IRCTC user hates to hear. Booking a waiting list ticket not just makes a journey unpredictable but also causes huge inconvenience to the traveller. Making situations worst, there hasn’t been a feasible solution to the unpredictability of ‘Waiting List’ for ages, resulting in last minute cancellation of plan. It was a few such experiences that sparked the idea of ConfirmTkt in Sripad and Dinesh Kotha.

Weld District Attorney Ken Buck’s U.S. Senate bid is reportedly coming to an end. Sources have told the Denver Post that Buck plans to drop out of the race. Ken Buck’s wife, Perry Buck, told the Tribune on Friday night that the family is holding off comment on the matter until Monday. Ken Buck announce his bid for the Senate in April, after which he began a campaign swing that yielded good immediate returns. Buck raised $332,655.97 during the first quarter – a three month period ending June 30.

Northside Step Team performs at Seattle Theatre Group ’ s Global Dance Party at the Moore Theater . She directs  the “Doin our Part” Teen Troupe, featuring members ranging in age from 8 - 19, representing schools across Seattle. The Northside Step Team ignited the Moore Theater as they commanded the floor with some of the most thrilling and authentic choreographed stepping they could put out. Kids couldn't stop raving about the Troupe and sang the praises of its group leader long after they had finished performing. With incredible athleticism and finesse the Troupe closed the show to the wild and never-ending cries of "encore, encore!"

AUSTIN — Rep. Rafael Anchia filed a resolution Monday condemning President Donald Trump's executive order restricting travel to the United States for citizens of seven Muslim-majority countries. Anchia, a Democrat from Dallas, described the move as "unconstitutional, un-American, unwise and unorganized." "This was not well thought out," Anchia said. "It was developed without consultation of the folks that are supposed to keep us safe, and the president really messed this up, and he needs to pull it down. The Legislature of the state of Texas needs to demand that he do so."

Could Washington state elect the greenest governor in the nation ? All around the country this election season , we 've seen candidates proposing comprehensive solutions to tackle climate change and transition to a green economy , with Washington state's race at the forefront. Democratic candidate and incumbent Jay Inslee continues to prove his commitment to Washington's role as a national leader in addressing the climate crisis. He is determined to uphold existing progress and build a greener and more inclusive future through ambitious plans and goals, such as pushing renewable energy technology, dedicating public health programs, and spearheading equity investments.

Toronto - A Porter Airlines Dash 8 with 54 on board encountered a UFO at a height of about 9,000 feet as it was making its descent into the Billy Bishop Airport on Toronto Islands. In a statement Porter Airlines said: “The pilots noticed an object in the distance (and) as they approached the object, they realized it was very close to their flight path.” The pilots at first thought the object was a balloon but after debriefing decided it could have been a drone. At this stage the object has not been identified.

Certainly one of the most brilliant dialogues in the ballet is its pas de deux . It was danced excellently  by

Andres Arau and Kristina Karl.The duet featured arched poses and fast-spinning rotations showcasing great acrobatic skill. Both showed incredible technique, with beautifully matched extensions in pas de chat, delicate musicality and fine precision in assembling the steps. Their synchronized leaps in several tricky petite jumps and finishes did justice to the difficult level of the choreography. Ultimately, it ended to tremendous ovations from the appreciative crowd and rousing applause from the judges and ballerinas from different companies and countries in the event.

WINNIPEG — Turning trash into treasure is somewhat of an art form, but the new season of a HGTV reality show will tackle that head-on with some expert help. Produced by Canadian film company Frantic Films, “Buy It, Fix It, Sell It” follows a cast of refurbishing professionals bidding on second-hand items at auctions in Winnipeg and Toronto, only to turn them into designer or collector items and sell them to see who can make the biggest profit. Mike Wolchock, and his brother Joe, are known as the Neon Brothers on the show.

Born June 9th , 1951 , Willem `` Wim '' Smith passed on August 2nd , 2017 . Wim was  surrounded by family as he passed away. Wim will be fondly remembered for his love of life, for the numerous friends that filled his world, and for the deeply caring man that he was. From gardening, bike rides to tinkering in his workshop or finding some obscure science fact and becoming the resident “Prof,” life was certainly enjoyed and fully explored. His tales of WWI “escapades,” singing any old song around a campfire, and storytelling nights still echo in everyone's memories.

A dinner lady who scooped £75,000 on the Irish Lottery could now win another million, thanks to our appeal to find her. Angela Mahoney, 52, of Bentley, used numbers from her late mother’s date of birth to win £75,000 from a £1 stake on a Betfred Irish Lottery game. Betfred have issued this poster to try and locate the mystery woman before 12 noon this Saturday.

Reporting a 25 percent jump in profits, Amgen (NASDAQ: AMGN) also dealt a blow to Seattle’s biotech job market today. The Thousand Oaks, CA-based biotech drug maker announced a huge round of job cuts, 12 to 15 percent of its staff worldwide, and a shuttering of research and manufacturing groups in Washington state and Colorado. An Amgen spokesman told Xconomy its Seattle R&D site and Bothell manufacturing sites employed 660 people combined, with 430 more in Colorado. The facilities will be closed by the end of 2015.

Boulder has sued the fossil fuel companies. Probably 15 percent or so of us would be alive today without fossil fuels since without them we would be living in the Middle Ages without medicines, electricity, real sanitation, etc. Those of us who did not die in childbirth or by an infection caused by a scratch could enjoy living a short life behind an animal pulling a wooden plow. Maybe it would be best if we recognize that fossil fuels had their role, evolve our power supplies to renewable, storable resources, and stop demonizing everyone.

The Bridge City Cardinals are the boys 22-4A district champions in tennis . The team participated in the district tournament  with determination and lots of team spirit. The four singles player from the Bridge City Cardinals each advanced to regional competition as well as the four double teams who will also participate. This team came into the district competition with dreams and left as champions. As a proud coach, their exceptional drive and motivation enabled them to reach this monumental moment for them and their school. This accomplishment demonstrated that working together produces not only great tennis players, but greater tennis teams and exemplary team effort.

The police have uncovered Class A drugs after using its powers of stop-and-search in Central Park. Arrests were made as Cambridgeshire police responded to complaints of anti-social behaviour in Park Ward, with particular emphasis on the park. Police Sergeant Warren Bottell said: “In November and December we conducted two periods of intensive patrolling in the Central Park area. We had different results with significantly more drug users stopped and arrested. In total, 12 full days of patrols since November 2015 have been conducted in the Central Park area, with stop-and-searches carried out between February 9 and 12.

Patient is a 36-year-old male who immigrated from southwest Asia three months ago , and now has a pustular pruritic  skin rash

The patient presented with a cluster of papules and pustules involving his arms, back and chest and also reported having itching sensation. Following medical history and physical examination it was decided to carry out necessary tests to determine whether it was an infectious or systemic etiology. Blood, serum and cultures from the lesions were collected for analysis and empiric treatment was initiated with an anti-fungal cream. Upon histopathology analysis and sensitivity tests for the culture a specific bacterial infection was determined.

Big Data is transforming the way Canadian businesses are able to build meaningful relationships with their customers. Today the Chief Information Officer and Chief Marketing Officer must combine efforts for true competitive advantage. A new market research report called "1 + 1 = 3: CMO & CIO Collaboration Best Practices That Drive Growth" looks at the new realities that are changing traditional roles of marketing and information technology. This report addresses how organizations are aligning their efforts to better understand and interact digitally with their customers and drive loyalty. According to studies by the Conference Board of Canada, Canadian organizations appear to be lagging behind the consumers.

Shimla, Jan 14 (IANS) It was a bright sunny day in Himachal Pradesh on Monday, with temperatures remaining below the freezing point in many places in the state after three days of continuous snow and rain, a weather official said here. Rain and snow are likely to continue in the state till Tuesday, the Met Department official told IANS. Keylong, the headquarters of Lahaul-Spiti district, was the coldest at a minus 12 degrees Celsius. It saw mild snow. Kalpa, around 250 km from here, recorded a low of minus 8.2 degrees Celsius.

An extra $ 190,000 in state special education reimbursement funding that came in late last month has helped the town  of Brick close its fiscal 2018 budget gap

The funding was a pleasant surprise to many in the Brick community. This additional revenue, which is greatly welcomed by the school board and administration, brought the total 2018 state special education aid for the district up to more than $10.6 million. These funds helped bridge the estimated $266,000 deficit from the initial adopted budget. It is evident that this relief from the state is integral in the successful support of Brick’s educators and the 1,900 special education students it serves.

(Reuters) - British serviced office space provider IWG Plc said on Wednesday it would close or refurbish some locations in certain markets, including the UK, to bring its performance back on track after reporting a lower full-year operating profit. The Switzerland-based company behind the Regus and Spaces brand said it was looking to revive its UK operations, which has been hit by a weak property market in London and higher costs related to opening of new sites. The company, which had warned on profit in June, reported a 5.6 percent fall in full-year operating profit to 154.1 million pounds.

Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi routinely lands up at the airport to receive world dignitaries. From the moment a world leader sets foot on Indian soil, Modi's photo ops begin. Who can forget the famous Modi hug reserved for world leaders? Modi's Canadian counterpart, Trudeau, is equally an ace at producing visuals of himself doing things. When they landed in New Delhi on February 17 on the beginning of the Canadian prime minister's week-long trip to the country, the Trudeaus came out of the plane with a namaste, the traditional Indian greeting. But Modi wasn't there to receive them.

Fish oil. Protein shakes. Vitamin D pills. The packages look alike. Does it matter which you buy? It certainly does, according to Labdoor, a four-year-old, South San Francisco-based startup that tests about 50 supplements and energy drinks each month that it buys off retail shelves, then ranks for consumers. What it finds might intrigue you. Vitamin C degrades in water, for example, so any water-based Vitamin C tablets are basically worthless. More than a quarter of fish oil products are rancid on the shelves, even when their expiration date may be two years out.

House Republicans weren ’ t talking about the economy as they left Washington for the August recess before a challenging  election year. Instead, Republican leaders hoped to stay on-message throughout August by showing how eager they were to continue focusing on reducing regulation and corporate tax rates. Meanwhile, House Democrats plan to utilize the August break to spotlight pocketbook issues for working and middle-class Americans and portray House Republicans as proponents of an elitist economic agenda. Some members may take this recess to lead panels with business executives, policy professionals and journalists to highlight America’s wealth divide.

WASHINGTON — Thousands of commuters across the region were delayed Thursday morning by an apparent work action by Metro ’ s workers, leading the transit agency to tell customers they “cannot guarantee trains” on certain lines. Metro employees failed to appear for their shift without warning, citing health concerns. Riders across the region were affected, including reports of frustrated drivers trying to go around stopped or slow-moving trains, including a 30-minute delay for those on the red line at Union Station. Metro buses saw the largest effect with an additional 500+ buses required to cope with the demand from displaced rail riders.

Aged 63 , Bowler was born in Kalgoorlie , completing his primary and secondary schooling in the region and spending  much of his early working life as a jockey. While on a media campaign, it was through a series of chance occurrences that Bowler moved onto photography. Bowler began amassing an impressive collection of sporting history and turned the photographic eye to sport. Bowler became renowned for iconic portraits of cricketer’s, like Sir Donald Bradman, Mark Taylor and Shane Warne.

SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) — A pair of Buckeyes were doing their best to hold off a team with five majors between them at the Liberty Mutual Legends of Golf. John Cook and Joey Sindelar, who have known each other since their college days at Ohio State, shot a better-ball 10-under 62 on Friday to share the first-round lead with Mark O'Meara and Nick Price in the Champions Tour event. Fred Couples, a three-time winner in five starts on the 50-and-over tour, and Jay Haas were a stroke back along with Blaine McCallister-Bob Tway and Brad Bryant-Lonnie Nielson.

Richard Drew/Associated PressThe normally busy trading floor will be empty on Monday . All United States stock and options markets  are closed for Martin Luther King Jr. Day

The New York Stock Exchange and the Nasdaq will not observe trading as this is an American federal holiday in honor of slain civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr. In 1995, the law passed proclaiming Martin Luther King Jr. Day to become an official holiday. Although Wall Street’s traditional 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. hours will be silent today, reports continue to signal optimism and resilience.

ROCHESTER – Nathan Bastian scored the game-winning goal as the Binghamton Devils defeated the Rochester Americans in overtime, 4-3, in front of 8,367 at BlueCross Arena on Friday night. After 17 minutes of scoreless hockey, Rochester scored two goals just two minutes apart. William Borgen scored on a shot from the point that took a fluke bounce off the end wall and trickled in behind Cam Johnson for a 1-0 lead. Victor Olofsson made it 2-0 with 1:36 remaining in the first, beating Johnson on a breakaway opportunity after sneaking behind the defense and taking a pass from Kyle Criscuolo.

The Scimitar-horned Oryx no longer lives in the African desert. It is considered extinct in the wild. But this lovely-looking Ungulate hasn’t been completely wiped out because they can still be found at zoos around the world. It’s just one example of a new role that zoos have taken on: preserving endangered wildlife. The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service lists 361 endangered mammals worldwide. Add in birds, fish, reptiles and other living creatures, that number rises to nearly 1200. That’s why the work of organizations like the Smithsonian Conservation Biology Institute – or SCBI – is so crucial.

Rivals. The battle was not taking place on the gridiron, but in the online chess arena and featured Ohio State's Jonah Bachelor and Caelen Bland against Auburn's Brandon Bright and Gaon Sharma in a showdown of college student chess pros. Bachelor and Bland earned a solid win, putting an end to Auburn’s streak of victories in collegiate chess competitions and winning the National Collegiate Online Championship with a near perfect score of 5-1/2- 1/2.

She further goes on to thank him for his undying support and unconditional love as she faced criticism in the public eye. After learning of her situation and through working on solutions, Michael convinced her to take advantage of her trials. Paula refused to retreat, stating that retreat isn't her "cup of tea", rather she challenges all situations.

ROBIN VAN PERSIE may still leave Manchester United this summer, but it won't be for Qatari side Lekhwiya according to general secretary Adnan Ali. Van Persie's United future remains up in the air with reports suggesting the Dutch striker could be sold this summer. Louis van Gaal refused to clarify Van Persie's future over the weekend, leading to further speculation that the former Arsenal man could be on his way. There's no truth in the news. It had been claimed that Lekhwiya - currently coached by former Swansea boss Michael Laudrup - had put together a £6m-a-year package to lure Van Persie to Qatar.

Minister for Enterprise and Commerce , Max Bradford , today rejected claims by the Engineers Union that jobs created by  government spending programs do not produce high quality work. Mr Bradford defended the claim stating "Government spending in recent times has gone towards infrastructure investment with rigorous guidelines that protect taxpayer money and ensure high quality of service. We have set up independent monitoring programmes to assure a high level of integrity for each of the projects. Through these projects many opportunities for training and skills development are created as we require local industries to compete for the contracts, guaranteeing an outcome with no local or state preference.

Nintendo’s ancient Power Glove remains a part of popular culture because, one, it was an epic, ET: The Game-style failure and, two, because it was a power glove. There’s something about the mammalian brain that just likes the idea of being able to reach out and touch a digital objects — that is the point at which virtual worlds could become credible representations of the real world. Still, most attempts to recreate the power glove mentality, to let you use your hands to naturally manipulate digital objects in three dimensions, have been failures.

He’s eaten dog food and appeared nearly naked on telly, but comedian Alex Horne has revealed his most embarrassing moment on television came when he appeared on Mastermind. The Horne Section front man and brainchild of Dave comedy game show Taskmaster said he came unstuck when he took part in a celebrity version of the super tough BBC1 quiz. Asked for the first three words of The Bible, Horne, whose specialist questions were on the life and career of Ken Dodd, admits he was stumped and had to come up with a joke answer.

Swedish furnishing giant IKEA is still looking to build a new store in Coventry which could create around 600 jobs. The firm is still searching for its perfect site in the city five years after first announcing it wanted to expand into Coventry. IKEA is holding land earmarked for shopping at the back of Morrisons superstore in Binley but is looking for better sites. Bosses were tight-lipped about where else in the city they are considering and refused to disclose where they would prefer. America is voting Tuesday to fill the country's top job opening. The country also has over five million other jobs waiting for the right candidate. There was even a small increase in federal government job openings. It's a great sign that employers want to hire. However, this huge number of openings also signals that employers can't find the workers with the right skills for the open jobs that they have.

Police in Itami, Hyogo Prefecture, said Monday they have arrested an unemployed 45-year-old woman on suspicion of fraud after she made false complaints to many businesses in order to get compensation from them. According to police, Tomoko Onotani called a pastry shop in Toyonaka City, Osaka Prefecture, in May and told them there was hair in a cake she bought from the store, Sankei Shimbun reported. An employee of the store went to a parking lot near her residence and gave her a cake as "compensation." Police said Onotani used the same trick to defraud a bakery in Kobe City of 1,085 yen in June.

American troops may have finally left Iraq , but for that nation 's citizens the war is only getting worse . Terrorist violence continues to be a common problem as Iraqi government struggle to quell the warring religious sects of Shia and Sunni Muslims. The collapse of Iraq’s oil industry means many are being plunged into poverty with the resulting rise of political insecurity undermining the national morale of Iraqis. Though security measures have improved somewhat, more aid from other countries needs to come in to provide the services needed for Iraqis to survive.

Low-income working families are losing hundreds of pounds each year – and being wrongly denied free healthcare entitlements – because of flaws in the way universal credit is designed, campaigners say. The Child Poverty Action Group (CPAG ) said arbitrary rules built in to the way universal credit is calculated leave some families unable to predict how much they will be paid each month, leaving households in debt and unable to budget. It can lead to claimants being wrongly benefit-capped – a penalty designed to “incentivise” jobless or low-earning households by severely limiting their benefits – because the system fails to spot they are working and earning enough.

Fast forward thirty years and now,Nintendo is resurrecting this retro relic from the 90s . Last December they re- released it in Japan with upgrades to the old hardware and as part of a bundle with a classic 8-bit NES game called Ice Climber . The gaming device became a coveted item and is currently sold out and offered at sky high prices on the used market.

May 23 - Egyptians arrive early at voting booth to cast their vote for the first president since deposed leader  Mohammed Morsi

The news was highly encouraging for a number of citizens as some had been involved in protests that called for more democratic rights and greater political transparency. Throughout the country, queues stretched for hundreds of meters at some of the voting stations. Even women with toddlers, along with the elderly and even monks, braved the heat of the day and arrived early, in eager anticipation to make their vote count. Celebratory flags of different political groups and tones of national pride dotted the skies.

MILLERSBURG -- If laughter really is the best medicine , then the people who turned out for the inaugural Standup  Millersburg performance this week in Millersburg must be the healthiest people around. The local event attracted over 40 people for two nights of top-tier local comedians, improv groups and lots of laughs. Born in the country and fluent in the language , Gursewak Singh considers himself Japanese . The government does n't . Recently, Gursewak appealed the Immigration Bureau's refusal to grant him Japanese citizenship on the grounds that he is stateless. Although he holds a UNHCR refugee protection certificate from Myanmar and India-born ID, Japan claims that his blood lineage alone disqualifies him from being a citizen. Gursewak’s only desire was to finally establish himself, permanently, in his homeland. Unfortunately, he has been consistently been denied by Japan despite speaking the language since childhood.

Today marks the 314th anniversary of the last Cascadia Subduction Zone earthquake . Geological records indicate that this 9.0 magnitude  event shook the northwest region of North America in 1700. To this day, seismic and tsunami activity is monitored throughout the area to ensure safety of the inhabitants. The coastal location of the region puts people in a dangerous spot due to risk of fault rupture. However, precautions such as more regular earthquake drills and geologists utilizing improved technology allows residents to remain on high alert to alert others in the event of an emergency.

Teaching language to an artificial intelligence system is child’s play, thanks to MIT. Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology developed a parser that imitates kids’ learning processes by observing the environment and making connections. The system studies captioned videos and learns to associate words with objects and actions. When given a new sentence, the parser can accurately predict its meaning—without visual clues. This “weakly supervised” approach, which requires limited training input, could expand the types of data and reduce the effort needed for training parsers. Annotations can certainly speed up the process, but they’re not needed to learn.

The NSA spied on Israel despite a US pledge to curtail surveillance of ally states , revealing how the Israelis  conducted spying on their political leaders and perceived enemies. The controversy revolves around the information collected about the Prime Minister's office in 2009-2012. US government intelligence officials have identified members of the Prime Minister's cabinet who, among others, were eavesdropped upon. They have gone so far as to say this type of targeted eavesdropping from the National Security Agency is nothing short of a betrayal of a promise made by former president Obama to limit surveillance of American allies.

With the economic noose poised to tighten around Iran over its suspect nuclear program , the Tehran regime is shaking  in its boots. Tehran fears an upcoming September United Nations (UN) Security Council resolution on tougher economic sanctions. Analysts say that Russia, China, France and Germany have negotiated various restrictions on sales of missile components, nuclear know-how, technical services and luxury goods that could seriously damage its ailing economy. The foreign ministry issued an "exhortation and call" to ambassadors around the world this week to try to hinder support for tougher sanctions and thereby preserving Iran's interests.

She said other Ladies in White in Pedro Betancourt were prevented by police from joining them in Perico . HAVANA -

On Sunday, when more than two hundred members of Cuba's largest dissident group marched through the small city of Perico, only eleven members from the Ladies in White movement, known for peaceful protests and resistance against Cuba's communist regime, could accompany them. As indicated by the Ladies in White organization coordinator Elsa Morejon, police in Pedro Betancourt kept back all the other members from joining them in Perico. Members from dissident associations Christian Liberation Movement and Cuba Platform also accompanied the Ladies in White.

SUT-PJ/CJ series tuner modules TOKYO—Sony Corp. announced commercialization of a demodulator and tuner set for 4K- and 8K-capable satellite TV transmission standards. Samples will start shipping in September, Sony said. The demod/tuner pairing is compatible with both DVB- and ISDB-based satellite TV transmission standards, but Sony said it was the first to work with ISDB-S3, the latest satellite version of the digital TV transmission format used in Japan and Brazil as well as several other Asian and South and Central American countries. Test broadcasting in 4K and 8K over ISDB-S3 is scheduled to commence in Japan in August, and full-scale broadcasting is slated to begin in 2018, the manufacturer said.

NSA Director General Keith Alexander maintains that his agency 's tactics are lawful and used against foreign adversaries . The  NSA defends their practice on the ground of providing safety for Americans and insists their approaches are accurate. The government backs Alexander's decision and believes that the NSA is abiding by its procedures by working in agreement with lawmakers and providing insight into its operations to strengthen the oversight process. Even in the face of wide-ranging critique and serious moral debate, NSA continues its commitment to defending the safety of citizens without exploiting civil rights and proper principles of accountability.

Oh, how the mighty ’do has fallen! Disgraced former senator and presidential candidate John Edwards, reviled for his costy coifs on the campaign trail, now places his strands in the hands of the pros at Supercuts, The Post reports. Edwards, who in his political heydey went to stylist Joseph Torrenueva, whose Beverly Hills salon charges $300 to $500 per cut, now goes to Supercuts in Raleigh, NC, for a $12.95 job, employees say. “We just talked about his hair,” said a hairdresser named Leah, who recognized Edwards from a photo.

Veronica Fatia carries her 2-year-old daughter as they travel in a wooden boat to Buzi district, 120 miles outside Beira, Mozambique, on Saturday, March 23, 2019. They left the cyclone-shattered city of Beira for the town of Buzi, which for a week people had been fleeing to with little but their clothes. The young mother huddled on a wooden boat clutching her 2-year-old daughter, headed for the unknown: The flooded town of Buzi, which thousands have fled with little but the clothes on their backs. Fishermen's boats have been ferrying out Buzi's displaced, sometimes scores of people crammed into a single vessel.

Iqbal Survé ’ s Sagarmatha Technologies , which failed to list on the JSE a year ago , has set  its sights on an ‘ over-the-top’ financial listing as part of a revised turnaround plan. To reach this goal, the company has reportedly moved $350 million of shares that were intended to be issued on the JSE in October 2019 to other parts of the group, restructuring debts and initiating the split of the group. With the new plan set to increase Sagarmatha's share price from 575 to 630 Rand, additional senior staff are to be added to management team to bring their products to a global marketplace.

Riders can rent a Spin electric scooter for $1 plus 15 cents per minute, making it an affordable option for short trips. As part of Ford, Spin plans to 'expand aggressively,' giving more people the opportunity to try its service. To start out, Spin is launching today in Detroit. Ford is beefing up its first and last mile transportation offerings. On Thursday, the automaker announced it has acquired electric scooter startup Spin. Founded in San Francisco in 2016, the dockless scooter sharing company currently operates in 13 cities and campuses throughout the US.

My research aims to improve our understanding of how cells with the same genome can develop dramatically different behaviors . To reach this objective, I am investigating the phenomenon at the molecular and biochemical level, taking cells with a genetic ‘off switch’ as the foundation of my research. I want to be able to probe at and manipulate the underlying environmental conditions in cells to establish if a number of molecular/biochemical events combine to promote more cells towards a more biologically desirable/ adaptive state. The insight gained by investigating cells of the same genotype could, in the long run, aid the treatment and care of degenerative and cognitive disorders.

A Manitoba woman has been sent to prison for hiding the remains of six infants in a rented storage locker . The 41-year-old was originally facing nine charges relating to hiding the babies, but pleaded guilty to only one - disposing of a body without legal authority. Manitoba prosecutors noted that all six of the infants found in the storage locker belonged to her and that all died as newborns and were located within an inch or two of each other. At her sentencing hearing, the woman spoke briefly, apologizing and saying she felt relief at having admitted what happened.

WASHINGTON — House Democrats on Friday unveiled a comprehensive elections and ethics reform package that targets what they call a  'culture of corruption' in Washington. The “For The People Act,” as House Democrats have named their new bill, would help American citizens have a greater say in who represents them in Congress and is said to deliver on a key promise made during the 2016 election to fix Washington's culture of corruption. Among many changes, the new bill would prevent foreign governments from influencing U.S. elections, and reform lobbying rules by banning congressional representatives from raising large funds from political donations.

He was hired earlier this month as an assistant by Cincinnati. Mayfield is showing the athleticism and accuracy that made the Browns gamble on him in the draft instead of going with Sam Darnold, Josh Allen or Josh Rosen.

MASSENA – Mr. William V. Cameron , Jr. , 62 , a resident of Olympia , Washington and a 1977  graduate of Massena Central School , passed away on June 25, 2018. Friends are invited to pay respects during the 9:00am memorial service at Elmcrest United Church of Christ, 23 Moore Avenue, on Saturday, July 21. His widow and her three children fondly remember William's offbeat sense of humor and integrity of character that have made such a meaningful mark in their lives. They cherished his compassionate wisdom and now dedicate their efforts towards giving others a loving and humble legacy in his memory.

LOS ANGELES (AP) — The Oscars are adding a new category to honor popular films and promising a brisk three-hour ceremony and a much earlier air date in 2020. John Bailey, the newly re-elected president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, and film Academy CEO Dawn Hudson said in an email to members Wednesday morning that the Board of Governors met Tuesday night to approve the changes. “We have heard from many of you about improvements needed to keep the Oscars and our Academy relevant in a changing world,” Hudson and Bailey wrote.

Patient is a 36-year-old male who immigrated from southwest Asia three months ago, and now has a pustular pruritic rash on his face and chest, chills, myalgias, sore throat, and night sweats. Ill-defined nodular opacities measuring about 5-10 mm, absence of hilar lymphadenopathy, and absence of pleural effusion. Varicella-zoster pneumonia is caused by the varicella-zoster virus, which is usually benign and self-limited with solely skin involvement in children. In neonates, there is 25% mortality for those born to mothers afflicted with varicella within 4 days of delivery or 2 days post-delivery.

Last week, we learned that the Obama administration is considering other alternatives to stop foreclosures. Today, we have some color on what one of these efforts might look like. It would encourage servicers to reduce struggling borrowers' mortgage balance. Although banks have fought such efforts in the past, it seems that the program could benefit everyone involved. And the best part: it wouldn't take any taxpayer dollars. Of the residential mortgage-backed securities outstanding, about $1.3 trillion are so-called private label notes that were issued by banks and other financial institutions, according to data from the Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association.

( Reuters ) - For U.S. media companies and investors , it was the ruling of the decade . A 

U.S. appeals court reversed an earlier decision Thursday and overturned a 2008 lower court decision that would have put constraints on retransmission fees , a potentially huge revenue stream for U.S. broadcasters. For major broadcasters such as Disney's ABC, CBS and 21st Century Fox, the win will let them continue to reap billions of dollars a year in fees that cable providers pay to show broadcast shows. Broadcasters celebrated the decision, while cable executives and Wall Street analysts wondered what impact it could have on their businesses.

Syrian sources said April 14 that the Jordanian charge d'affaires in Lebanon , Hisham Moheisen , who was kidnapped from  his convoy Saturday , was freed Monday

Local officials had called on both sides involved in the incident - Lebanon's Shia militant group and a local kidnapping group in south Lebanon - to work together towards a safe return of Moheisen. Reports indicated that four suspects were detained in the past two days, likely contributing to the decision to release Moheisen, who reportedly travelled with other diplomats to collect a stranded citizen at the borders.

China began three days of national mourning for the victims of the May 12 earthquake, restricting access to entertainment content both on the Internet and broadcast media. The official English-language newspaper China Daily reported Monday that "All public amusements will be suspended for three days from Monday. The State Council, the Cabinet, on Sunday ordered a nationwide display of respect for the dead." Major portals Sina.com and Sohu.com limited their home page offerings to news content. Sohu adopted an all-black font, with most of the links on the top half of the page relating to earthquake news.

Last week , we learned that the Obama administration is considering other alternatives to stop foreclosures . Today , we  learned that the Treasury Department has confirmed this information. A loan modification program, giving more accessible loan terms , is the main approach that could prevent more households from ending up in foreclosure . Other initiatives may involve decreasing rates or providing more affordable payments , allowing loan forbearance, and allowing access to government subsidized home purchases . More information will be announced soon , including details of each proposed alternative . So far, more than five million American households are behind on mortgage payments .

Ryanair has lowered its full year profit guidance from a current range of €1.25-€1.35 billion to a new range of  €1.20-€1.30 billion

In addition to lower-than-expected passenger numbers due to global health fears over the coronavirus, Ryanair also attributed their profit forecast drop to higher fuel and cost pressure, an expected continuing decline in the British pound and oil price pressure in Q2. They further noted a fall in oil prices of up to 30 percent could drive some increased fare pricing which could mean its half year result, released this coming March, might not be as bad as expected.

In developed capitalist democracies, financial, media and energy companies are private enterprises that don’t report to presidents. In Russia, things are different. Most of those businesses are majority-state-owned corporations, virtual branches of the government. And that means when you talk to the head of a Russian bank or oil company, you are effectively talking to the Kremlin. In 2000, when Vladimir Putin assumed the presidency, he consolidated competing power centers — media, business, local government, opposition parties and the Parliament — under his authority. He called it “a vertical of power.” This system now includes organized crime and cybercriminals.

German scientists working on the Wendelstein 7-X fusion device started a series of experiments that could eventually prove the superiority  of the country in terms of its renewable energy endeavors. In the hopes of commercializing the design, the Wendelstein 7-X began two years of testing today with the successful release of about 1.4 megajoules of thermal energy. Though current energy requirements can't yet be met with the new fusion process, the objective of the trial run is to compare the performance with existing power plants and nuclear power sources, measuring how quickly the reactor cools during discharges, the stability of its operation, as well as determining methods of optimization.

Salads from McDonald 's have been linked to more than 500 cases of an intestinal illness in the US . This intestinal illness is being identified as a foodborne infection called cyclosporiasis which causes common flu like symptoms. Due to this issue the centers for Disease Control and prevention have set forth multiple recall alerts related to salads at McDonald’s throughout the U.S. Local health authorities, meanwhile, have identified 15 locations of potential infection risk for customers who ate salads from McDonalds locations in five different states in the midwest region of the U.S. The findings continue to develop as tests are done on these salads.

Pierre René-Worms , FRANCE 24 | Marco Cecchinato is the lowest-ranked French Open semi-finalist since 1999 . Marco Cecchinato ,  who was initially added to the main draw only after Rafael Nadal pulled out due to injury, advanced to the semi-finals with a stunning 7-6, 1-6, 7-6, 7-6 win over Dominic Thiem on Tuesday. Cecchinato's win came as a surprise to everyone watching. A nobody who began this season outside the Top 100, the 25-year-old Sicilian began the week unseeded, losing eight straight French Open first-round matches in qualifying or main draws over four seasons.

How Should Google Handle Google Bombs ? Home > Google News > Google SEO > How Should Google Handle Google  Bombs ? Google bomb usually directs someone to unexpected pages due to carefully constructed combination of keywords in link or on-page. It’s important for Google to address this issue in order to continue delivering results relevant to the query being made. One solution may be to ensure an established voting system based on individual visits. When multiple visits are identified from various locations within a specific region, that would raise a red flag alerting Google to analyze further.

The Australian telecommunications ( telco ) industry is largely responsible for the highly connected and digital world we live in  today. It plays a critical role in delivering Australians with fast, secure and reliable access to the internet and a suite of related products and services. Telcos employ over 57,000 Australians in highly technical and skilled roles. Additionally, the telco sector makes a valuable contribution to the Australian economy with revenues totalling $25 billion in 2018-2019, representing 7.9% of GDP. Beyond its core product offerings, the telco industry leads in providing Australians with tools and innovations to thrive in our ever-changing digital world.

Accompanying the Medal of Honor release this Tuesday, SteelSeries has branded their high-end keyboards, mice, and mousepads with deigns to complement the first person shooter. Accompanying the "Medal of Honor" release this Tuesday, SteelSeries has branded its high-end keyboards, mice, and mousepads with deigns to complement the first-person shooter. I have written previously about my own pets , and the most common prompt for me to do this has  been various recent animal law reform. In most cases, the outcome has been promising and has given us hope for animal rights across the world. Over the past couple of years, there has been a steady increase of people being given authority to intervene if they observe animals being abused and neglected, in an effort to defend the innocent. States in the United States, Australia and beyond have already recognised these cases in court and punished the culprits.

The footage comes days after former St. Anthony , Minnesota , police officer Jeronimo Yanez was acquitted for killing Castile  

Outrage spread nationwide with the verdict and people, taking to the streets, trying to make their voices heard. After an event of his conviction in the 2012 manslaughter of Trayvon Martin, this serves to stir new talk about the Black Lives Matter Movement and widespread fear by minority communities when interacting with law enforcement. Activist argue that communities of color are particularly scrutinized by the police, who some feel routinely lack effective measures for identifying potential deadly circumstances, instead disproportionately jumping to violence without thought for consequence or negotiation.

Chrissy Teigen and John Legend arrive at the Oscars on Feb. 26, 2017 at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. Chrissy Teigen is loving life on vacation and, judging by a new post, her hubby John Legend isn’t the only singer in the house. Teigen, the model and activist, shared a video of herself goofing around with an inflatable flamingo by a pool and singing “Thank You For Being A Friend,” the theme for The Golden Girls, a hugely popular sitcom in the 1980s and early 1990s. Teigen’s version has a fresh set of lyrics tailored to her lush surroundings.

Most Janus cats don't live for more than a few days, but Frank and Louie's unusually long life earned him a place in the Guinness World Records. December 8, 2014, 10:49 a.m.
Frank and Louie, a ragdoll cat born with two faces, wasn't expected to live more than a few days, but for years he defied the odds. The cat passed away last week at the age of 15. Janus cats, named after the two-faced Roman god, are extremely rare and typically don't live long due to health problems related to their deformity.

From Madonna to Sam Smith , Taylor posed with everyone ! As was made evident in Taylor Swift 's intro -dense U.S. shows. Following the "1989 Tour", Swift seemed in awe and being interviewed by DJ Sway for Shade45 SiriusXM; Swift reflected about her time touring the nation. She detailed meetings she encountered throughout the country, ranging from cancer survivors to parents grieving a lost son, singing or in some other special way Swift bonding with their fan families. "They make this road life you get to experience feel not only easy, but such a pleasure”.

Selkirk Avenue was closed down for several hours by a fire. At around 10 a.m. Monday, Winnipeg Fire Paramedic Service crews responded to a fire in a vacant commercial building in the 400 block of Selkirk. Crews evacuated nearby buildings as a precaution and one individual from a neighbouring building was assessed on scene. The road was closed to traffic for around two and a half hours. Officials said that the fire progressed into the roof of an attached residential-style portion of the building. Crews contained the fire to the building of origin using several handheld hose lines and an aerial ladder for safety.

To any objective observer , the consensus that exists between Barack Obama and Mitt Romney on the fundamental issues of  the economy appears to be non existent. It may be why so many other parties are pushing their ideas and perspectives, trying to make an impact on the discussion about our future economy. Independent parties have done particularly well this season, pushing an agenda focused on putting the money and power in the hands of people, rather than politicians or Wall Street financiers. Polls indicate that voters are anxious to turn away from two-party bickering and are overwhelmingly in support of expanding their options on the ballot this November.

It didn't have the highest success rate when it came to matches this season, with only Melissa Walsh and John Robertson still together. A network spokesperson told The Daily Telegraph they have received 10,000 applications since the casting call began earlier this month. This is 1200 more than the total number of applications Married At First Sight received last year over a three month period, the spokesperson added.

German scientists working on the Wendelstein 7-X fusion device started a series of experiments that could eventually prove the superiority of the stellarator-type fusion devices. German chancellor Angela Merkel prepares to press the start bottom next to the head of the Max Planck Institute for Plasma Physics Sibylle Guenter , left, and Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania governor, Erwin Sellering, right at the Wendelstein 7-X' nuclear fusion research center at the Max-Planck-Institut for Plasma Physics in Greifswald, Germany Wednesday Feb. 3, 2016. Nuclear fusion power has been the dream of many since the 1950s and on Wednesday German scientists took one step closer to making it possible.

In the week between Christmas and New Years , Gov . George Pataki signed into law two bills sponsored by  Senator Schumer 

The two bills are expected to strengthen national security throughout the state, requiring organizations with mail order privileges to employ specific mailing restrictions that meet postal standards for enhanced safety. Business owners are pleased that these changes will make sure consumer security is being improved. They anticipate fewer fraudulent claims and deliverance services as a result of the tougher new requirements. While organizations prepare for these new restrictions, local organizations have made suggestions to increase consumer and organization protection while retaining convenience.

(CNN) -- Thousands of people in Northern Ireland protested Wednesday against the killing of two soldiers and a policeman, reportedly by paramilitaries who want the province to leave the United Kingdom and become part of the Republic of Ireland. Girls in Craigavon, where the police officer was killed, join a candlelit vigil. Unions organized a 30-minute silent vigil following the shooting of policeman Stephen Carroll on Monday and British soldiers Cengiz "Pat" Azimkar and Mark Quinsey on Saturday. Vigils were held in Belfast, Craigavon -- where Carroll died -- and other towns including Lisburn and Newry.

Two years ago , Red Sox prospect Ryan Westmoreland seemed to be on the fast track to the majors . He was the second pick of the 2008 draft and boasted the type of fastball-curveball combo the big club had craved since Pedro Martinez and Curt Schilling anchored the top of their rotation. His climb ended in spring training of 2010 after doctors found a cavernous malformation in his brain, eventually requiring multiple brain surgeries. In March of 2011, after coming perilously close to having his baseball career permanently shelved, the then-21-year-old resumed throwing in Sarasota.

We say everyone should turn down the volume on complaining and let people go about their own business downtown. Also, let the police do their job. There is already a downtown noise ordinance in place, and the police reported to the city Tuesday that new measures are coming. First, the bikers.

Made of Q-Tips, this craft goes far beyond a miniature garland or cake topper. The light strand also looks cute as a bracelet, necklace, package decoration, or decoration for a miniature Christmas tree or dollhouse. Set up an area to work in, on top of a piece of waxed paper. Place a little bit of each paint color in its own bottle cap or other small container. One by one, dip the ends of the Q-tips in the paint. To avoid drips, scrape the end of the Q-tip on the edge of the bottle cap.

It takes a community to help migrant workers who need affordable medical care and social assistance. This is the belief of Dr Goh Wei Leong, co-founder of HealthServe, which has grown from strength to strength and marks the 10th anniversary of its first clinic this year. "Its not just about dishing out medicine. It's about the human community. (In the early days), I realised we needed social workers, counsellors and legal advisory." The non-governmental organisation has dental and medical clinics in Geylang, Mandai and Jurong catering to migrant workers. It also provides social assistance to those in distress.

Jack Kerouac cruised the bohemian North Beach neighborhood here in the 1950s intent on achieving nothing less than freedom of  his own

But true bohemian living was only ever a fleeting thing; try as he might, Jack was left behind when things shifted during the conservative 1960s. Disillusioned and helpless against his diminishing influence on the cultural movements around him, Jack tried to reassert his control through artistic endeavours such as movie reviews, artwork, and extensive explorations into Buddhist beliefs. To Jack, the acquisition of this personal freedom went much further than what was simple geographically, leading him deeper in the self.

The Dallas-Fort Worth Film Critics Association , of which this reporter is a member , has named Moonlight as the  year's best picture

The independent coming-of-age drama about an African-American coming to terms with his sexual identity has a score of 99 per cent from reviews aggregated by the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, so this news is no real surprise. Since its October 2016 release, Moonlight has stirred strong emotion with critics, receiving countless awards from various respected critics circles. Some of the notable critics groups honoring the picture this year include the Critics' Choice Awards, Los Angeles Film Critics Association and now the Dallas-Fort Worth Film Critics Association.

America is voting Tuesday to fill the country 's top job opening . The country also has over five million  decisions to make on numerous ballot issues and referendums. Across the United States, polling places were mostly uncharacteristically quiet in light of the overwhelming amounts of absentee voting, despite looming issues regarding that process. Tuesday has started relatively free of widespread polling issues, leaving Americans to go through the routine process to determine the occupant of the White House. In some areas, issues remained with incorrect ballot collection boxes, polling place queues, and automated equipment.

Bloxx kick off their latest jaunt across the UK with a headline gig at the Craufurd Arms on Wednesday nextweek 

On this tour, they will be performing many of their greatest tracks, showcasing their emerging brand of hybrid Brit pop, jangle rock and poppunk. Furthermore, they will also be playing some material from their new album 'Tales From Elsewhere' which is due out in March. Tickets to their headline gig have been sold out, but fans will have the opportunity to catch Bloxx in some other smaller, yet intimate venues along the way.

Best Buy Co. Inc. shares surged 9 % in premarket trade after the electronics retailer & apos ; s fiscal  first-quarter earnings report beat expectations. Revenue came in at $9.31 billion which was above estimates of $9.12 billion, primarily driven by growth in e-commerce sales as store footfalls dwindled due to pandemic-induced restrictions. During the reported quarter, digital sales surged 179%, accounting for 28% of the total sales. Meanwhile, comparable store sales declined 18.3%, steeper than estimates of 15.2% drop. Best Buy continued to strengthen its service capabilities as demand for delivery and install services rose sharply.

Veronica Fatia carries her 2-year-old daughter as they travel in a wooden boat to Buzi district , 120 miles outside  Mozambique. Veronica left her home in Sofala Province days before Cyclone Idai had pounded into Beira city, turning roads and streets to rivers. "I had been warning them," she thought. After being completely washed away with massive flooding and stronger than expected wind, there seemed to be nothing to turn back to anymore. However, despite all that happened, Veronica has made her mind, She is to take her daughter in a voyage filled with hopes of rebuilding a new life.

The one and only Nolan Ryan is such a fan of Round Rock, its minor league baseball and the greater Austin lifestyle that he wondered why his son would want to leave it. Even for the big leagues. "That was my big question," Ryan told CultureMap when his son Reid Ryan was named president of the Houston Astros earlier this summer, which meant leaving a similar position with the Round Rock Express. "If he'd be willing to give up Round Rock and the life he and his family had there. "He had a pretty good setup."

For decades, aid groups have assumed they know what's best for refugees and the poor; a growing body of evidence suggests they're wrong. Both academic research and practical experience, such as with the mass of Syrians fleeing civil war, shows that simply handing out traditional relief goods may not be the most effective way of helping the dispossessed. Aid agencies are tentatively also giving away cash and letting refugees decide for themselves what they need. While the results may be unexpected, the money is being wisely spent and rarely wasted - contrary to old prejudices among donors.

The team that brought you driverless cars and Siri is now fighting a new kind of war on information. In the world of internet memes, Instagram filters, and Photoshop, seeing is no longer believing. Everyone is a photographer or videographer once they have a smartphone in their hands, which often comes equipped with alteration tools already installed. But manipulations that started with cropping and teeth-whitening have spurred into the spread of misinformation. Parkland shooting survivor Emma Gonzalez is pictured ripping up a shooting range target, left. At right, a doctored photo circulated the Internet, depicting Gonzalez tearing apart the U.S. Constitution.

Low-income working families are losing hundreds of pounds each year – and being wrongly denied free healthcare entitlements – because  of a quirk in how state-funded NHS “non-means-tested” financial schemes for dentistry and optician services are run in England. Local council staff are unsure how the funds work and many councils impose residency checks which lead to individuals wrongly failing the test. As a result, people may not be able to pay for sight-saving or potentially pain-easing check-ups even when the patient in question is below the means-test threshold. People of various ages have been affected, resulting in many denied the services they desperately need.

In recent years, platformers have proven to be a hospitable genre for video game developers looking to flaunt their artistry. For the generation of designers who grew up playing “Super Mario Bros.” platformers offer a sound formula. Though the goal of such games is usually to get from one area to the next, that framework supports copious possibilities. Determining how a character moves through a world and what sorts of things should impede or assist in the process allows plenty of room for creativity. It is why games like “Journey” and “Inside” can both be constructed around jumping avatars but otherwise appear quite distinct.

The Toronto real estate market is showing signs of stirring from its deep freeze, with new listings starting to pick up — and an almost 8 per cent spike in prices — as of mid February, year over year, according to figures released Wednesday. Some 2,767 properties were sold during the first two weeks of February, up just 1.3 per cent from the same period a year ago, says the Toronto Real Estate Board. But the average sale price was up 7.8 per cent to $547,107 from the $507,474 recorded in the first two weeks of February 2013.

Student Senators passed a resolution that would have NYU divest from three companies associated with the Israeli government and institute  an overall ethical investment review for all funds invested 

The divestment plan follows years of public and student demands for the university to respond to what advocates label as human rights abuses committed by Israeli security forces against Palestinians. Under this proposal, NYU will no longer have financial ties to three Israeli companies, namely Lockheed Martin, Hewlett Packard and Motorola Solutions, who are associated with human rights abuses. Moreover, all investments are to undergo review through an annual ethical investment portfolio created by the University Finance committee.

A cartographer that created maps for senior policy makers at the National Counterterrorism Center wants to map out your next  summer vacation

The cartographer was looking to break out of her governmental bubble, and had an interesting idea to offer travelers around the country. She decided to start a map-making business to assist travelers looking to explore different parts of the country and make sure they wouldn't miss out on the amazing sites to see and activities to take part in. After curating itineraries, she created personalized custom maps tailored to her customers' specifications, with an emphasis on color-coding the areas in accordance to the experiences the customer wants to make.

BAMAKO , Mali – The head of an ethnic Dogon militia blamed for a massacre in central Mali is denying  responsibility. Haman Houdou told local news outlets that he has been wrongly accused and detained without charge, without a lawyer or a medical visit. The militia leader said that it is wrong to accuse him or his militia of killing. The Dogon militia is accused of a massacre of nearly 160 people from the Fulani ethnic group in Ogossagou in early March. Mali’s security and intelligence chiefs said earlier this month they found several abandoned arms in villages previously held by the militia.

After seven seasons together with the Cubs , could the Theo Trio be on the verge of a breakup ? The uncertainty surrounds a duo with very different stances when it comes to contracts and free agents: President of Baseball Operations Theo Epstein and Chairman Tom Ricketts. Their dissimilar beliefs sparked some doubt from critics. Despite winning a historic 2016 World Series and winning four straight division titles, tensions began to rise. Speculation continues if the alleged fraying in relationships between Tom, Theo, and Chief Executive Officer Crane Kenny are unfixable, especially if money continues to become more difficult in Major League Baseball.

After seven seasons together with the Cubs, could the Theo Trio be on the verge of a breakup? That could depend on the Giants. Or the Mets. Both are looking for new general managers, and Jason McLeod, the Cubs’ top scouting and player-development executive, already has been linked to both. The Giants job opened Monday with Bobby Evans’ firing. “I’m not actively looking because of how great things are here,” said McLeod, who sat alongside team president Theo Epstein and general manager Jed Hoyer during the fall 2011 news conference introducing them as the Cubs’ new front-office regime.

Bavarian farmers are angry that their famous Alpine dairy cows will apparently have to wear nappies under European Union environmental  legislation

The issue, which was announced at the European parliament's Agriculture Committee meeting, came to light during a debate on new EU livestock regulations, leaving some German farmers bemused. Under the plans, "if a pasture is deemed especially sensitive from an environmental point of view, livestock may only be allowed there for a few days. During that period, special provisions must be taken for waste management", leading to Bavarian farmers proposing nappies for the cattle.

The GoPro brand is synonymous with the action cameras. Whether you use it daily or occasionally, many of you probably have one model or another sitting around the house. Even though GoPro’s point-and-shoot simplicity makes it easy to use, there are plenty of extra tricks you can learn to take your filmmaking to the next level. If your helmet is blocking 90 percent of your GoPro’s field of view, you’ll want to know about it as early as possible, not after you’ve been out kayaking for five hours.

The 2014 Chevrolet Camaro Z28. DETROIT — General Motors is recalling more cars for problems with ignition switches. GM is recalling nearly 512,000 Chevrolet Camaro muscle cars from the 2010 to 2014 model years. A driver's knee can bump the key and knock the switch out of the "run" position, causing an engine stall. That knocks out power steering and brakes and could cause drivers to lose control. GM said it knows of three crashes and four minor injuries from the problem. The company added that the Camaro switches met its specifications, unlike the switches at the center of a recall of 2.6 million small cars.

An online portal aimed at ensuring that the Muslim community gets religious knowledge from recognised sources was launched yesterday by the Islamic Religious Council of Singapore (Muis). Besides being able to access articles from accredited religious teachers, users on LearnIslam.sg can also sign up for Islamic education programmes run by mosques and other Islamic education providers. The site, targeted at young adults, was unveiled by Minister-in-charge of Muslim Affairs Yaacob Ibrahim at the Al-Iman Mosque in Bukit Panjang. Asked if LearnIslam.sg was created to counter websites which may have radical messages, Dr Yaacob said this would narrow the potential of the site.

Kīlauea continues to erupt at its summit and East Rift Zone . During the past week , the summit lava  lake leveled off and volcanists observed persistent surface activity and crustalflation at the east vent of the crater floor. An unmanned Aerial Vehicle mission conducted in the lower East Rift Zone observed minor surface activity along the mid section of the fissure system with very few if any small surface flows, lava fountains and lava benches continuing near Kupaianaha and Pu`u `O`o. A set of robot cameras overlooking the fissures also did not detect major active movement from that area of the fissure system.

Many attributed the team's successful stand to the resilience and the passionate spirit demonstrated by the coach, who always inspired the players to never back down.
