Marine Le Pen, the French National Front political party leader, at an FN political rally in Frejus. French presidential candidate Marine Le Pen is not the biggest fan of the euro. "The euro is not a currency," she said earlier this month. "It is a political weapon to force countries to implement the policies decided by the [European Union] and keep them on a leash. "Look at what happened to the Greeks when they said no to austerity, as they were right to do: Liquidity for the banks was cut off."

Should Bikes Be Allowed On Muni Metro? A recent news report on an injured cyclist denied passage on the N Judah because she was carrying her (unfolded) bike received no small amount of attention this week, and now transit advocates are asking why bikes are unequivocally banned from Muni light rail vehicles at all. As reported this Thursday by the Ex, cyclist Katherine Roberts "hit a metal plate that jutted open by the Muni tracks at Church and Duboce streets" at around 11:30 p.m. on April 11, and struck her head.

Hybrid Cloud: Wave of the Future or Digital Chimera? Home Blogs Infrastructure Hybrid Cloud: Wave Of The Future Or Digital Chimera? The hybrid cloud remains the top infrastructure initiative in the enterprise, but it is a huge undertaking and leads into such deep, uncharted waters that it is by no means a smooth transition. Quite naturally, as the difficulties mount, more voices are starting to call the wisdom of the hybrid cloud into question. Does it really provide the benefits that supporters claim? Is it really the best way to prepare for the emerging digital economy?

For three turbulent centuries, the glimpse of a square sail and dragon-headed prow on the horizon struck terror into the hearts of medieval Europeans. Indeed, the Viking Age, from A.D. 800-1100, was the age of the sleek, speedy longship. Without this crucial advance in ship technology, the Vikings would never have become a dominant force in medieval warfare, politics, and trade. With their invention of the longship, the Vikings spurred a literal sea change in medieval European affairs. The drekar, or dragon-headed longships, were stealthy troop-carriers.

The Jawbone Up debuted last year with big ambitions : A bracelet-like device that you 'd wear all the time  to measure the data from everyday activity to become healthier. However, the ambitious wearable device was soon overwhelmed by criticism on its hard-to-navigate software interface, problems syncing to Android phones, and malfunctioning product performance. In a bid to rectify some of these problems and stay ahead of competitors, Jawbone updated the Up app to allow users to compare stats, create tailored goals and custom programmes that focused on running, cycling, weight training and dancing.

Kīlauea continues to erupt at its summit and East Rift Zone. During the past week, the summit lava lake level varied between about 22 and 52 m (70–170 ft) below the vent rim within Halema‘uma‘u Crater. On the East Rift Zone, satellite imagery acquired on April 3 showed scattered lava flow activity within about 7.6 km (4.7 mi) of Puʻu ʻŌʻō. These flows were not threatening nearby communities. Mauna Loa is not erupting. Seismicity remains elevated above long-term background levels, but no significant changes were recorded during the past week.

BANGKOK ( Reuters ) - The leader of Thailand ’ s military junta said on Thursday that Yingluck Shinawatra ,  the nation’s deposed prime minister, would not be allowed to return to power any time soon. General Prayut Chan-o-cha, who has been ruling the country since he ousted Yingluck from office in a May 2014 coup, added that he would not allow those who supported her to come to power either. He justified his position saying that it was necessary to rid the nation of corrupt people and keep the country safe. He noted that economic conditions were improving and pledged to reduce military activity.

GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. — Democrat John Edwards endorsed former rival Barack Obama on Wednesday, a move designed to help solidify support for the party’s likely presidential nominee even as Hillary Rodham Clinton refuses to give up her long-shot candidacy. The endorsement came a day after Clinton defeated Obama by more than 2-to-1 in the West Virginia primary. The loss highlighted Obama’s challenge in winning over the “Hillary Democrats” — white, working-class voters who also supported Edwards in significant numbers before he exited the race in late January. He said Obama “stands with me” in a fight to cut poverty in half within 10 years.

In the greatest debate since the color of the dress , people are arguing over what color these pills are 

After pictures of an unmarked bottle of white pills spread on social media, heated debates have taken the internet by storm. Twitterverse quickly disagreed about what color these pills really were. Half claimed it was lavender while others maintained it was peach or blush. Even pharmaceutical companies joined in to take sides, drawing sharp line with opposing colors. With brands arguing their colors, discussions inevitably delved into debates over acceptable terms in color descriptions.

Sen. Cory Booker , the New Jersey Democrat who ’ s launched a bid for the White House in 2020  , spent Thursday crisscrossing Iowa

Sen. Booker emphasized his lifelong work towards supporting issues important to Iowans, like fair taxation and better access to health care. He also touted his accomplishments in the Senate since 2013 such as creating jobs, saving home mortgages, criminal justice reform and backing sensible gun regulations. At one stop in Iowa, he asserted his goal of uniting “people of common purpose regardless of their identity.” Booker's inspirational and energized supporters surrounded him wherever he spoke.

Sympathetically converted 2 bedroom pent house apartment in the heart of the village. The Coach House is situated in the heart of the rural village of Upottery. Set in the Blackdown Hills Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, Upottery benefits from a public house, The Sidmouth Arms, a highly regarded primary school and church. The nearby A30 trunk road gives rapid access to both Honiton and the city of Exeter whilst Taunton is within easy reach to the north. 16 Miles to the south is the Jurassic coastline at Lyme Regis, with further popular resorts along the Lyme Bay at Beer, Branscombe and Sidmouth.

WASHINGTON – Congress is moving to put under military control all armed contractors operating in combat zones , a Pentagon  effort long in the works to improve control of war zone private armies like that of Blackwater. Lawmakers attached a sweeping and contentious measure on private security to the 2010 defense authorization bill, which passed a Senate committee yesterday. Under the measure, contractors accused of murder or major war crimes must be dealt with by the US military. Contractors hired to accompany US forces in war zones and face such serious allegations must now be investigated and possibly prosecuted by US service personnel.

Evan Spiegel's once-buzzy company is laying off employees as it cuts back on hiring. Just a few months after its euphoric debut on the public market was stifled by a series of increasingly bleak earnings reports, Snapchat parent company Snap is laying off a handful of employees for the second time this month. Business Insider reports that 18 employees from Snap’s recruiting division have been let go. While those employees represent less than 1 percent of the company’s total headcount, Snapchat also plans to pump the brakes on hiring next year.

PARIS -- France could become the latest country to ban the use of underweight fashion models. France's health minister says she supports a proposal that would criminalize advertising that features anorexic models. The measure would put France, a world capital of fashion, in alignment with countries like Israel and Spain that are cracking down on the glorification of dangerously thin models. Socialist lawmaker Olivier Veran, who is also a doctor, wants to add language to an upcoming health bill to make it illegal to employ models deemed to have an eating disorder.

On screen , 12 mysterious black ships suddenly materialize at different places across the world . Col. Weber ( Forest  Whitaker) commands an elite unit which are ready to explore what these ships could possibly contain . Weber's unit quickly discovered that inside the ships is highly advanced weaponry far more advanced then their own technology. Furthermore, what puzzled authorities was the uncanny similarities between the aliens's communication and spoken languages here on Earth. Despite facing danger of both unknown and unexpected type, Col Weber managed to make contact with one of the aliens using sign language which pointed toward their superior technology.

COLOGNE CATHEDRAL SWITCHED off its light last night , in protest at the weekly anti-Islam rallies happening in Dresden . This is not the first instance in which a monument has tried to register its opposition to PEGIDA's weekly events; just recently a 15th-century old fountain in Cologne's Old Town turned off its sprinkler in mourning against the ultra-right movements gaining momentum in Germany. Hundreds of churches across Germany have organised torchlight rallies in condemnation of such demonstrations. Leading figures from religious institutions have vowed to continue to be loud with their outrage against PEGIDA and combat xenophobic rants which incite animosity towards minorities.

Is a roving , body-scanning van a needed surveillance tool or a another step toward eroding personal privacy ? Andy  Cotner

Critics of the roving body-scanning vans say that its the most aggressive kind of police search and most people view it as overly invasive. Opponents say that any legislation that would lead to their deployment around populated areas would create mistrust of the police and possibly make people scared to participate in normal everyday activities. Even those in favor of increased safety can be uncomfortable with body scanning. A wider range of security tools need to be explored if any balance between the personal right of privacy and protection is going to be achieved.

Tacko Fall, who stands 7’5″, is unstoppable. Likely the tallest player in high school basketball, he’s always turning heads in the gym. “Everywhere I go, people want to take pictures, talk to me, shake my hand, but I’m getting used to it now,” the Tavares (Fla.) Liberty Christian Prep junior told the Orlando Sentinel last year. Fall arrived in Florida from Dakar, Senegal with little to no organized basketball experience. He has also lived in Texas, Ohio and Tennessee.

HLAAF—Harvard Latin American Alumni and Friends—launched its Facebook page in March 2013 , hosted its first official alumni reception that  year. This new network attracted increasing number of alumni, leading to formal registration as an organization with Harvard’s Alumni Association. It fostered connections through events, conferences, book club meetings and visiting delegations to host Latin American countries. Most notably, they provided financial support to newly formed university chapters of Proyecto SOMOS. Each summer since 2013, HLAAF launched fundraising campaigns to ensure sustainable operations for SOMOS’ missions in rural Bolivia, India and Ghana.

Sanday , a Scottish island inhabited by only six people , has just got its first road – an unpaved  path that connects a windmill to the western part of the island. The installation of this one-kilometer-long path has been a difficult feat for the engineers involved as the hilly terrain and difficult terrain made it quite an arduous undertaking. The results are there for everyone to see, the locals feeling more connected with each other than ever before. As Sanday remains almost cut off from the rest of the world and is essentially unaffected by much modern progress, this move makes a world of difference to them.

What's the difference between bipolar I and bipolar II? Bipolar disorder is a mental health condition that causes abnormally high and in some cases, low moods. It affects a person's energy levels and their ability to function in everyday life. There are several types of bipolar disorder, the most widespread being bipolar I and bipolar II. In this article, learn about the similarities and differences between bipolar I and bipolar II. We also consider their causes, symptoms, and the available treatment options. A person with bipolar disorder may experience extreme changes in mood.

Doing business in British Columbia is particularly challenging because of the province ’ s reputation as a hotbed of environmental  protection initiatives and climate change response. British Columbia is also well known for its openness to renewable energy, so much so that many global organizations have located headquarters in the region to gain a competitive advantage. Businesses have implemented more energy efficient operations, clean production methods, and sustainable transportation systems to benefit the province. Along with environmental initiatives, government funded initiatives, including public infrastructure projects and apprenticeship training, ensure ongoing prosperity in the region.

Boeing ’ s latest setback , a deal between Tesla and Fiat Chrysler , and Pinterest ’ s valuation were  among the top headlines today

Under the terms of the agreement, the two companies will develop new EV models, which will use the platforms of both Tesla and Fiat Chrysler. The long-term plan is to revolutionize mass transportation by drastically reducing transportation cost. Boeing's news, on the other hand, didn't fare as well with investors.

Toronto - A Porter Airlines Dash 8 with 54 on board encountered a UFO at a height of about 9,000  feet above the sky

There were reports of several witnesses on the ground spotting two bright objects appearing simultaneously while they were ascending. Many passengers onboard spotted two unidentified glowing discs. These UFOs circled around the plane multiple times and soon disappeared. The airline informed Transport Canada of the event, who informed that there is no precedence of any reports or complaints related to UFO activity in Canadian airspace before. Canadian armed forces have taken charge of the case, doing all investigations as per their policies.

If you are a soda drinker unable to decide between healthier homemade sodas and your favorite off-the-shelf Coke, the upcoming Keurig Cold at-home beverage maker might be your savior. While this is positive for consumers, the impact for sellers of soda-makers and sodas isn't straightforward. In early February, Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO) announced that it entered into a 10-year agreement to collaborate with Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (UNKNOWN:GMCR.DL) on the development of its global brand portfolio for use in Green Mountain's upcoming Keurig Cold at-home beverage system. Coca-Cola will also be taking a 10% stake in Green Mountain.

JERUSALEM — The face-off at the security gate outside the Western Wall one Friday this month was familiar : for  nearly three years, two branches of Judaism have been engaged in a bitter religious rivalry that regularly spills onto the streets of the Old City. But the latest incident, in which Ultra-Orthodox protesters attacked a liberal religious women's prayer service with Torah scrolls and flags, sparked unprecedented international condemnation and galvanized Israeli politicians, bringing calls for more inclusive worship and legal intervention. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ordered the site open to non-Orthodox Jews for prayer for the first time.

Holwell Sports reached their first Senior County Cup final in 17 years on Tuesday evening after a penalty shoot-out win over Heather St Johns. John Webster’s side raced into an early two-goal lead but were left hanging on through 90 minutes and then extra time as Heather fought back to level. A nerveless and clinical display then won them the shoot-out 4-1 as Holwell booked their place in the final against Leicester Road on Tuesday, May 2. Assistant manager Andy Hill said: “I thought Heather were a very good footballing side, and it was a hard-fought win for us rather than a brilliant performance.

After delivering a blockbuster such as Meri Gurriya, writer Radain Shah is on a roll as her story explores polarities in a society with double-standards. Trouble knows no bounds when a lively, emancipated, jeans-clad Uswa (Ramsha Khan) — who has male friends and comes home at all hours because her family gives her the trust and space — succumbs to immense family pressure and marries Hannan (Shehzad Sheikh), born and bred in a conservative family set-up. To top it all he has massive anger issues. Uswa’s abaya-wearing repressive mum-in-law (Asma Abbas) calls the shots in Uswa’s new home.

The European Commission is considering legal action against EU member states to protect farm animals from suffering in hot weather while waiting at the Bulgarian-Turkish border. This can be concluded from the commission's response to an EUobserver access to documents request, which asked for recent correspondence between the commission and EU capitals about the transport of animals to Turkey. "The documents requested are letters exchanged with member states in the context of an ongoing administrative investigation on the implementation of regulation (EC) No 1/2005," said the commission's directorate-general for health and food safety in a letter to EUobserver.

Although there ’ s long been a debate over the accuracy of health information online , many U.S. Internet users  turn to digital sources for self-care advice 

Surveys by the Pew Research Center suggest that three-fourths of adult U.S. Internet users look for information to treat or prevent medical issues or to diagnose health problems online. This percentage rose when an issue was considered less severe and fewer people needed to visit a doctor. To some degree, they found reliable sources and consider themselves “savvy” users who are able to distinguish between poor-quality and more-accurate content.

Mission of Burma: Signals, Calls, and Marches / Vs.
Thirty years later, Mission of Burma still sounds like the future. Mission of Burma is a band with a lot to offer acolytes of cool post-punk minimalism who prefer a little anthemic arena rock and musical invention with their explorations of modern sterility. The Boston trio of Roger Miller, Clint Conley, and Peter Prescott brought exuberance and lyricism to their noise rock, producing only one full-length studio album before disbanding in 1983. Producer Martin Swope added the tape effects that lend the band its dreamlike, blurred-around-the-edges sound.

French President Emmanuel Macron wants to invigorate the European Union as a global power and spurn the populist nationalism that threatens to undermine its success. But he knows it requires cooperation with the United States—which makes his strange bedfellow in the White House so crucial to his agenda. This piece originally appeared in the Washington Post. Macron, who at 40 is three decades younger than Trump, disdains the president’s abrasive nature and many of his policies, notably on Iran and climate change. The French president prefers books, ideas and lofty intellectual conversation to the aggressive transactional style embodied by Trump, who favors television over written text.

AMD 's Ryzen CPUs offer some of the best bang for the buck , but which is best ? AMD  Ryzen 5 3600 , one of its more midrange CPUs, is one of the more popular chips . It packs a decent base clock speed of 3.6GHz which, coupled with the massive 6-cores and 12 threads, makes this CPU perfect for casual gaming, or a powerfull workstation setup. As one of the cheaper, entry-level AMD Ryzen processors , it has up to eight full x86 processing cores running up to 4.2GHz clock speed.

Two cemeteries in Washington County are prime examples of the wealth of history that graveyards can hold -- and the hard work required to maintain it. Amid the hubbub of shopping centers and the din of traffic from nearby Hwy. 61, the cemetery sandwiched between McDonald's and Tires Plus seems jarringly out of place. Few pause to notice the prim patch of well-tended green, bounded by an iron fence, that holds some of Cottage Grove's earliest pioneers. The cemetery, designated a historic site by the Washington County Historical Society, has ties to the founders of Mars Inc., the giant candy manufacturing company.

The “digital workforce” may sound like science fiction, conjuring up images of lines of robots running through an office. In truth, the digital workforce is a tangible reality. But, rather than teams of robots, it involves a more promising environment with people, automation, and artificial intelligence working side by side. This hybrid workforce is coming to life thanks to businesses that recognize the transformative potential in automation and AI. In a study by Genpact of 300 C-suite and senior executives, 79% of AI leaders – the companies generating impact from AI – expect their employees to be comfortable working alongside robots by 2020.

The long-awaited third Bill & Ted film has been confirmed . Titled Bill & Ted Face The Music , the  franchise favourites

Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter will both be reprising their roles and are reported to be 'really happy' with the new story. The film, set to hit cinemas in 2020, sees the San Dimas duo tasked with composing a new song in order to save the world. Two promising new stars Brigette Lundy-Paine and Samara Weaving are set to join the existing stars, which will also include the likes of William Sadler and Anthony Carrigan.

Is a roving, body-scanning van a needed surveillance tool or a another step toward eroding personal privacy? Andy Greenberg of Forbes is reporting that American Science & Engineering, which provides x-ray scanners to governments and defense companies, has introduced a van capable of scanning nearby cars. The Z Backscatter Vans, or ZBVs, are used to scan for explosives, drugs and people, making them an ideal tool for security, law enforcement and border control agencies. The vans work by emitting low-level x-rays off and through nearby objects to collect a visual snapshot of other vehicles.

Swedish furnishing giant IKEA is still looking to build a new store in Coventry which could create around 600 jobs 

IKEA had identified Coventry's Earlsdon area for a large 400,000 sq ft store to be built, but has not been given the go-ahead from Coventry City Council's planning department, after a decade of consideration. Although the business had their plans passed last month, councillors would prefer another site for the proposed store. It's estimated the Earlsdon store will require around 674 permanent and 314 seasonal job, therefore providing hundreds of jobs for people in the Coventry region.

The first image of Earth from lunar orbit. Before an Apollo-era NASA could launch a few humans on top of a rocket and plop them down on the moon, it needed to find safe places to land. So from 1966 through 1967, the space agency launched five spacecraft, which it creatively named Lunar Orbiters 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. Lunar Orbiter 1 was the first to swing around the moon. It automatically took film photos, processed and scanned them, then beamed the images back as radiowaves to receivers on Earth, where technicians recorded them onto analog data tapes.

Who pulled the plug on the canal this time? It’s winter, and we’re certainly not in the middle of a drought, so what’s happened to this stretch of the Grand Union Canal? The Cooks Wharf area of the canal appears to have drained away again, just four months after the same section was left bereft of water. The area sits just outside Cheddington on the way to Marsworth. In August there was a similar scene after a boater left a lock gate paddle open – the gates control the flow of water in the lock.

The decision on 15 December 2005 in the case of Jones v Garnett was a victory for the taxpayer and  will impact similar cases in the future. The court case was on the extent to which private motoring should qualify for relief against inheritance tax. Mrs Garnett had used her inherited funds to finance a range of vehicles, and HMRC disallowed some relief against tax. The appeal court overruled the original decision and ordered that a substantial amount of inheritance tax could be reduced from her original sum due to a discount available for 'motor vehicles used for private purposes'.

Weather Underground on the Weather Channel: Highly gender-normative interactions. The lady sits behind the bar when the men are talking. This week the Weather Channel, mainstay of bored insomniacs and families on vacation in Florida, debuted a new weekday prime-time live show about the weather. Problem is, the show, Weather Underground, is set in what appears to be a 40-year-old storm chaser’s parents’ basement and features highly gender-normative interactions between its slew of male meteorologists and its single female presenter, Sarah Dillingham. Dillingham is working on a master’s degree in atmospheric sciences and appears on-camera during every segment of the two-hour show.

In true Colorado fashion , Fort Collins ' first full week of spring will bring below-freezing temperatures on the heels  of the first April snowstorm in decades . For Fort Collins and the rest of Colorado, this week is all about jumping into spring head first. Despite temperatures significantly lower than expected, this upcoming week still contains several stretches of sunny weather. Hikes, river walks and bike rides with take place as they've had the winter to prep their new favorite outdoor destination, with families can barbeque, games and fun activities taking advantage of the recent sunshine and sunshine.

According to a new poll by pro-business policy group the Bay Area Council , 34 percent of Bay Area residents  surveyed feel they can no longer afford to live in the Bay Area. This is compared to 41 percent in 2018. As rents skyrocket, median income lags far behind. Average income growth from 2016-2018 was 10.7%, yet the median rent grew 15% in that same period. Additionally, median household income rose 5.6% between 2018-2019, yet median home price is currently 25% higher. Additionally, 34% reported in 2019 that it was harder to stay living in the area compared to 31% in 2018.

Aged 63, Bowler was born in Kalgoorlie, completing his primary and secondary schooling in the region and spending most of his working life in the goldfields. Bowler was the founding editor of the Golden Mail newspaper. He won Eyre for Labor at the 2001 election on the retirement of Julian Grill, switching to the new seat of Murchison-Eyre in 2005. Bowler was appointed to the Ministry in November 2005, but dumped in March 2007 after his close links with lobbyists Brian Burke and Julian Grill were exposed by the Corruption and Crime Commission. Denied Labor pre-selection for the 2008 election, Bowler contested and won Kalgoorlie as an Independent.

Peter Brimelow writes : On November 21 , 2008 , I spoke in Baltimore at the inaugural meeting of the  college

 group Youth for Western Civilization. I congratulated the group for starting up, then paused before continuing, because the irony of the title, of celebrating an apparently forgotten idea, suddenly became overwhelmingly apparent. I went on to explain to the mostly bewildered, silent audience of several hundred how the United States was arguably founded as the last of the Western civilizations, its rhetoric harkening back to the classical civilizations of Athens, Rome, and others.

The “ digital workforce ” may sound like science fiction , conjuring up images of lines of robots running through  businesses completing tedious tasks. In reality, a digital workforce comprises of machine learning software and algorithmic automation systems. Its implementation within a business ensures that tasks can be completed with less resources in terms of human labour. Artificial Intelligence software such as “chatbots” has already revolutionized customer service departments with its automated interaction capability. In the near future, it’s safe to expect that any repetitive process - from insurance quotes to IT help desks - will soon be managed by digital employees.

EVE Online’s new “Abyssal Deadspace” areas let players engage in true one-on-one combat for big rewards. Just pray you don’t run into BoRn2ReIgN. Abyssal Deadspace pockets, introduced in the latest EVE expansion Onslaught, are a new way for players to engage in high-stakes combat. At the end of the hazard-filled Abyssal Deadspace pockets, new stargates beckon players into Abyssal arenas. In the heart of these arenas, rare and valuable loot is held in a secure container. The only thing stopping a player from scooping it into their cargohold and making a clean escape is another player angling for the same target.

Let ’ s dispense with the question of whether Democrat Ralph Northam is being treated unfairly . This being said, Republicans and other opponents of late term abortions need to take the long view on this scandal and use it to press the advantage with undecided voters on the matter of late term abortions. Recent polls have demonstrated that the majority of voters in swing states are decidedly pro-life, and with each day that passes, voters in those states are considering whether this sort of political miscalculation is truly reflective of the entire party.

Two capitals are look set to burst through the 40C mark and another swelters through its 10th day of a  severe heatwave

The high temperature across two of the nation's major capitals on Monday has only become increasingly unbearable as days go by and is set to intensify as the week moves along. With already no indication of any temperature break over the coming days, doctors urge the public to stay hydrated, try to stay in shady or cool places, take short rests, apply plenty of sunscreen and practice personal hygiene to limit risks associated with heat strokes and exhaustion.

Voting for the eight phase of panchayat elections has begun across the state amidst heightened security . Polling is scheduled  from seven in the morning to five in the afternoon. About one thousand polling centers are set up to facilitate peaceful voting . Apart from adequate number of personnel and weapons deployed at these polling booths , Unmanned Aerial Vehicle or UAVs is also patrolling and video graphing activities around the centre. Various heavy vehicles and passenger carriers has also been seized on check posts so as to maintain law and order. As this phase marks the concluding elections process , government expects that higher voter turnout compared to the previous seven rounds.

The OLCC is cracking down on marijuana retailers that sell to minors. PORTLAND, Ore. – A rule increasing penalties for marijuana retailers that sell marijuana to minors takes effect Friday. The new rule allows a marijuana worker’s permit to be revoked if the person intentionally sells marijuana to a minor. It increases the penalty for the unintentional sale of marijuana to a minor to a 30-day license suspension or a $4,950 fine. Previously the penalty was a 10-day license suspension or a $1,650 fine. The Oregon Liquor Control Commission re-evaluated penalties after reviewing compliance from recent sting operations.

MANCHESTER UNITED outcast Morgan Schneiderlin has emerged as a January target for Inter Milan , according to reports . Schneiderlin 's United career stalled following the sacking of former manager Louis Van Gaal. Due to the increased competition for places Schneiderlin decided his future lies away from Old Trafford. With that in mind, Gazzetta dello Sport believe the two sides have discussed a January switch that could be financially advantageous to all parties.

Peter, an aspiring pilot, bravely set off on a solo cross-country journey in his makeshift aircraft, an eight-seat Beechcraft loaded to its maximum. To the horror of bystanders and emergency services, Peter's aircraft struggled with power, diving and crashing before reaching a lower altitude, barely avoiding electricity poles, trees and houses on the way down. Miraculously, his life was saved thanks to his precaution of wearing a parachute, safely landing the plane in the soft grass of an adjoining pasture.

There were two dividing impulses in Robin Williams's performances that could, roughly, be called his American and British sides. On the American side, there was the slushy tendency towards sentimentality, for which he became increasingly known, which, at its best, resulted in Dead Poets Society, The Birdcage and Mrs Doubtfire, and, at its worst, became Patch Adams and Old Dogs. Hollywood has long had a tendency to adopt the finest and most interesting comedians and then determinedly blunt the hard edges that make them interesting. Along with Richard Pryor, Williams was the most obvious example of that.

Peter Brown took the precaution of carrying a parachute on his home-made plane but it wasn't enough to save him. Mr Brown, 57, was found dead inside the wreckage of his home-made ultralight after crashing in trees, metres from the Lovedale Store and Cafe in the Hunter Valley cafe yesterday. Hunter Valley Inspector Peter Vromans confirmed his parachute was onboard but it had not been deployed. "That will be part of the investigations," he said. Recreational Aviation Australia president Michael Monck said parachutes were not mandatory on flights, though they could add an extra element of safety.

Hundreds have digital say on how they manage their health and wellbeing . Last year Healthier Lancashire and South Cumbria  launched its Your Way wellbeing programme to connect residents to local community support and services. The Your Way wellbeing programme gives people with long-term physical or mental health conditions the tools, training and guidance needed to make life better for themselves. An estimated 15,000 individuals across Lancashire and South Cumbria are expected to benefit from the programme, offering courses from CV writing, workplace skills, to well-being tools such as mindfulness, music, creative and therapeutic.

The 2014 Chevrolet Camaro Z28 . DETROIT — General Motors is recalling more cars for problems with ignition switches . The Camaro Z28 has now been added to the list of affected vehicles due to issues related to ignition switches. GM is recalling 9.5 million vehicles from model years from 1997-2014 and will issue a repair with a software upgrade for owners. Customers with the Camaro Z28 should have their car taken in to the GM dealership for repair or the GM helpline. There are potentially a million vehicles being recalled but officials believe the actual number will likely be closer to 200,000.

Should Bikes Be Allowed On Muni Metro ? A recent news report on an injured cyclist denied passage on the  muni prompted outrage. The San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency was immediately put on the defensive by the report and strongly condemned the denial of entry for cyclists. The agency argued that as a light rail system Muni Metro simply didn't have the space or infrastructure needed to accommodate bikes on board. San Francisco cyclists however argued that transportation on a bus with sufficient capacity could offer an opportunity to lessen congestion and lead to a greener, more eco-friendly environment.

While it ’ s not the most glamorous construction project , the state Department of Transportation says it ’ s  necessary . Work has started on rebuilding an overpass near Parkersville. Crews will upgrade the existing structure, reinforce its support system, widen it and update safety features. Work is estimated to be completed in October. Detours are currently in place in order to ensure the safety of both construction workers and commuters. Additionally, due to the heavy noise and construction occurring in the area, DOT officials advise neighbors to sound proof their homes.

The five-storied 'Farhad Mansion ' resembles any other well-maintained house in an affluent neighbourhood of Chittagong city . Yet no  family is seen living in it. For years this historic mansion has stood empty, lost in the splendour of past memories of Farhad’s affluent lifestyle. Rumor has it, the spirit of his ill-fated lover still haunted it at night, never willing to part from her mortal lover. Eventually, Farhad was crushed and now his erstwhile majestic house is beginning to succumb to neglect, haunted by the curses of shattered love. Yet visitors are entranced, visitors that go and reminisce the tragedy and admire the flimsy remains.

In Atlanta This Weekend ? Then You Should Be At Momocon . Anime and gaming convention Momocon is on day  2 and it's bigger than ever. Held at the Georgia World Congress Centre in Downtown Atlanta, this family-friendly fan convention has something to satisfy everyone. Not just anime and gaming though - attend momocon to access panels with your favorite TV and YouTube stars, witness or compete in the gaming tournaments, make friends and dress-up, find great memorabilia and figures, and make wonderful new memories. It’s even pet friendly too!

LITCHFIELD , Maine ( AP ) — A Maine woman is trying to protect a series of osprey nests atop  a utility pole 

Samantha Knapp of Lincolnville is a conservation biology major and a self-taught biologist who noticed that Maine had higher than average numbers of osprey but faced threats from nearby developments and utility pole replacements. She works closely with Maine utility company, Central Maine Power Company (CMP), who has agreed to fund the building of a specially designed platform next to the original utility pole, allowing the birds to migrate without having to abandon their nests.

Where will he wake up next? A prison cell? A tropical hammock? Or suspended on a cliff? It has the makings of a pretty good TV show, in the vein of Quantum Leap. Each day, a man wakes up to find himself in a different bed in a different part of the world. The experience, while clearly always disorienting, can vary dramatically based on the circumstances. Some days he’s in prison, or squatting in a storage bin. Other mornings he wakes up in a goat pen or a tropical hammock.

While it’s not the most glamorous construction project, the state Department of Transportation says it’s something that needs fixing. No, we’re not talking about something on the scale of four Route 8/25 bridges in Bridgeport that were demolished and erected over just one summer. It’s the replacement of old sign supports that hold up those large green signs that direct us at intersections and exits. “The new sign supports are necessary because the old sign supports have reached the end of their life expectancy. The new supports will comply with the latest state and federal standards,” DOT says.

Hundreds have digital say on how they manage their health and wellbeing. Last year Healthier Lancashire and South Cumbria asked the Healthwatch Collaborative to help them find out what local people think about using digital technology to manage their health and wellbeing. Almost 2,000 people got involved in the conversation about digital health. Healthwatch have now published the resulting ‘Have your say: digital health’ report. The aim of the project was to explore how local people currently use technology to manage their health and wellbeing – and that of their families and those they support or care for.

Capital abundance, low interest rates, and high volatility are creating new challenges and opportunities in equity markets. To succeed in this crowded and complex global landscape, you must take your investment expertise to a new level. Private Equity and Venture Capital, an Executive Education program at Harvard Business School, explores cutting-edge industry models and related issues—from venture capital, growth equity, and buyouts to industry infrastructure, portfolio strategies, and decision-making processes. Designed to improve your effectiveness at all stages of a deal, this program examines innovative approaches to asset management, financial strategy, organizational structure, and portfolio management.

Or not . In the world of digital photography , you do n't have to flash a smile . Instead  you can say “cheese” if you’re into the posed, traditional look . But the good news is that those words don't dictate what your photo shoot looks like . You can come up with your own story to tell — or look outside for inspiration and tap into fashion mags for what styles of clothing or poses you can use for your shots . It has seemed for a while as though the global financial storm was going to deal a mostly glancing blow  to India's economy

This glimmer of hope may, however, now be receding, with many Indian banks declaring sharp drops in stock values and projects showing worrying declines in annual progress. High profile Indian companies are likely to lose vast sums from investments overseas as trade tensions with traditional markets increase, bringing considerable economic strain back home. Exporters are reporting softening sales due to flaccid markets both domestically and globally, amplifying calls for incentives from various Central Government funds.

Considering all the comings and goings of people involved in the project , we should be grateful that Bohemian Rhapsody  is seeing the light of the day at all.The movie stars Rami Malek as Queen frontman Freddy Mercury. Malek spent months immersed in research and multiple acting coachs, stunt trainers and an orchestra of musicians all came together to bring his portrayal of Freddie to the screen. Both long time and new Queen fans have been showing much appreciation for Malek’s success in embodying Freddie and people are sure that their music has been brought to life brilliantly by Malek's fine and distinct performance.

Banking giant Standard Chartered on Tuesday announced a return of dividends for shareholders after a two-year hiatus as it reported a surge in annual profits following restructuring and cutbacks. The Asia-focused lender said it would pay out a full-year dividend of 11 cents per share, citing "improving financial performance and strong capital". It also said pre-tax profit jumped 175 percent on-year to $3.01 billion in 2017. Shares in the firm rose almost two percent in afternoon Hong Kong trading, having been in negative territory before the results were announced during the break.

Ex-Communications Director Anthony Scaramucci had extensive plans for President Trump 's communications department before he was booted from the White  House

During the 10 days that Scaramucci held his role, he was adamant in working towards effective messaging to publicize the Trump agenda. His strategy included being able to diffuse criticism of the President’s attitude and reinforcing communication within the staff members. While his methodology made him some enemies in the cabinet, including the new White House Chief of Staff John Kelly, he felt that Trump would respect and accept the high level of accomplishment from his staff.

Video — 1 videodisc ( 140 min . ) : sd. , col. ; 4 3/4 in . A dramatisation  about a true story about racial issues during the time of aplatt formation during 1956 of families living in Kensington area and suburbs

The film is set in Kensington, focusing on five families experiencing aplatt (disfunctionality in black urban American communities). With bigotry and moral decay between family, struggles of inner cities erupt; inter-generational privilege heighten stress for victims of racism, racial laws at play create deprivation, shaming, unresponsiveness in court system when voices were not respected.

One person died and 8,469 people were affected in torrential rains that prevails in Galle from Saturday evening, Galle Additional District Secretary M.M.M Sharfaz said. Over 8,469 people in Baddegama, Yakkalmulla, Imaduwa, Thawalama, Niyagama, Nagoda, Habaraduwa and Akmeemana were adversely affected, he said. The Galle Disaster Management Center Head said the deceased was identified as a father of four (60), a resident of Urala in Wanduramba. He had drowned in flood and his body was found yesterday evening, he said. He said five houses were completely destructed, and 244 were partly damaged.

If you would like to support the Down Syndrome Association of West Michigan's campaign of kindness, you may visit the organization's crowd funding site to help pay for supplies. The more money raised, the more random acts of kindness those in our community with Down syndrome will be able to commit. The Down Syndrome Association of West Michigan is a resource and advocacy organization promoting public awareness and supporting lifelong opportunities for individuals with Down syndrome and their families. Down syndrome is the most commonly occurring chromosomal condition, with one in every 700 babies being born with Down syndrome.

(CNN) -- France's Michel Desjoyeaux won the Vendee Globe solo round the world yacht race for a record second time on Sunday. Desjoyeaux crosses the line in triumph at Les Sables to win his second Vendee Globe. He crossed the line off Les Sables d'Olonne in a time of 84 days, three hours, nine minutes and eight seconds to smash the race record by over three days and claim a 150,000 euros first prize. Desjoyeaux first won the sailing classic in 2001 and emerged victorious again after an incident-packed race which saw two French competitors dramatically rescued.

The Brexit crowd refused to believe the experts in the run-up to the referendum vote. The warnings from every leading economic body, including the Bank of England, were dismissed as scaremongering that should be ignored. Now, apparently, the words of the Governor of the Bank of England and other economists are so influential they can talk us into a recession – I am baffled by this double-think. But we need not agonise over all the talk now, because the facts are mounting up. Last week, we reported exclusive figures showing a sharp fall in the number of shoppers out on our high streets.

Voting for the eight phase of panchayat elections has begun across the state amidst heightened security. Polling is scheduled to end at 2 PM today. While 43 sarpanch and 681 panch have been elected unopposed, polling will take place for 331 sarpanch and 2007 panch seats, with 6304 candidates in the fray. An electorate of 5,15,121 will be voting for sarpanch constituencies and 4,19,775 for panch constituencies. In this phase, 2633 polling stations have been set up - 550 in Kashmir division and 2083 in Jammu division. Of these, 361 have been categorised as 'hypersensitive', including 171 in Kashmir division and 190 in Jammu division.

What Steve Lonegan can teach Republicans about making life hell for Democrats . New Jersey Senate candidate Steve Lonegan may  just be an individual political aspirant but his moves will provide GOP as well as other independent representatives with much more of an impact this mid term election season. Onlookers speculate that his vote campaign shows that the Independent Line candidacy may come up as an impediment to strong Democratic supporters in and across various state voting results. By distributing his budget around the growing businesses, rather than accepting the heavily voted political figures, Mr Lonegan emphasizes true movement amongst people.

Planting the Savannah grasses in front of Cary Home seemed like a good idea in 2013, when they received a grant for the project. LAFAYETTE, Ind. — Planting the Savannah grasses in front of Cary Home seemed like a good idea in 2013, when it received a grant for the project. "It grew much taller than we needed it — wanted it — to be," Cary Home Director Rebecca Humphrey said when asked about Tuesday's removal of the grasses from the front of the home in the 1500 block of South 18th Street.

John Bennett ( July 20 ) , a teacher at Westside Middle School , was upset by the School Board ’s decision to cancel the school’s proposed expansion project. John felt the expansion was a necessity for both his students and colleagues and he expressed his distress about it during an emergency school board meeting held Tuesday. Other teachers also expressed dismay, along with parents of the students. After hearing from everyone, the board revised their earlier decision. Instead of cutting the expansion altogether, the board agreed to look for potential cost cutting measures so that the expansion can proceed within a manageable budget.

Around 2.54 million new cars were registered in 2017 compared with 2.69 million the previous year. More than 157,000 cars rolled off production lines last month, 3.5% more than the October 2016, while exports have increased by 5%. They say they are planning on spending the same or less on plant and machinery, according to the manufacturers' organisation. David Cameron will use a speech to lure business back to the UK, reversing the trend of "offshoring" - where businesses relocate manufacturing and customer service to countries where overall costs are cheaper.

A Houston district court judge who lost a re-election bid on Tuesday is facing criticism for releasing a majority of  individuals charged with low-level misdemeanors during the novel coronavirus outbreak. The controversial ruling to release defendants on a $200 bond was defended by the judge in his explanation that vulnerable citizens needed to be released due to the health risks the virus could cause in the jail's close quarters. Judge Michael Gomez released 78 defendants; 19 still remain in jail. Despite having no control of individuals after they are released, the local Houston sheriffs are in dissent of this move.

A high profile heavyweight boxing match at Sands Casino Resort Bethlehem will be broadcast live on NBC Saturday as Tomasz Adamek of Poland and Steve "USS" Cunningham of Philadelphia meet for a highly anticipated rematch. The winner will be in line for a shot to face International Boxing Federation Heavyweight Champion Wladimir Klitschko. “Adamek and Cunningham are going to put up a great fight to be in the number two IBF spot among heavyweights,” says promoter J Russell Peltz. “Adamek won the first time in 2007 when both he and Cunningham were cruiserweights. Now, the stakes are even higher."

Former police officer Drew Peterson threw his wife to the floor one night, grabbed her throat and told her he "could kill her there and then," a one-time co-worker of the wife testified Tuesday at a hearing to determine what evidence can be admitted in Peterson's murder trial. Kathleen Savio, Drew Peterson's third wife, who mysteriously drowned in a bathtub six years ago, essentially is testifying from the grave during the hearing. Witnesses are expected to tell a judge how Savio discussed and wrote about her fears that Peterson, a former Bolingbrook police sergeant, would kill her.

A group of Solomon Islands timber exporters and government officials is visiting Australia and New Zealand this week. The export mission starts in Brisbane from 22 – 25 March and moves to Auckland from 25-30 March 2015. The group will meet with importers and government officials including a meeting with the New Zealand Timber Importers Association at the Pacific Islands Trade & Invest office in Newmarket. As 60% of sawn timber is sold to markets in Australia and New Zealand, the visits aim to increase understanding among both exporters and importers of market requirements and opportunities for Solomon Islands sawn timber.

This week, in a closed-door meeting of Congressional Democrats with President Obama, Representative Ed Perlmutter of Colorado bluntly said what has been on many politicians' minds: "Larry Summers. Bad choice." Mr. Obama was visibly annoyed and mounted a defense of Mr. Summers, his former economic policy adviser who also served as Treasury secretary under President Bill Clinton. Mr. Summers, who the president said had become something of a "progressive whipping boy," appears to be a strong contender to succeed Ben S. Bernanke as chairman of the Federal Reserve.

The long-awaited third Bill & Ted film has been confirmed. Titled Bill & Ted Face The Music, the movie is the first movie in the franchise for 27 years and will follow on from 1989’s Bill & Ted’s Excellent Adventure and 1991’s Bill & Ted’s Bogus Journey. Following much speculation, The Hollywood Reporter has now confirmed news of Bill & Ted 3, with both Keanu Reeves and Alex Winter signing on to reprise their eponymous roles. Creators Chris Matheson and Ed Solomon return to pen the script, with Dean Parisot (Galaxy Quest) directing.

The pheasant-hunting season in New York is under way, and thanks to a great stocking program hunters should find plenty of action. New York’s DEC says it has released close to 25,000 adult pheasants on lands open to public hunting. The pheasant season began Oct. 1 in northern and eastern portions of the state, and will open on Saturday in central and western parts and Nov. 1 on Long Island. Pheasants are raised at the DEC’s Reynolds Game Farm in Ithaca. The majority of the birds will be released on state wildlife-management areas and cooperative hunting areas prior to and during the fall hunting season.

ARSENE WENGER last night confessed he passed up the chance to buy Didier Drogba – for just £100,000! The Arsenal boss could have landed the super striker seven years ago, while he was playing for lowly French outfit Le Mans in the French Second Division. But Wenger stressed he was not the only manager to snub a player who went on to join today’s FA Cup semi-final opponents Chelsea for £24m two years later. “Don’t forget all the French clubs watched him,” he pointed out. “Nobody took him. He went from Le Mans to Guingamp.

French President Emmanuel Macron wants to invigorate the European Union as a global power and spurn the populist nationalism that  has gained traction across the continent. He intends to move the European Union to becoming the most powerful trade and technological group of nations on earth and revive democracy. This will involve engaging proactively with major global actors and partnering with smaller regional economies to secure mutual success. Additionally, Macron has promised sweeping economic reforms in both domestic and European policies with the view to drive growth, stoke technological innovation, and shield industries from technological disruption.

Black Starlets coach Samuel Fabin says his side were not threatened at any point in their convincing win over India 

Coach Fabin credited his boys with playing their very best throughout the game. They took control early, with powerful combinations and confident ball movement. Goals were exchanged during the match and at the half-time mark, Ghana were leading 2-1. The Black Starlets then fired ahead, controlling the possession, not allowing India an inch. Fabin lauded his side for continuing to press until the final whistle, conceding only two further goals on their way to a 5-2 victory.

We've picked our top five favorite trailers from this year's awards show  arguably, more fun to watch than the show itself! The 2013 Spike VGX awards have come and gone. Say what you will about video games award shows  and trust us, plenty of people are  but they do make for an excellent time for developers to show off what they're cooking up across the next few months (or years). To us, at least, it doesn't really matter who wins and loses; the trailers that tease all the hot new games in development are the real prize.

There were two dividing impulses in Robin Williams 's performances that could , roughly , be called his American and  international comic personae . His American persona, sometimes even grotesque and fierce, almost resembled a white circus clown delivering merciless blasts of cynical criticism - whil,es His international persona turned out more pensive and melancholic - darker yet attentive to subtle undercurrents. Such transition back and forth between comedy and drama — daringly encoded in only his looks, expressions and hushed allusions – showcased an otherwordly complexity rare to that or any medium.

Kids and computers can be a beautiful mix or a disaster waiting to happen. Education-based applications and popular games are some of the biggest reasons kids get on the computer, and the various dangers of the Internet are one of the biggest reasons parents shy away from granting free-reign access. Such is where the MiiPC comes in. This small desktop PC, which is a cube scarcely larger than a softball, is aimed at families with young children, and offers, among other things, parental controls and runs on Android Jelly Bean. Read our full SlashGear review to find out what all the MiiPC has to offer.

I have written previously about my own pets, and the most common prompt for me to do this has been when my own animals have reached the end of their lives. For me, it has been a type of grief therapy sometimes, with the opportunity to write an obituary for an animal that's been an important part of my life. This week, the good news is that this is not an obituary. One of my two cats, Couscous, has been unwell, but so far, treatment has been successful, so this is a tale about her illness, not about her death.

Plushenko ’ s glorious career was finished . He had hoped to cap it at home after a comeback from  spine surgery. However, he eventually realized he wasn't going to compete. In 2018 he tried once more to qualify, though unfortunately he ultimately had to concede due to medical reasons. He ended his sports career at a Sochi 2014 interview where he announced, “My career ended long ago. This is just my send-off.” Plushenko was an absolute warrior - he even has a jumps named after him - who fully took advantage of each of his seven Olympic games.

The Texas Supreme Court has transferred about 80 cases from El Paso's 8th Court of Appeals in a first of its kind move to reduce a growing backlog. AUSTIN — In an unprecedented move, the Texas Supreme Court has stripped more than 80 cases from the 8th Court of Appeals in El Paso due to the court's growing backlog. The cases, some of which are up to 3 years old, are being transferred to other appeals courts in Texas. Most are at the final stage of processing, awaiting a decision from the three justices on El Paso's court.

MANILA , Philippines — House Majority Leader Rolando Andaya Jr. will yield his position to Capiz 2nd District Rep. Fredenil  Castro following his clash with Budget Secretary Benjamin Diokno. The announcement by Andaya to resign was made through a statement. He denied receiving offers or enticements, despite unverified information linking him to contract allegations involving Chinese funded projects. He also denied allegations of soliciting kickbacks, saying they’re beyond “the moral fiber of his public service.” 

At the same time, Diokno said he welcomed the development as it proves that Andaya is acting in good faith, respecting Congress’ “right to probe” allegations.

Jesse Winker will undergo season-ending shoulder surgery. He was batting .299 this year with 7 homers and 43 RBI. Throughout the last couple of seasons, Jesse Winker dealt with pain his right shoulder. After he felt more pain Monday, it was determined that Winker would need surgery to repair his shoulder. He will miss the remainder of the season. The Reds placed Winker on the 10-day disabled list Thursday with a right shoulder subluxation. "Man, I have no idea it is," said Winker. "I know my shoulder hurts. That’s all I know."

Both phones are rumoured to have powerful specifications, although the Plus will boast an upgraded processor as well as an extra rear camera. While exact specs remain up in the air, we're hearing they may have different screen sizes and densities as well.

My research aims to improve our understanding of how cells with the same genome can develop dramatically different behaviors. For example, consider the mechanical abilities of a muscle cell compared to the electrical excitability of a neuron, or the industrious activity of bone building cells in a youthful person compared to an elderly one. Each of these cells, (if taken from the same individual) has an identical genome — and yet each is “reading” a very distinct subset of that genome and consequently carrying out very different behaviors. The choice of what to read and what to hide away is made during development.

Capello has overseen a 10-match unbeaten run, following the back-to-back wins against Kazakhstan and Belarus, and can now enjoy an unbeaten qualifying campaign going into their match against Croatia. All that is required is a win over Croatia, ensuring fans travel to Wembley in anticipation, excitement and high hopes.

EVE Online ’ s new “ Abyssal Deadspace ” areas let players engage in true one-on-one combat for big rewards 

Players now have access to the Abyssal Deadspace, located within EVE's expansive universe, to participate in exhilarating space battles and garner enormous rewards in exchange. Aside from tangible prizes, combatants who test their space survival and warfare capabilities are exposed to tense, real-time-oriented engagements without automated control. Participating is similar to previous tests such as Burn Jita; however, due to its many isolated gates, locations and leveled warp drives, even a space traveller familiar with navigating and tracking battlefields needs keen wits and instincts to escape alive.

What Steve Lonegan can teach Republicans about making life hell for Democrats. New Jersey Senate candidate Steve Lonegan may not beat Cory Booker, but his run offers some interesting lessons for Republicans. I’m betting that the candidate with the poll lead, higher favorables, and more experienced campaign team will, indeed, win, but I’m interested in how the race has become a test kitchen for attacks on liberals. Steve Lonegan, Booker’s opponent, is running his third statewide campaign, his first as a nominee.

Richard Swift Obituary: Richard Swift’s Obituary by the TheTimesNews.com. Richard Swift, singer-songwriter, musician and producer who worked with the Shins and many others, has died at the age of 41, according to multiple news sources. The sad news was announced in a Facebook post and it was confirmed to Pitchfork and other media outlets. No cause of death was given. In June, a GoFundMe campaign was started to help Swift with medical costs for an undisclosed life threatening medical condition. The multi-instrumentalist was a member of the Shins from 2011 until 2016 and he was a touring musician with the Black Keys.

WASHINGTON — Thousands of commuters across the region were delayed Thursday morning by an apparent work action by Metro’s largest union. About 20 percent of bus service was impacted by the “late out,” Metro spokeswoman Sherri Ly said, which meant many buses either arrived late or did not arrive at all across Maryland, Virginia and the District because drivers reported to work well after the scheduled starts of their shifts. Late in the morning, Metro told riders about the delays via Twitter. Many riders had been complaining about missing buses or longer-than usual waits for hours.

Big Data is transforming the way Canadian businesses are able to build meaningful relationships with their customers . Today the  amount of data available to Canadian firms has greatly increased thanks to emerging data sources such as social media, public records and loyalty cards. By using predictive analytics to extract insights, businesses have been able to use customer segmentation to gain more targeted intelligence in order to craft targeted campaigns that produce better results. In addition, the use of A/B testing provides insights into product positioning that can give firms a competitive edge and allow them to quickly fine-tune offerings to reflect current customer trends.

According to a new poll by pro-business policy group the Bay Area Council, 34 percent of Bay Area residents are "likely to move out of the Bay Area in the next few years," or so they say. For the study, conducted online, Oakland-based EMC Research polled 1,000 residents of the region from February 12 through March 9. Citing a variety of gripes familiar to all — housing costs, related cost of living, and traffic issues chief among them — 13 percent said they "strongly agree" and 21 percent said they "somewhat agree" that they'll move.

The British are known for their collective stiff upper lip. The elements of British style translate easily in every region, even in the subtropics. A comfortable armchair, slipcovers, small prints, antiques and wicker furniture are all British touches that look good anywhere. -- Slipcovers. On sofas, on chairs, on pillows. ''Chintzes and paisleys look great even in this climate,'' said Melissa B. Luetgert of Designers Age in Naples, Fla.
-- Patterns. Leafy designs, white-on-white and chintzes are showing up on upholstery, wall coverings and accent pieces.

Hi , National Geographic , it 's me , Ryan . I got your package today and I guess I  need to thank you . So, I want to extend my warmest appreciation for the delightful present you sent me. As a fellow admirer of science and adventure, your kindly support always spurs my ambitious interests. On the same note, I shall return the same positivity of encouragement I received in its magnitude. After all, life is more worthwhile when experienced in good company, especially when there is shared passion between. This memento reminds me to remain invested in both imagination and good things to come.

LITCHFIELD, Maine (AP) — A Maine woman is trying to protect a series of osprey nests atop power poles that are threatened by a $1.55 billion project to modernize the state's power distribution system. But so far Rebecca Loveland of Litchfield has been unsuccessful in her campaign to spare the nests or at least provide alternatives for the big birds' homes. Poles supporting the nests will be removed as part of Central Maine Power Company's modernization effort known as the Maine Power Reliability Project. Loveland tells the Kennebec Journal at least 60 osprey nests will be removed.

The Jewish-American advocacy group J Street , which bills itself as the dovish alternative to the influential American Israel Public  Affairs Committee, or AIPAC, launched a virtual Summit. At its virtual summit, J Street released plans for legislative activities meant to align US-Israeli policies with both nation’s needs, as well as non-governmental dialogue between those both critical of and sympathetic towards the state of Israel. Notably, one bill J Street supports would undo the 2002 Authorization for Use of Military Force for Iraq, saying such language must not be applied for current political fights.

Two cemeteries in Washington County are prime examples of the wealth of history that graveyards can hold -- and the  areas around them. Strawberry Hill Cemetery, located south of Fayetteville, dates back to 1843, while Oak Hill Cemetery, at 12th and Mulberry Streets, was started in 1858. Both sites tell of soldiers, slaveowners, and average Americans living throughout Washington County and highlight how vital an understanding of graveyards can be to getting a full picture of a community’s history. Interesting physical markers still tell the tales of individuals and their final resting places today.

In recent years , platformers have proven to be a hospitable genre for video game developers looking to flaunt their  artistic flair. Not only has the art direction been nothing short of jaw-dropping in modern titles such as "Celeste" and "Ori and the Blind Forest" but the clever use of backdrops, 3D parallax effects and isometric settings, have granted them a visual nuance hitherto unseen in other titles. Adding to the auditory splendor and some rewarding progression systems and enemy varieties, contemporary platformers continue to set the benchmark for graphical and playstyle excellence within the gaming medium.

This is the ninth dispatch in a series from Jeff Goodell , who will be investigating the effect of climate  change. Jeff Goodell continued his journey, moving from the beaches of the Outer Banks of North Carolina, an area long predicted to face higher-than-usual storm activity. Goodell is chronicling the human and economic effects of more extreme and frequent climate-driven weather. People here were resigned to the power and inevitability of climate change, even as most accepted it would bring them economic, social and environmental losses in coming decades. Even so, it also fostered among people here a resignation to fate and determination to confront a difficult future head-on.

When I opened the brown clasp envelope and pulled out the 21-page spiral book , I was startled . Dr. Light had finished the project report! This was well beyond what I was expecting given how busy he was. I hastily skimmed through the report which included beautiful visuals. Dr. Light had clearly put a lot of hard work into it. His commitment to the project and sincere efforts in delivering the report at the given deadline was extraordinary. I felt proud to be associated with Dr. Light, who I knew had such an outstanding work ethic.

For three turbulent centuries , the glimpse of a square sail and dragon-headed prow on the horizon struck terror into  the hearts of merchants and peasants alike:

These were the Viking raiders whose plundered homes, chapels and farms on raids along the coasts and rivers of Western Europe. Over the centuries they traveled as far south as North Africa and became known to later generations as Sea Raiders and exploring and trading almost throughout their Mediterranean routes and European colonies. But, Vikings eventually dwindled and never again posed any kind of threat to the continental coastal trade.

Brothers Osborne performed at a fundraiser for Democratic Tennessee gubernatorial candidate Karl Dean in Nashville . “ I agree with  many of Dean's positions and it felt good to play for him," TJ Osborne, of Brothers Osborne, said in a press release. At the event, Brothers Osborne were joined by Trisha Yearwood and Vince Gill and also performed classic country and rock songs as well as some of their biggest hits like “It Ain’t My Fault.”

Both TJ and John Osborne shared their excitement over playing to an engaged and energized audience to support Karl Dean in the gubernatorial race in Nashville.

Two years ago, Red Sox prospect Ryan Westmoreland seemed to be on the fast track to the majors. The Portsmouth native, who the Sox selected in the fifth round of the 2008 draft, got off to a blazing start in his professional career in 2009 in Single-A Lowell. In 60 games with the Spinners, the outfielder hit .296 with seven homers and 19 stolen bases, and his five-tool potential helped him quickly ascend up everyone's list of top Red Sox prospects. But all of that changed in a hurry when, in March of 2010, he was diagnosed with a cavernous malformation in his brain.

The first image of Earth from lunar orbit . Before an Apollo-era NASA could launch a few humans on top  of the Apollo space rocket, they achieved an earlier milestone with an orbit of the first Earth-shot-ever. It was taken with a 38.7 kg Ranger 8 craft launched a few days prior. With 600,000 scattered stars over our pale blue home and swirls of indigo and white hinting at the North American region below. The mesmeric shot seen all over the world would soon become one of the enduring visual for space exploration and the birth of the new millennium.

Doing business in British Columbia is particularly challenging because of the province’s reputation as a hotbed of environmental and aboriginal activism. John Winter worries it could get worse, threatening $90-billion in planned projects, if the Northern Gateway oil pipeline isn’t built. “If this thing fails it will be a serious and significant issue,” Mr. Winter, president and CEO of the B.C. Chamber of Commerce, which represents 125 chambers around the province with 36,000 businesses in every sector of the economy, said in an interview.

The eight-episode 1980s-set drama will air in the summer . Mere weeks after finishing production on the pilot and securing  streaming rights, the series is moving swiftly in the leadup to release. As cast and crew alike gush with enthusiasm, excitement is building for the upcoming show. Reviews have already been incredibly positive, giving audience's an early taste of what's to come. Social media has exploded with fans' theories, adding to the drama as they imagine where the storyline will go. Critics seem confident this will be the series that steals the summer, continuing its track record of wowing and delighting viewers.

WASHINGTON – Congress is moving to put under military control all armed contractors operating in combat zones, a Pentagon recommendation that could run into resistance at the State Department. The Senate this month included such a requirement in its 2008 defense spending bill. Democratic Sen. Carl Levin, chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, told reporters Wednesday he is confident the House will go along with the idea and include it in a final bill sent to President George W. Bush. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice was to testify about the subject Thursday before the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee.

U.S. President Donald Trump attends a swearing in ceremony for senior staff at the White House in Washington , DC 

The ceremony started with a welcome address from White House Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders and then a swearing in of members of the National Security team. President Trump followed with some comments, recognizing and appreciating their contributions and saying "America will never again betray you or the millions of hard-working Americans, like those present today, who seek a better future for their family and a prosperous, secure nation". After completing the ceremony, he thanked everyone and proclaimed it a new dawn of opportunity and cooperation with allies.

Throwing knives at your HSC project and then dunking it in the pool isn't the usual way of checking for success, but it was a big part of Tom Denby's major work. The 17-year-old set out in year 11 to build a wetsuit that could protect scuba divers from shark bites as part of the accelerated Design and Technology class at Mosman High School. The finished product has four sleeves that go over both arms and legs, is made of aramid fabric and metal mesh wire and has been coated in black and white rubber spray to repel sharks.

NSA Director General Keith Alexander maintains that his agency's tactics are lawful and used against foreign adversaries. The National Security Agency is using the tracking data intended for Google's advertisers to locate its targets. According to the Washington Post's new analysis of an internal presentation Edward Snowden leaked earlier in the year, the NSA has been using the numeric identifiers in Google's "PREF" cookies for hacking. A cookie is a small piece of data sent from a website that is stored in a user's browser. In addition to customizing browsing experiences on some sites, advertisers use them to target ads for specific audiences.

The word hero gets thrown around so much that its use has lost much of the intended impact. Indie filmmaker Denise Ohio restores a bit of the word’s luster with this surprisingly compelling portrait of Frank Minden. Who? An ordinary, hard-working man, a WWII vet and master diesel machinist, the 76-year-old Minden has never signed a multimillion-dollar contract with a sports franchise or refused an Oscar in honor of the worthy cause of the day. But in the short space of thirty minutes, Ohio illustrates what makes this St. Louis man so admired and respected by those around him.

Gotham opens Season 2 on Monday, Sept. 21, where it now leads into the freshman drama Minority Report. * Homeland Season 5 has cast Ukrainian actor Mark Ivanir (Royal Pains) in the recurring role of Ivan Krupin, Saul’s intelligence counterpart in the SVR, THR reports.

The Frewsburg Central School board of education received an update Thursday on the capital project that began last spring. The primary work of the capital project involved the renovation and upgrades to the auditorium, the bleachers, the press box, science classrooms, high school offices and air conditioning in classrooms. The project allowed for the budgeting of four alternate projects if the total budget had enough room for the additions. The district, according to Jerome Lee Yaw, administrative team member, will be able to complete three of the four alternate projects.
