Although there’s long been a debate over the accuracy of health information online, many U.S. Internet users aren’t hesitant to use the Web when they want answers to health-related questions. And rather than dedicated health sites, the vast majority of them begin their research at a search engine. A new study out tonight from the Pew Research Center’s Internet & American Life Project says that 72 percent of U.S. Internet users have gone online in the past year specifically for health-related information, and 77 percent of that group says their research started at Google, Bing or another general search engine.

Eighteen years ago Monday , on June 24 , 1995 , South Africa ’ s Springbok rugby team staged a  thrilling extra-time upset to beat hosts and tournament favourites New Zealand in the final of the 1995 Rugby World Cup . Monday marked 18 years since that incredible day for the South African public when for 80 magical minutes the oppressive cloud of the country's troubled apartheid past was forced to dissipate. But of course the people and the sports played an enormous role in the event becoming such an incredible show of national identity and a unique historical occasion, not only in South Africa but in rugby across the globe.

Harvest season is back, which means it’s time to drive out to the farm stands on the East End of Long Island, but which ones are worth the trip is the question. Press readers voted Briermere Farms Best Farm Stand on Long Island in the 2017 Best of Long Island competition—a title this farm stand has earned for eight years in a row, thanks to their delicious, fresh, local produce. It’s no surprise that Briermere Farms took the top spot once again. Going to Briermere Farms is kind of like going home.

In the age of Instagram, food is no longer designed to just be food. It’s a set piece, a lifestyle statement of fantastical hyperbole. So we drink unicorn lattes, eat rainbow bagels, and lick our charcoal-black soft serve in front of neon signs. Food is no longer about eating. It’s about the documentation of unattainable perfection, catching the next ever-illusive meme. Yet in this new wave of food-as-influencer, there is a single, curmudgeonly brand that insists on photographing its dishes on conference room tables, under fluorescent lighting, and from all sorts of unflattering angles.

New Jersey hits day three of its government shutdown Monday over a budget stalemate that 's closed state parks — 

Day three of the budget stalemate left many without answers. Some furloughed state workers showed up to protest at state Capitol today to support Governor Phil Murphy’s $37.4 billion budget. So far, state Democrats and the Murphy administration has not come to an agreement on issues concerning sales tax and his proposed millionaires tax. Taxpayers have voiced their opinions across the state, while both sides debate their views of tax increases and other miscellaneous policies.

The 35-year-old actor will be playing Geralt of Rivia, a witcher (or male witch) who travels a mythic land known only as “the Continent” hunting horrifying creatures. Spokane and Spokane Valley have something to boast about; a stunning river that flows through like a vein, its banks ripe with history where men and women settled to benefit from the flowing abundance. Now a metropolis, the area often forgets the river; its sound lost to traffic. Still, it flows with the help of three major tributaries: Chamokane Creek, Hangman Creek and the Little Spokane River. The participating artists will display their wares at five locations within minutes of each other and the river.

( Reuters ) - British serviced office space provider IWG Plc said on Wednesday it would close or refurbish some  centers over the coming year as the company was "actively embracing new concepts such as more private office areas, break-out spaces and works-station options." IWG Plc said the centres which would remain open or the newly refurbished spaces would become modern and sustainable with greater digital presence. They would provide flexible workspace solutions catering to the diverse needs of their clients. The move comes amidst shifting trend to offer modern solutions such as hot desking, virtual office and co-working areas, which has emerged in response to the digitalization of businesses.

TOKYO ( Reuters ) - Japan on Wednesday basked in the glow of its World Cup soccer team ’ s  unprecedented success, their victorious run stopped just shy of reaching the title

Civic celebrations are held with several ceremonies and have invited players and national coaches to speak. Crowds flocked the streets with players wearing Japanese team flags, chanting and screaming and the Prime Minister himself turned up to commend and acknowledge their exemplary achievement of clinching the place in the finals for the first time ever. Moreover, Tokyo station was dressed in banners and symbolic greenery were hung.

The thorny question of abortion rights is again taking center stage on Beacon Hill and putting some top officials in  difficult positions. Today's political battle continues to boil around existing restrictions which proponents of expanded abortion access see as hindering personal liberties and individual choices. A study from a couple of years ago had concluded that restrictive laws deprive Massachusetts residents of access to quality, appropriate healthcare, a fact supported by recent data and stories coming out of state. Now, these policy proposals represent new opportunities to improve healthcare outcomes while encouraging everyone in Massachusetts to have the support they need when making decisions around pregnancy.

Millions of refugees have fled their homes in war-torn Syria since 2011 . President Barack Obama previously planned to resettle  10,000 refugees before the end of 2016, however, now the current president, Donald Trump, has made changes and drastically reduced those numbers to only 1000. Many human rights organizations, both local and international, have accused Trump's administration of ignoring the needs of desperate Syrians seeking shelter in other countries, by reducing the proposed resettlement numbers by 90 percent. The lowered quotas also highlights a deepening political polarization surrounding the world refugee crisis.

PENTICTON, British Columbia -- Connor Hellebuyck doesn't want to ruffle any feathers, but he's not planning to concede as a challenger for the Winnipeg Jets goal crease this season. Hellebuyck, 22, will be competing with Ondrej Pavelec and Michael Hutchinson. "I know they have two really good goalies in [Pavelec] and [Hutchinson] right now," Hellebuyck said at the Young Stars Classic tournament. "I'm just going to go out and try to do my thing, get better every day and when it's time, it's time.
